information </P>

<DIV style="width:667.2px"><P style="margin:0px" align=center><BR></P>
<P style="margin:0px" align=center><BR>

<P style="margin:0px"><BR></P>
<P style="margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:12px; font-size:9pt" align=center>5</P>
<P style="margin:0px"><BR></P>
<HR style="margin-bottom:9.6px; padding-top:9.6px" noshade size=1.333>
</DIV><DIV style="width:667.467px"><P style="line-height:14pt; margin-top:12px; 
margin-bottom:0px; padding-right:24px; font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; 
font-size:14pt; color:#7F7F00; page-break-before:always" align=justify><B>ASANKO
GOLD INC.</B><FONT style="font-size:9pt"> </FONT></P>
<P style="line-height:14pt; margin:0px; font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; 
font-size:9pt">NOTES TO THE CONDENSED CONSOLIDATED INTERIM FINANCIAL 
STATEMENTS</P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px; font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; 
font-size:9pt">FOR THE THREE AND SIX MONTHS ENDED JUNE 30, 2016</P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px; font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; 
font-size:9pt">Expressed in Thousands of United States Dollars unless otherwise 
stated</P>
<P style="margin:0px; padding-top:4px; border-top:2px solid #000000"><BR></P>
<P style="margin:0px"><BR></P>
<P style="line-height:14pt; margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:-2px; width:23.8px; 
font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-size:9pt; float:left"><B>1.</B></P>
<P style="line-height:14pt; margin:0px; padding-left:23.8px; padding-right:-
1.133px; text-indent:-2px; font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-size:9pt"
align=justify><B>Nature of operations</B></P>
<P style="line-height:14pt; margin-top:12px; margin-bottom:12px; padding-
left:18.933px; padding-right:-8.333px; font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; 
font-size:9pt; clear:left" align=justify>Asanko Gold Inc. (&#147;Asanko&#148; or
the &#147;Company&#148;) was incorporated on September 23, 1999 under the laws 
of British Columbia, Canada. &nbsp;The Company&#146;s principal project, the 
Asanko Gold Mine (&#147;AGM&#148; or &#147;the Project&#148;), which consists of
two neighboring gold projects, the Obotan Project and the Esaase Project, both 
located in the Amansie West District of the Republic of Ghana 
(&#147;Ghana&#148;), West Africa, is<FONT style="background-color:#FFFFFF"> 
being developed in three distinct phases. &nbsp;January 2016 saw Phase 1 of the 
AGM produce and pour its first gold and on April 1, 2016, the Company declared 
that the AGM was in commercial production. &nbsp;A definitive feasibility study 
is currently being undertaken with respect to Phases 2A and 2B, which together 
form the development of the Esaase deposit.</FONT></P>
<P style="line-height:14pt; margin-top:12px; margin-bottom:12px; padding-
left:18.933px; padding-right:-8.333px; font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; 
font-size:9pt" align=justify>In addition to its principal project, the Company 
holds a portfolio of other Ghanaian gold concessions in various stages of 
exploration.</P>
<P style="line-height:14pt; margin-top:8px; margin-bottom:8px; padding-
left:18.933px; font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-size:9pt" 
align=justify>The head office, principal address and registered and records 
office of the Company are located at 1066 West Hastings Street, Suite 680, 
Vancouver, British Columbia, V6E 3X2, Canada.</P>
<P style="line-height:14pt; margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:-2px; width:24px; 
font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-size:9pt; float:left"><B>2.</B></P>
<P style="line-height:14pt; margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:8px; padding-
left:24px; padding-right:-1.2px; text-indent:-2px; font-family:Calibri,Times New
Roman; font-size:9pt" align=justify><B>Basis of presentation </B></P>
<P style="line-height:14pt; margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:-2px; text-
indent:23.8px; width:47.6px; font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-size:9pt;
clear:left; float:left">(a)</P>
<P style="line-height:14pt; margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:8px; padding-
left:47.6px; text-indent:-2px; font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-
size:9pt">Statement of compliance</P>
<P style="line-height:14pt; margin:0px; padding-left:47.267px; font-
family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-size:9pt; clear:left" align=justify>These 
condensed interim consolidated financial statements have been prepared in 
accordance with International Accounting Standard (&#147;IAS&#148;) 34, 
&#147;Interim Financial Reporting&#148; using accounting policies consistent 
with International Financial Reporting Standards (&#147;IFRS&#148;) as issued by
the International Accounting Standards Board (&#147;IASB&#148;) and 
Interpretations issued by the International Financial Reporting Interpretations 
Committee (&#147;IFRIC&#148;). &nbsp;These condensed consolidated interim 
financial statements do not include all of the necessary annual disclosures in 
accordance with IFRS and should be read in conjunction with the Company&#146;s 
audited consolidated financial statements for the year ended December 31, 
2015.</P>
<P style="line-height:14pt; margin:0px" align=justify><BR></P>
<P style="line-height:14pt; margin:0px; padding-left:47.267px; font-
family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-size:9pt" align=justify>The accounting 
policies followed in these condensed interim consolidated financial statements 
are the same as those applied in the Company&#146;s most recent audited 
consolidated financial statements for the year ended December 31, 2015. 
&nbsp;However, given that the Company declared commercial production at the AGM 
effective April 1, 2016, a number of the Company&#146;s accounting policies are 
being implemented for the first time in the three months ended June 30, 2016 and
as such a full list of the Company&#146;s accounting policies are presented 
herewith. &nbsp;</P>
<P style="line-height:14pt; margin:0px" align=justify><BR></P>
<P style="line-height:14pt; margin:0px; padding-left:47.267px; padding-right:-
1.133px; font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-size:9pt" align=justify>These
condensed consolidated interim financial statements were authorized for issue
and approved by the Board of Directors on August 11, 2016.</P>
<P style="line-height:14pt; margin:0px" align=justify><BR></P>
<P style="line-height:14pt; margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:-2px; text-
indent:23.8px; width:47.6px; font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-size:9pt;
float:left">&nbsp;(b)</P>
<P style="line-height:14pt; margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:8px; padding-
left:47.6px; text-indent:-2px; font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-
size:9pt" align=justify>Basis of presentation and consolidation</P>
<P style="line-height:14pt; margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:8px; padding-
left:48px; padding-right:-1.133px; font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-
size:9pt; clear:left" align=justify>The financial statements have been prepared 
on the historical cost basis, with the exception of the forward currency 
contract liability (note 18(d)(i)) and interest rate floor derivative liability 
(note 18(d)(ii)) which are measured at fair value. </P>
<P style="line-height:14pt; margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:8px; padding-
left:48px; padding-right:-1.2px; font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-
size:9pt" align=justify>All amounts are expressed in thousands of United States 
dollars, unless otherwise stated, and the United States dollar is the functional
currency of the Company and each of its subsidiaries. &nbsp;References to C$ are
to Canadian dollars. &nbsp;Certain prior period numbers have been reclassified 
in order to conform to current year presentation.</P>
<P style="line-height:14pt; margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:8px" 
align=justify><BR></P>
<P style="line-height:14pt; margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:8px" 
align=justify><BR></P>
<P style="margin:0px"><BR></P>
<P style="margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:12px; font-size:9pt" align=center>6</P>
<P style="margin:0px"><BR></P>
<HR style="margin-bottom:9.6px; padding-top:9.6px" noshade size=1.333>
<P style="line-height:14pt; margin-top:12px; margin-bottom:0px; padding-
right:24px; font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-size:14pt; color:#7F7F00; 
page-break-before:always" align=justify><B>ASANKO GOLD INC.</B><FONT 
style="font-size:9pt"> </FONT></P>
<P style="line-height:14pt; margin:0px; font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; 
font-size:9pt">NOTES TO THE CONDENSED CONSOLIDATED INTERIM FINANCIAL 
STATEMENTS</P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px; font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; 
font-size:9pt">FOR THE THREE AND SIX MONTHS ENDED JUNE 30, 2016</P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px; font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; 
font-size:9pt">Expressed in Thousands of United States Dollars unless otherwise 
stated</P>
<P style="margin:0px; padding-top:4px; border-top:2px solid #000000"><BR></P>
<P style="margin:0px"><BR></P>
<P style="line-height:14pt; margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:-2px; width:24px; 
font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-size:9pt; float:left"><B>2.</B></P>
<P style="line-height:14pt; margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:8px; padding-
left:24px; padding-right:-1.2px; text-indent:-2px; font-family:Calibri,Times New
Roman; font-size:9pt" align=justify><B>Basis of presentation (continued)</B></P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:8px; padding-
left:48px; font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-size:9pt; clear:left" 
align=justify>These consolidated financial statements incorporate the financial 
statements of the Company and its controlled subsidiaries. Control exists when 
the Company has power, directly or indirectly, to govern the financial and 
operating policies of an entity as to obtain benefits from its activities. All 
significant intercompany amounts and transactions have been eliminated on 
consolidation. </P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px"><BR></P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px; text-indent:48px; font-
family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-size:9pt">The consolidated financial 
statements include the accounts of the Company and the following subsidiaries: 
</P>

<P style="margin:0px" align=justify><BR></P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px; padding-left:47.267px; font-
family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-size:9pt" align=justify>During the three 
months ended March 31, 2016, the Company transferred the assets related to the 
Obotan project from Adansi Ghana to Asanko Ghana in order to have the two 
neighboring gold projects, Obotan and Esaase (which together form the Asanko 
Gold Mine Project) owned and managed by the same Ghanaian subsidiary. &nbsp;The 
assets include the Abirem, Abore and Adubea mining leases and all of the AGM 
assets. &nbsp;The transfer had no impact on the consolidated position or results
of the Company.</P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px" align=justify><BR></P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:-2px; width:24px; 
font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-size:9pt; float:left"><B>3.</B></P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:8px; padding-
left:24px; padding-right:-1.2px; text-indent:-2px; font-family:Calibri,Times New
Roman; font-size:9pt" align=justify><B>Significant accounting policies</B></P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:-2px; text-
indent:28.4px; width:48px; font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-size:9pt; 
clear:left; float:left">&nbsp;(a)</P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px; text-indent:-2px; font-
family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-size:9pt">Business combinations</P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px; clear:left" align=justify><BR></P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px; padding-left:47.267px; font-
family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-size:9pt" align=justify>Acquisitions of 
subsidiaries and businesses are accounted for using the purchase method. The 
cost of the business combination is measured as the aggregate of the fair value 
at the date of acquisition of the consideration transferred in exchange for the 
interest in the acquiree. &nbsp;The acquiree&#146;s identifiable assets, 
liabilities and contingent liabilities that meet the conditions for recognition 
under IFRS 3 are recognized at their fair values at the acquisition date. 
&nbsp;The acquisition date is the date the Company obtains control over the 
acquiree, which is generally the date that consideration is transferred and the 
Company acquires the assets and assumes the liabilities of the acquiree. The 
Company considers all relevant facts and circumstances in determining the 
acquisition date.</P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px" align=justify><BR></P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px; padding-left:47.267px; font-
family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-size:9pt" align=justify>Acquisition-related
costs, other than costs to issue equity securities, of the acquirer, including 
investment banking fees, legal fees, accounting fees, valuation fees and other 
professional or consulting fees are expensed as incurred. The costs to issue
equity securities of the Company as consideration for the acquisition are 
reduced from share capital as share issue costs.</P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px" align=justify><BR></P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px; padding-left:47.267px; font-
family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-size:9pt" align=justify>Goodwill arising on
acquisition is recognized as an asset and initially measured at cost, being the 
excess of the cost of the business combination over the Company&#146;s interest 
in the net fair value of the identifiable assets, liabilities and contingent 
liabilities recognized. If, after reassessment, the Company&#146;s interest in 
the net fair value of the acquiree&#146;s identifiable assets, liabilities and 
contingent liabilities exceeds the cost of the business combination, the excess 
is recognized immediately in the statement of operations and comprehensive 
income (loss).</P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px" align=justify><BR></P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px" align=justify><BR>
<BR></P>
<P style="margin:0px"><BR></P>
<P style="margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:12px; font-size:9pt" align=center>7</P>
<P style="margin:0px"><BR></P>
<HR style="margin-bottom:9.6px; padding-top:9.6px" noshade size=1.333>
<P style="line-height:14pt; margin-top:12px; margin-bottom:0px; padding-
right:24px; font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-size:14pt; color:#7F7F00; 
page-break-before:always" align=justify><B>ASANKO GOLD INC.</B><FONT 
style="font-size:9pt"> </FONT></P>
<P style="line-height:14pt; margin:0px; font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; 
font-size:9pt">NOTES TO THE CONDENSED CONSOLIDATED INTERIM FINANCIAL 
STATEMENTS</P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px; font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; 
font-size:9pt">FOR THE THREE AND SIX MONTHS ENDED JUNE 30, 2016</P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px; font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; 
font-size:9pt">Expressed in Thousands of United States Dollars unless otherwise 
stated</P>
<P style="margin:0px; padding-top:4px; border-top:2px solid #000000"><BR></P>
<P style="margin:0px"><BR></P>
<P style="line-height:14pt; margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:8px; padding-
left:24px; padding-right:-1.2px; text-indent:-24px; font-family:Calibri,Times 
New Roman; font-size:9pt" align=justify><B>3. &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Significant 
accounting policies (continued)</B></P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:-2px; text-
indent:18px; width:48px; font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-size:9pt; 
float:left">&nbsp;(b)</P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px; padding-left:-0.933px; text-indent:-2px;
font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-size:9pt">Non-controlling interest</P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px; clear:left"><BR></P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px; padding-left:47.267px; font-
family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-size:9pt" align=justify>Non-controlling 
interests in the Company&#146;s less than wholly-owned subsidiaries are 
classified as a separate component of equity. Non-controlling interests are 
recorded at their proportionate share of the fair value of identifiable net 
assets acquired on initial recognition. Subsequent to the acquisition date, 
adjustments are made to the carrying amount of the non-controlling interests for
the non-controlling interests&#146; share of changes to the subsidiary&#146;s 
equity. In the event an arrangement (either contractual or statutory) exists 
between the Company and the non-controlling interest whereby losses and all 
commitments are assumed by the parent entity, then net income is allocated 
between the Company and non-controlling interest on the statement of operations 
and comprehensive income (loss) in accordance with the terms of the arrangement.
</P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px" align=justify><BR></P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px; padding-left:47.267px; font-
family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-size:9pt" align=justify>Changes in the 
Company&#146;s ownership interest in a subsidiary that do not result in a loss 
of control are recorded as equity transactions. The carrying amount of non-
controlling interests is adjusted to reflect the change in the non-controlling
interests&#146; relative interest in the subsidiary and the difference to the 
carrying amount of the non-controlling interests and the Company&#146;s share of
proceeds received and/or consideration paid is recognized in equity and 
attributed to the shareholders of the Company.</P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px"><BR></P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:-2px; text-
indent:28.4px; width:48px; font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-size:9pt; 
float:left">(c)</P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px; text-indent:-2px; font-
family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-size:9pt">Foreign currency translation</P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px; clear:left" align=justify><BR></P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px; padding-left:47.267px; font-
family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-size:9pt" align=justify>Transactions in 
foreign currencies are initially recorded at the functional currency rate of 
exchange at the date of the transaction. </P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px" align=justify><BR></P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px; padding-left:47.267px; font-
family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-size:9pt" align=justify>Monetary assets and
liabilities denominated in foreign currencies are translated at the functional 
currency rate of exchange at the date of the statement of financial position. 
Foreign exchange gains (losses) are recorded in the statement of operations and 
comprehensive income (loss) for the period.</P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px" align=justify><BR></P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px; padding-left:47.267px; font-
family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-size:9pt" align=justify>Non-monetary items 
that are measured in terms of historical cost in a foreign currency are 
translated using the exchange rates as at the dates of the initial transactions.
Non-monetary items measured at fair value in a foreign currency are translated 
using the exchange rates at the date when the fair value is determined.</P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px" align=justify><BR></P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:-2px; text-
indent:28.4px; width:48px; font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-size:9pt; 
float:left">(d)</P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px; padding-left:28.4px; padding-right:-
1.2px; text-indent:-2px; font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-
size:9pt">Cash and cash equivalents</P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px; clear:left" align=justify><BR></P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px; padding-left:47.267px; font-
family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-size:9pt" align=justify>Cash and cash 
equivalents consist of cash on hand and short-term investments with original 
maturity dates of less than ninety days or that are fully redeemable without 
penalty or loss of interest.</P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px" align=justify><BR></P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:-2px; text-
indent:28.4px; width:48px; font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-size:9pt; 
float:left">(e)</P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px; padding-left:28.4px; padding-right:-
1.2px; text-indent:-2px; font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-
size:9pt">Inventories</P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px; clear:left" align=justify><BR></P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px; padding-left:47.267px; font-
family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-size:9pt" align=justify>Gold on hand, gold 
in process and stockpiled ore inventories are recorded at the lower of weighted 
average production cost and net realizable value. Production costs include the 
cost of raw materials, direct labour, mine-site overhead expenses and applicable
depreciation and depletion. Net realizable value is calculated as the estimated 
price at the time of sale based on prevailing and long-term metal prices less 
estimated future costs to convert the inventories from their respective states 
into saleable form less estimated costs to sell.</P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px" align=justify><BR></P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px; padding-left:47.267px; font-
family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-size:9pt" align=justify>Production costs 
are included in work-in-process inventory based on current costs incurred up to 
the point of dore production. The costs of finished goods represents the costs
of work-in-process inventories plus applicable treatment costs. The costs of 
inventories sold during the period are presented as cost of sales in the 
statement of operations and comprehensive income (loss) for the period.</P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px" align=justify><BR>
<BR></P>
<P style="margin:0px"><BR></P>
<P style="margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:12px; font-size:9pt" align=center>8</P>
<P style="margin:0px"><BR></P>
<HR style="margin-bottom:9.6px; padding-top:9.6px" noshade size=1.333>
<P style="line-height:14pt; margin-top:12px; margin-bottom:0px; padding-
right:24px; font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-size:14pt; color:#7F7F00; 
page-break-before:always" align=justify><B>ASANKO GOLD INC.</B><FONT 
style="font-size:9pt"> </FONT></P>
<P style="line-height:14pt; margin:0px; font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; 
font-size:9pt">NOTES TO THE CONDENSED CONSOLIDATED INTERIM FINANCIAL 
STATEMENTS</P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px; font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; 
font-size:9pt">FOR THE THREE AND SIX MONTHS ENDED JUNE 30, 2016</P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px; font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; 
font-size:9pt">Expressed in Thousands of United States Dollars unless otherwise 
stated</P>
<P style="margin:0px; padding-top:4px; border-top:2px solid #000000"><BR></P>
<P style="margin:0px"><BR></P>
<P style="line-height:14pt; margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:8px; padding-
left:24px; padding-right:-1.2px; text-indent:-24px; font-family:Calibri,Times 
New Roman; font-size:9pt" align=justify><B>3. &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Significant 
accounting policies (continued)</B></P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px; padding-left:47.267px; font-
family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-size:9pt" align=justify>The cost of ore 
stockpiles is increased based on the related current cost of production for the 
period, and decreased based on the weighted average cost per tonne of ore in the
stockpile. &nbsp;Stockpiles are segregated between current and non-current 
inventories in the consolidated statement of financial position based on the 
planned period of usage.</P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px" align=justify><BR></P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px; padding-left:47.267px; font-
family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-size:9pt" align=justify>Supplies and spare 
parts are valued at the lower of weighted average cost and net realizable value.
Replacement costs of materials and spare parts are generally used as the best 
estimate of net realizable value. &nbsp;Provisions are recorded to reduce the 
carrying amount of materials and spare parts inventory to net realizable value 
to reflect current intentions for the use of redundant or slow-moving items. 
Provisions for redundant and slow-moving items are made by reference to specific
items of inventory. The Company reverses writedowns where there is a subsequent 
increase in net realizable value and where the inventory is still on hand.</P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px"><BR></P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:-2px; text-
indent:28.4px; width:48px; font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-size:9pt; 
float:left">(f)</P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px; padding-left:28.4px; padding-right:-
1.2px; text-indent:-2px; font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-
size:9pt">Mineral properties, plant and equipment</P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px; clear:left"><BR></P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:-2px; text-
indent:47.267px; width:95.267px; font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-
size:9pt; float:left">(i)</P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px; padding-left:95.267px; text-indent:-2px;
font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-size:9pt">Mineral properties</P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px; clear:left"><BR></P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px; padding-left:47.267px; padding-right:-
1.2px; font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-size:9pt"><I>Recognition 
</I></P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px"><BR></P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px; padding-left:47.267px; padding-right:-
1.2px; font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-size:9pt">Capitalized costs of 
mining properties include the following: </P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px"><BR></P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:-2px; text-
indent:60px; width:84px; font-size:9pt; float:left">-</P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px; padding-left:84px; text-indent:-2px; 
font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-size:9pt" align=justify>Costs assigned
to mining properties acquired in business combinations; </P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:-2px; text-
indent:60px; width:84px; font-size:9pt; clear:left; float:left">-</P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px; padding-left:84px; text-indent:-2px; 
font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-size:9pt" align=justify>Expenditures 
incurred to develop mineral properties including pre-production stripping costs;
</P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:-2px; text-
indent:60px; width:84px; font-size:9pt; clear:left; float:left">-</P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px; padding-left:84px; text-indent:-2px; 
font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-size:9pt" align=justify>Stripping 
costs in the production phase of a mine if certain criteria have been met (see 
below);</P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:-2px; text-
indent:60px; width:84px; font-size:9pt; clear:left; float:left">-</P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px; padding-left:84px; text-indent:-2px; 
font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-size:9pt" align=justify>Costs to 
define and delineate known economic resources and develop the project; </P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:-2px; text-
indent:60px; width:84px; font-size:9pt; clear:left; float:left">-</P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px; padding-left:84px; text-indent:-2px; 
font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-size:9pt" align=justify>Borrowing 
costs attributable to qualifying mining properties; </P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:-2px; text-
indent:60px; width:84px; font-size:9pt; clear:left; float:left">-</P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px; padding-left:84px; text-indent:-2px; 
font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-size:9pt" align=justify>Costs incurred
during testing of the processing facility, net of proceeds from sales, prior to 
operating in the manner intended by management; and </P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:-2px; text-
indent:60px; width:84px; font-size:9pt; clear:left; float:left">-</P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px; padding-left:84px; text-indent:-2px; 
font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-size:9pt" align=justify>Estimates of 
reclamation and closure costs. </P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px; clear:left" align=justify><BR></P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px; padding-left:47.267px; padding-right:-
1.2px; font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-size:9pt"><I>Stripping 
costs</I></P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px"><BR></P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px; padding-left:47.267px; font-
family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-size:9pt" align=justify>In open pit mining 
operations, it is necessary to incur costs to remove overburden and other mine 
waste materials in order to access the ore from which minerals can be extracted 
economically. Stripping costs incurred in order to provide initial access to the
ore body (referred as pre-production stripping) are capitalized as incurred. 
Stripping costs incurred during the production stage of an open pit mine are 
accounted for as production costs during the period that the stripping costs 
were incurred, unless these costs provide a future economic benefit. Production 
phase stripping costs are considered to generate a future economic benefit when 
(i) it is probable that future economic benefit associated with the stripping 
activity will flow to the entity; (ii) the entity can identify the component of 
the ore body for which access has been improved; and (iii) the costs relating to
the stripping activity associated with that component can be measured reliably. 
These costs are capitalized as mine development costs. Production costs are 
allocated between inventory produced and the stripping asset based on the volume
of waste extracted compared with the expected volume, for a given volume of ore 
production. &nbsp;Stripping costs incurred and capitalized during the production
phase are depleted using the units-of-production method over the proven and 
probable reserves of the component of the ore body to which access has been 
improved as a result of the specific stripping activity.</P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px" align=justify><BR></P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px" align=justify><BR>
<BR></P>
<P style="margin:0px"><BR></P>
<P style="margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:12px; font-size:9pt" align=center>9</P>
<P style="margin:0px"><BR></P>
<HR style="margin-bottom:9.6px; padding-top:9.6px" noshade size=1.333>
<P style="line-height:14pt; margin-top:12px; margin-bottom:0px; padding-
right:24px; font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-size:14pt; color:#7F7F00; 
page-break-before:always" align=justify><B>ASANKO GOLD INC.</B><FONT 
style="font-size:9pt"> </FONT></P>
<P style="line-height:14pt; margin:0px; font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; 
font-size:9pt">NOTES TO THE CONDENSED CONSOLIDATED INTERIM FINANCIAL 
STATEMENTS</P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px; font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; 
font-size:9pt">FOR THE THREE AND SIX MONTHS ENDED JUNE 30, 2016</P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px; font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; 
font-size:9pt">Expressed in Thousands of United States Dollars unless otherwise 
stated</P>
<P style="margin:0px; padding-top:4px; border-top:2px solid #000000"><BR></P>
<P style="margin:0px"><BR></P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:-2px; width:28.4px; 
font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-size:9pt; float:left"><B>3.</B></P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px; padding-left:28.4px; text-indent:-2px; 
font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-size:9pt"><B>Significant accounting 
policies (continued)</B></P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px; clear:left" align=justify><BR></P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px; padding-left:47.267px; font-
family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-size:9pt" align=justify><I>Exploration and 
evaluation expenditures</I></P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px" align=justify><BR></P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px; padding-left:47.267px; font-
family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-size:9pt" align=justify>Exploration and 
evaluation expenditures include the costs of acquiring rights to explore, 
exploratory drilling and related exploration costs incurred on sites without an 
existing mine and on areas outside the boundary of a known mineral deposit which
contain proven and probable reserves. &nbsp;Exploration and evaluation 
expenditures incurred on a mineral deposit, with the exception of acquisition 
costs and costs arising from the recognition of an asset retirement obligation, 
are expensed as incurred upto the date of establishing that costs incurred on a 
mineral deposit are technically feasible and commercially viable. </P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px" align=justify><BR></P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px; padding-left:47.267px; font-
family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-size:9pt" align=justify>Expenditures 
incurred on a mineral deposit subsequent to the establishment of being 
technically feasible and commercially viable are capitalized and included in the
carrying amount of the related mining property. </P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px" align=justify><BR></P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px; padding-left:47.267px; font-
family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-size:9pt" align=justify>The technical 
feasibility and commercial viability of a mineral deposit is assessed based on a
combination of factors, such as, but not limited to: </P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px" align=justify><BR></P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:-2px; text-
indent:60px; width:84px; font-size:9pt; float:left">-</P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px; padding-left:84px; text-indent:-2px; 
font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-size:9pt">The extent to which mineral 
reserves or mineral resources have been identified through a feasibility study 
or similar level document;</P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:-2px; text-
indent:60px; width:84px; font-size:9pt; clear:left; float:left">-</P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px; padding-left:84px; text-indent:-2px; 
font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-size:9pt" align=justify>The results of
optimization studies and further technical evaluation carried out to mitigate 
project risks identified in the feasibility study; </P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:-2px; text-
indent:60px; width:84px; font-size:9pt; clear:left; float:left">-</P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px; padding-left:84px; text-indent:-2px; 
font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-size:9pt" align=justify>The status of 
environmental permits, and </P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:-2px; text-
indent:60px; width:84px; font-size:9pt; clear:left; float:left">-</P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px; padding-left:84px; text-indent:-2px; 
font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-size:9pt" align=justify>The status of 
mining leases or permits. </P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px; clear:left" align=justify><BR></P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px; padding-left:47.267px; font-
family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-size:9pt" align=justify><I>Borrowing 
costs</I></P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px" align=justify><BR></P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px; padding-left:47.267px; padding-right:-
1.2px; font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-size:9pt">Borrowing costs 
directly relating to the financing of qualifying assets are added to the 
capitalized cost of those related assets until such time as the assets are 
substantially ready for their intended use or sale which, in the case of mining 
properties, is when they are capable of commercial production. Where funds have 
been borrowed specifically to finance a project, the amount capitalized 
represents the actual borrowing costs incurred. Where the funds used to finance 
a project form part of general borrowings, the amount capitalized is calculated 
using a weighted average of rates applicable to relevant general borrowings of 
the Company during the period. &nbsp;Capitalized borrowing costs are depreciated
over the life of the related asset.</P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px"><BR></P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px; padding-left:47.267px; padding-right:-
1.2px; font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-size:9pt">All other borrowing 
costs are recognized in the statement of operations and comprehensive income 
(loss) in the year in which they are incurred. Borrowing costs are included as 
part of interest paid in the statement of cash flows.</P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px"><BR></P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px"><BR>
<BR></P>
<P style="margin:0px"><BR></P>
<P style="margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:12px; font-size:9pt" align=center>10</P>
<P style="margin:0px"><BR></P>
<HR style="margin-bottom:9.6px; padding-top:9.6px" noshade size=1.333>
<P style="line-height:14pt; margin-top:12px; margin-bottom:0px; padding-
right:24px; font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-size:14pt; color:#7F7F00; 
page-break-before:always" align=justify><B>ASANKO GOLD INC.</B><FONT 
style="font-size:9pt"> </FONT></P>
<P style="line-height:14pt; margin:0px; font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; 
font-size:9pt">NOTES TO THE CONDENSED CONSOLIDATED INTERIM FINANCIAL 
STATEMENTS</P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px; font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; 
font-size:9pt">FOR THE THREE AND SIX MONTHS ENDED JUNE 30, 2016</P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px; font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; 
font-size:9pt">Expressed in Thousands of United States Dollars unless otherwise 
stated</P>
<P style="margin:0px; padding-top:4px; border-top:2px solid #000000"><BR></P>
<P style="margin:0px"><BR></P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:-2px; width:48px; 
font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-size:9pt; float:left"><B>3.</B></P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px; text-indent:-2px; font-
family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-size:9pt"><B>Significant accounting 
policies (continued)</B></P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px; clear:left"><BR></P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px; padding-left:47.267px; padding-right:-
1.2px; font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-size:9pt"><I>Depletion</I></P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px; padding-left:47.267px; padding-right:-
1.2px; font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-size:9pt">Mining properties in 
production are depleted on a mine-by-mine basis using the units-of-production 
method over the mine&#146;s estimated proven and probable reserves, with the 
exception of deferred stripping which is depleted using the unit-of-production 
method over the reserves that directly benefit from the specific stripping 
activity, and will commence when the mine is capable of operating in the manner 
intended by management. The Company uses a number of criteria to assess whether 
the mine is in the condition necessary for it to be capable of operating in a 
manner intended by management. These criteria include, but are not limited 
to:</P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px"><BR></P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:-2px; text-
indent:60px; width:84px; font-size:9pt; float:left">-</P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px; padding-left:84px; text-indent:-2px; 
font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-size:9pt" align=justify>Completion of 
operational commissioning of each major mine and plant component;</P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:-2px; text-
indent:60px; width:84px; font-size:9pt; clear:left; float:left">-</P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px; padding-left:84px; text-indent:-2px; 
font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-size:9pt" align=justify>Demonstrated 
ability to mine and mill consistently and without significant interruption at a 
pre-determined average rate of designed capacity;</P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:-2px; text-
indent:60px; width:84px; font-size:9pt; clear:left; float:left">-</P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px; padding-left:84px; text-indent:-2px; 
font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-size:9pt" align=justify>The passage of
a reasonable period of time for testing of all major mine and plant 
components;</P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:-2px; text-
indent:60px; width:84px; font-size:9pt; clear:left; float:left">-</P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px; padding-left:84px; text-indent:-2px; 
font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-size:9pt" align=justify>Gold 
recoveries at or near expected production levels; and</P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:-2px; text-
indent:60px; width:84px; font-size:9pt; clear:left; float:left">-</P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px; padding-left:84px; text-indent:-2px; 
font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-size:9pt" align=justify>A significant 
portion of available funding is directed towards operating activities.</P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px; clear:left" align=justify><BR></P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px; padding-left:84px; text-indent:-
36.733px; font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-size:9pt" 
align=justify>Mining properties in development are not depleted.</P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px" align=justify><BR></P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:-2px; text-
indent:47.267px; width:95.267px; font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-
size:9pt; float:left">(ii)</P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px; padding-left:95.267px; text-indent:-2px;
font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-size:9pt">Plant and equipment </P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px; clear:left"><BR></P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px; text-indent:47.267px; font-
family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-size:9pt"><I>Recognition</I></P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px"><BR></P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px; padding-left:47.267px; padding-right:-
1.2px; font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-size:9pt">The cost of plant and
equipment consists of the purchase price, costs directly attributable to the 
delivery of the asset to the location and the condition necessary for it to be 
capable of operating in the manner intended by management, including the cost of
testing whether these assets are operating in the manner intended by management.
Subsequent costs are included in the asset&#146;s carrying amount or recognized 
as a separate asset, as appropriate, only when it is probable that future 
economic benefits associated with the item will flow to the Company and the cost
can be measured reliably. Where significant components of an asset have 
differing useful lives, depreciation is calculated on each separate 
component.</P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px"><BR></P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px; padding-left:47.267px; padding-right:-
1.2px; font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-
size:9pt"><I>Depreciation</I></P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px"><BR></P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px; padding-left:47.267px; padding-right:-
1.2px; font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-size:9pt">Depreciation of an 
asset begins when it is available for use, i.e. when it is in the location and 
condition necessary for it to be capable of operating in the manner intended by 
management. &nbsp;</P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px"><BR></P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px; padding-left:47.267px; padding-right:-
1.2px; font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-size:9pt">The carrying amounts 
of plant and equipment are depreciated using either the straight-line or units-
of-production method over the shorter of the estimated useful life of the asset 
or the life of mine. The significant classes of depreciable plant and equipment 
and their estimated useful lives are as follows: </P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px"><BR></P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin-top:0px; margin-right:-336.733px; margin-
bottom:-2px; text-indent:47.267px; width:630px; font-family:Calibri,Times New 
Roman; font-size:9pt; float:left">Fixed plant &amp; related components and 
infrastructure</P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:-2px; width:336.733px;
font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-size:9pt; float:left" 
align=right>Units of production over life of mine </P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin-top:0px; margin-right:-358.4px; margin-
bottom:-2px; text-indent:47.267px; width:630px; font-family:Calibri,Times New 
Roman; font-size:9pt; clear:left; float:left">Mobile and other mine equipment 
components </P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:-2px; width:358.4px; 
font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-size:9pt; float:left" align=right>3 to
8 years </P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin-top:0px; margin-right:-421.733px; margin-
bottom:-2px; text-indent:47.267px; width:630px; font-family:Calibri,Times New 
Roman; font-size:9pt; clear:left; float:left">Computer equipment and 
software</P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:-2px; width:421.733px;
font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-size:9pt; float:left" align=right>3 
years</P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px; clear:left"><BR>
<BR></P>
<P style="margin:0px"><BR></P>
<P style="margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:12px; font-size:9pt" align=center>11</P>
<P style="margin:0px"><BR></P>
<HR style="margin-bottom:9.6px; padding-top:9.6px" noshade size=1.333>
<P style="line-height:14pt; margin-top:12px; margin-bottom:0px; padding-
right:24px; font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-size:14pt; color:#7F7F00; 
page-break-before:always" align=justify><B>ASANKO GOLD INC.</B><FONT 
style="font-size:9pt"> </FONT></P>
<P style="line-height:14pt; margin:0px; font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; 
font-size:9pt">NOTES TO THE CONDENSED CONSOLIDATED INTERIM FINANCIAL 
STATEMENTS</P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px; font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; 
font-size:9pt">FOR THE THREE AND SIX MONTHS ENDED JUNE 30, 2016</P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px; font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; 
font-size:9pt">Expressed in Thousands of United States Dollars unless otherwise 
stated</P>
<P style="margin:0px; padding-top:4px; border-top:2px solid #000000"><BR></P>
<P style="margin:0px"><BR></P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:-2px; width:48px; 
font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-size:9pt; float:left"><B>3.</B></P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px; text-indent:-2px; font-
family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-size:9pt"><B>Significant accounting 
policies (continued)</B></P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px; clear:left"><BR></P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px; padding-left:48px; padding-right:-1.2px;
font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-size:9pt">Management reviews the 
estimated useful lives, residual values and depreciation methods of the 
Company&#146;s plant and equipment at the end of each financial year, and when 
events and circumstances indicate that such a review should be made. Changes to 
estimated useful lives, residual values or depreciation methods resulting from 
such review are accounted for prospectively.</P>
<P style="margin:0px"><BR></P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px; padding-left:47.267px; padding-right:-
1.2px; font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-size:9pt"><I>Major maintenance 
and repairs </I></P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px" align=justify><BR></P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px; padding-left:47.267px; padding-right:-
1.2px; font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-size:9pt">Expenditure on major 
maintenance and repairs includes the cost of replacement parts of assets and 
overhaul costs. Where an asset or part of an asset is replaced and it is 
probable that future economic benefits associated with the item will be 
available to the Company, that expenditure is capitalized and the carrying 
amount of the item replaced derecognized. Similarly, overhaul costs associated 
with major maintenance are capitalized when it is probable that future economic 
benefits will be available and any remaining carrying amounts of the cost of 
previous overhauls are derecognized. All other maintenance and repair costs are 
expensed as incurred.</P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px" align=justify><BR></P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:-2px; text-
indent:47.267px; width:96px; font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-size:9pt;
float:left">(iii) </P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px; padding-left:28.4px; padding-right:-
1.2px; text-indent:-2px; font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-
size:9pt">Assets under construction<B> </B></P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px; clear:left"><BR></P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px; padding-left:47.267px; padding-right:-
1.2px; font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-size:9pt">Assets under 
construction include property, plant and equipment in the course of construction
for the Company&#146;s own purposes. Assets under construction are carried at 
cost less any recognized impairment loss and are not subject to depreciation. 
&nbsp;The cost comprises the purchase price and any costs directly attributable 
to bringing it into working condition for its intended use. &nbsp;Depreciation 
of these assets commences when the asset is available for use, i.e. when it is 
in the location and condition necessary for it to be capable of operating in the
manner intended by management.</P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px" align=justify><BR></P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:-2px; text-
indent:47.267px; width:95.267px; font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-
size:9pt; float:left">(iv)</P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px; padding-left:95.267px; padding-right:-
1.2px; text-indent:-2px; font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-
size:9pt">Impairment of non-financial assets</P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin-top:6px; margin-bottom:0px; padding-
left:47.267px; font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-size:9pt; clear:left" 
align=justify>The carrying amounts of assets included in mining interests are 
reviewed for impairment when events and changes in circumstances indicate that 
the related carrying amounts may not be recoverable. If any such indication 
exists, the recoverable amount of the relevant cash-generating unit 
(&#147;CGU&#148;) is estimated in order to determine the extent of impairment. A
CGU is the smallest identifiable group of assets that generates cash inflows 
that are largely independent of the cash inflows from other assets or groups of 
assets. The Company&#146;s CGUs are its significant mine sites, represented by 
its principal producing mining properties and significant development projects. 
</P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin-top:6px; margin-bottom:0px; padding-
left:47.267px; font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-size:9pt" 
align=justify>The carrying amounts of the CGUs are compared to their recoverable
amounts where the recoverable amount is the higher of value-in-use and fair 
value less costs to sell (&#147;FVLCS&#148;). &nbsp;For mining assets, when a 
binding sale agreement and observable market prices are not readily available, 
FVLCS is estimated using a discounted cash flow approach for each of the 
Company&#146;s cash generating units (CGUs) to which the individual assets are 
allocated. The assumptions used in determining the FVLCS for the CGU&#146;s 
include long-term mining plans, long-term commodity prices, discount rates and 
foreign exchange rates. If the recoverable amount of an asset (or CGU) is 
estimated to be less than its carrying amount, the carrying amount is reduced to
its recoverable amount. An impairment is recognized immediately in the statement
of operations and comprehensive income (loss). </P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin-top:6px; margin-bottom:0px; padding-
left:47.267px; font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-size:9pt" 
align=justify>Where an impairment loss subsequently reverses, the carrying 
amount of the asset (CGU) is increased to the revised estimate of its 
recoverable amount (however, the increased carrying amount shall not exceed the 
net carrying amount that would have been recognized should no impairment loss 
have been recognized for the asset (or CGU) in prior years).</P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px"><BR>
<BR></P>
<P style="margin:0px"><BR></P>
<P style="margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:12px; font-size:9pt" align=center>12</P>
<P style="margin:0px"><BR></P>
<HR style="margin-bottom:9.6px; padding-top:9.6px" noshade size=1.333>
<P style="line-height:14pt; margin-top:12px; margin-bottom:0px; padding-
right:24px; font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-size:14pt; color:#7F7F00; 
page-break-before:always" align=justify><B>ASANKO GOLD INC.</B><FONT 
style="font-size:9pt"> </FONT></P>
<P style="line-height:14pt; margin:0px; font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; 
font-size:9pt">NOTES TO THE CONDENSED CONSOLIDATED INTERIM FINANCIAL 
STATEMENTS</P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px; font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; 
font-size:9pt">FOR THE THREE AND SIX MONTHS ENDED JUNE 30, 2016</P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px; font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; 
font-size:9pt">Expressed in Thousands of United States Dollars unless otherwise 
stated</P>
<P style="margin:0px; padding-top:4px; border-top:2px solid #000000"><BR></P>
<P style="margin:0px"><BR></P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px"><BR></P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:-2px; width:24px; 
font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-size:9pt; float:left"><B>3.</B></P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:8px; padding-
left:24px; padding-right:-1.2px; text-indent:-2px; font-family:Calibri,Times New
Roman; font-size:9pt" align=justify><B>Significant accounting policies 
(continued)</B></P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:-2px; text-
indent:47.267px; width:95.267px; font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-
size:9pt; clear:left; float:left">(v)</P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px; padding-left:95.267px; padding-right:-
1.2px; text-indent:-2px; font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-
size:9pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;Derecognition </P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px; clear:left"><BR></P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px; padding-left:47.267px; padding-right:-
1.2px; font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-size:9pt">Upon disposal or 
abandonment, the carrying amounts of mining properties and plant and equipment 
are derecognized and any associated gains or losses are recognized in the 
statement of operations and comprehensive income (loss).</P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px"><BR></P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:-2px; text-
indent:28.4px; width:48px; font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-size:9pt; 
float:left">(g) </P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px; padding-left:28.4px; padding-right:-
1.2px; text-indent:-2px; font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-
size:9pt">Provisions</P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px; clear:left"><BR></P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px; padding-left:47.267px; padding-right:-
1.2px; font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-size:9pt"><I>General</I></P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px"><BR></P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px; padding-left:47.267px; padding-right:-
1.2px; text-indent:0.733px; font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-
size:9pt">Provisions are recognized when the Company has a present obligation 
(legal or constructive) as a result of a past event, it is probable that an 
outflow of resources embodying economic benefits will be required to settle the 
obligation and a reliable estimate can be made of the amount of the obligation. 
Where the Company expects some or all of a provision to be reimbursed, for 
example under an insurance contract, the reimbursement is recognized as a 
separate asset, but only when the reimbursement is virtually certain. The 
expense relating to any provision is presented in the statement of operations 
and comprehensive income (loss) net of any reimbursement. If the effect of the 
time value of money is material, provisions are discounted using a current pre-
tax rate that reflects where appropriate, the risks specific to the liability. 
Where discounting is used, the increase in the provision due to the passage of 
time is recognized as finance expense in the statement of operations and 
comprehensive income (loss). </P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px"><BR></P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px; padding-left:47.267px; padding-right:-
1.2px; font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-size:9pt"><I>Asset retirement 
provisions</I></P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px" align=justify><BR></P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px; padding-left:47.267px; font-
family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-size:9pt" align=justify>An obligation to 
incur restoration, rehabilitation and environmental costs arises when 
environmental disturbance is caused by the exploration, development or ongoing 
production of a mineral property interest. The Company records the estimated 
present value of future cash flows associated with site reclamation as a 
liability when the liability is incurred with a corresponding increase in the 
carrying value of the related assets. Discount rates using a pre-tax rate that 
reflect the time value of money are used to calculate the net present value. The
liability is accreted over time to reflect the unwinding of the discount with 
the accretion expense included in finance costs in the consolidated statement of
operations and comprehensive income (loss). Changes in estimates or 
circumstances include changes in legal or regulatory requirements, increased 
obligations arising from additional mining and exploration activities, changes 
to cost estimates and changes to the risk-free interest rates.</P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px" align=justify><BR></P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:-2px; text-
indent:24px; width:47.267px; font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-size:9pt;
float:left">(h)</P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px; padding-left:48px; padding-right:-1.2px;
text-indent:-2px; font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-size:9pt">Revenue 
recognition </P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px; clear:left"><BR></P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px; padding-left:47.267px; padding-right:-
1.2px; font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-size:9pt">Revenue is derived 
from the sale of gold and by-products. Revenue is recognized on individual 
contracts when there is persuasive evidence that all of the following criteria 
are met: </P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:-2px; text-
indent:60px; width:84px; font-size:9pt; float:left">-</P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px; padding-left:84px; padding-right:-1.2px;
text-indent:-2px; font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-size:9pt">the 
significant risks and rewards of ownership have been transferred to the buyer; 
</P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:-2px; text-
indent:60px; width:84px; font-size:9pt; clear:left; float:left">-</P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px; padding-left:84px; padding-right:-1.2px;
text-indent:-2px; font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-size:9pt">neither 
continuing managerial involvement to the degree usually associated with 
ownership nor effective control over the goods sold have been retained; </P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:-2px; text-
indent:60px; width:84px; font-size:9pt; clear:left; float:left">-</P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px; padding-left:84px; padding-right:-1.2px;
text-indent:-2px; font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-size:9pt">the amount
of revenue and costs to sell can be measured reliably; </P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:-2px; text-
indent:60px; width:84px; font-size:9pt; clear:left; float:left">-</P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px; padding-left:84px; padding-right:-1.2px;
text-indent:-2px; font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-size:9pt">&nbsp;it 
is probable that the economic benefits associated with the transaction will flow
to the Company and collectability of proceeds is reasonably assured. </P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px; clear:left"><BR></P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px"><BR>
<BR></P>
<P style="margin:0px"><BR></P>
<P style="margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:12px; font-size:9pt" align=center>13</P>
<P style="margin:0px"><BR></P>
<HR style="margin-bottom:9.6px; padding-top:9.6px" noshade size=1.333>
<P style="line-height:14pt; margin-top:12px; margin-bottom:0px; padding-
right:24px; font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-size:14pt; color:#7F7F00; 
page-break-before:always" align=justify><B>ASANKO GOLD INC.</B><FONT 
style="font-size:9pt"> </FONT></P>
<P style="line-height:14pt; margin:0px; font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; 
font-size:9pt">NOTES TO THE CONDENSED CONSOLIDATED INTERIM FINANCIAL 
STATEMENTS</P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px; font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; 
font-size:9pt">FOR THE THREE AND SIX MONTHS ENDED JUNE 30, 2016</P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px; font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; 
font-size:9pt">Expressed in Thousands of United States Dollars unless otherwise 
stated</P>
<P style="margin:0px; padding-top:4px; border-top:2px solid #000000"><BR></P>
<P style="margin:0px"><BR></P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:8px; padding-
left:24px; padding-right:-0.933px; text-indent:-24px; font-family:Calibri,Times 
New Roman; font-size:9pt" align=justify><B>3. &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Significant 
accounting policies (continued)</B></P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px; padding-left:47.267px; padding-right:-
0.933px; font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-size:9pt">Revenue from gold 
is generally recorded at the time of physical delivery of the refined gold, 
which is also the date when title to the gold passes to the customer. 
&nbsp;Revenue from saleable gold produced during the testing phase of production
activities is deducted from capitalized mine development costs. &nbsp;</P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin-top:7.333px; margin-bottom:0px"><BR></P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:-2px; text-
indent:18.933px; width:47.267px; font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-
size:9pt; float:left">(i)</P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px; padding-left:47.267px; text-indent:-2px;
font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-size:9pt">Royalties and mining taxes 
</P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px; clear:left"><BR></P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px; padding-left:47.267px; font-
family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-size:9pt" align=justify>Payments to 
governments that are based on a measure of income less expense are accounted for
in accordance with the Company&#146;s income tax accounting policy. 
&nbsp;Payments to governments which are based on gross amounts such as revenue 
are classified in accordance with the substance of the transaction; this means 
that for royalties calculated based on revenues, the royalty is presented as a 
reduction of revenues and that for royalties calculated based on production 
costs, the royalty is presented as an increase in production costs.</P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px" align=justify><BR></P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:-2px; text-
indent:28.4px; width:48px; font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-size:9pt; 
float:left">(j)</P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px; padding-left:-0.933px; text-indent:-2px;
font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-size:9pt">Financial instruments</P>
<P style=margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:-1pt;font-size:1pt /><P style="line-
height:12pt; margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:-2px; text-indent:47.267px; 
width:66.2px; font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-size:9pt; clear:left; 
float:left">(i)</P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px; text-indent:-2px; font-
family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-size:9pt">Financial assets</P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin-top:8px; margin-bottom:0px; padding-
left:66.133px; font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-size:9pt; clear:left" 
align=justify><I>Recognition</I></P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin-top:8px; margin-bottom:0px; padding-
left:66.133px; font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-size:9pt" 
align=justify>All financial assets are initially recorded at fair value plus 
directly attributable transaction costs and designated upon inception into one 
of four categories: held-to-maturity, available-for-sale, loans and receivables 
or fair value through profit or loss.</P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px" align=justify><BR></P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px; text-indent:66.2px; font-
family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-size:9pt" align=justify>Subsequent to 
initial recognition, the financial assets are measured in accordance with the 
following:</P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px"><BR></P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:-2px; text-
indent:60px; width:84px; font-size:9pt; float:left">-</P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px; padding-left:84px; padding-right:-1.2px;
text-indent:-2px; font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-size:9pt">Held-to-
maturity investments, and loans and receivables, are initially measured at fair 
value and subsequently measured at amortized cost. Amortization of premiums or 
discounts and transaction costs are amortized into net earnings (loss), using 
the effective interest method less any impairment. Cash and cash equivalents and
receivables are classified as loans and receivables.</P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px; clear:left" align=justify><BR></P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:-2px; text-
indent:60px; width:84px; font-size:9pt; float:left">-</P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px; padding-left:84px; padding-right:-1.2px;
text-indent:-2px; font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-size:9pt">Available-
for-sale financial assets are measured at fair value, with unrealized gains and 
losses recorded in other comprehensive income until the asset is derecognized, 
at which time they are reclassified to net earnings (loss). Other than temporary
impairments on available-for-sale financial assets are recorded in net earnings 
(loss).</P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px; clear:left" align=justify><BR></P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:-2px; text-
indent:60px; width:84px; font-size:9pt; float:left">-</P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px; padding-left:84px; padding-right:-1.2px;
text-indent:-2px; font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-size:9pt">Financial 
assets classified as fair value through profit or loss are measured at fair 
value. All gains and losses resulting from changes in their fair value are 
included in net earnings (loss) in the period in which they arise. </P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px; clear:left" align=justify><BR></P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px" align=justify><BR>
<BR></P>
<P style="margin:0px"><BR></P>
<P style="margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:12px; font-size:9pt" align=center>14</P>
<P style="margin:0px"><BR></P>
<HR style="margin-bottom:9.6px; padding-top:9.6px" noshade size=1.333>
<P style="line-height:14pt; margin-top:12px; margin-bottom:0px; padding-
right:24px; font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-size:14pt; color:#7F7F00; 
page-break-before:always" align=justify><B>ASANKO GOLD INC.</B><FONT 
style="font-size:9pt"> </FONT></P>
<P style="line-height:14pt; margin:0px; font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; 
font-size:9pt">NOTES TO THE CONDENSED CONSOLIDATED INTERIM FINANCIAL 
STATEMENTS</P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px; font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; 
font-size:9pt">FOR THE THREE AND SIX MONTHS ENDED JUNE 30, 2016</P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px; font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; 
font-size:9pt">Expressed in Thousands of United States Dollars unless otherwise 
stated</P>
<P style="margin:0px; padding-top:4px; border-top:2px solid #000000"><BR></P>
<P style="margin:0px"><BR></P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:-2px; width:28.4px; 
font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-size:9pt; float:left"><B>3.</B></P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px; padding-left:28.4px; text-indent:-2px; 
font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-size:9pt" align=justify><B>Significant
accounting policies (continued)</B></P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px; clear:left"><BR></P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px; padding-left:12px; text-indent:48px; 
font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-size:9pt"><I>Derecognition </I></P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px"><BR></P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px; padding-left:66.2px; font-
family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-size:9pt">A financial asset (or, where 
applicable, a part of a financial asset or part of a group of similar financial 
assets) is derecognized when: </P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px"><BR></P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:-2px; text-
indent:60px; width:84px; font-size:9pt; float:left">-</P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px; padding-left:84px; padding-right:-1.2px;
text-indent:-2px; font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-size:9pt">The rights
to receive cash flows from the asset have expired, or </P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:-2px; text-
indent:60px; width:84px; font-size:9pt; clear:left; float:left">-</P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px; padding-left:84px; padding-right:-1.2px;
text-indent:-2px; font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-size:9pt">The 
Company has transferred its rights to receive cash flows from the asset or has 
assumed an obligation to pay the received cash flows in full without material 
delay to a third party under a &#145;pass-through &#145;arrangement; and either 
(a) the Company has transferred substantially all the risks and rewards of 
ownership of the asset, or (b) the Company has neither transferred nor retained 
substantially all the risks and rewards of the asset, but has transferred 
control of the asset. </P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px; clear:left" align=justify><BR></P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:-2px; text-
indent:47.267px; width:66.2px; font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; 
float:left"><B>&nbsp;</B><FONT style="font-size:9pt">(ii)</FONT></P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px; padding-left:96px; text-indent:-2px; 
font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-size:9pt">Financial liabilities</P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin-top:8px; margin-bottom:0px; padding-
left:66.133px; font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-size:9pt; clear:left" 
align=justify><I>Recognition</I></P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin-top:8px; margin-bottom:0px" 
align=justify><BR></P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px; padding-left:66.2px; font-
family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-size:9pt" align=justify>All financial 
liabilities are initially recorded at fair value and designated upon inception 
as fair value through profit or loss or other financial liabilities.</P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px" align=justify><BR></P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px; padding-left:66.2px; font-
family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-size:9pt" align=justify>Subsequent to 
initial recognition, other financial liabilities are measured at amortized cost 
using the effective interest method. The effective interest method is a method 
of calculating the amortized cost of a financial liability and of allocating 
interest expense over the relevant period. The effective interest rate is the 
rate that discounts estimated future cash payments through the expected life of 
the financial liability, or, where appropriate, a shorter period. The
Company&#146;s accounts payable and accrued liabilities and long term loan are 
classified as other financial liabilities. &nbsp;</P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px" align=justify><BR></P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px; padding-left:66.2px; font-
family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-size:9pt" align=justify>Fair value changes 
on financial liabilities classified as fair value through profit or loss are 
recognized in the statement of operations and comprehensive income (loss). </P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px" align=justify><BR></P>
<P style=margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:-1pt;font-size:1pt /><P style="line-
height:12pt; margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:-2px; text-indent:47.267px; 
width:94.533px; font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-size:9pt; 
float:left">(vi)</P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px; padding-left:95.267px; padding-right:-
1.2px; text-indent:-2px; font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-size:9pt" 
align=justify>Embedded derivatives</P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin-top:6px; margin-bottom:0px; padding-
left:72px; padding-right:-1.2px; font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-
size:9pt; clear:left" align=justify>The Company may enter into derivative 
contracts or financial instruments and non-financial contracts containing 
embedded derivatives. Embedded derivatives are required to be accounted for 
separately at fair value as derivatives when the risks and characteristics of 
the embedded derivatives are not closely related to those of their host 
contract, and the host contract is not designated as fair value through profit 
or loss. These embedded derivatives are measured at fair value with changes in 
fair value recognized in the statement of operations and comprehensive income 
(loss).</P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px" align=justify><BR>
<BR></P>
<P style="margin:0px"><BR></P>
<P style="margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:12px; font-size:9pt" align=center>15</P>
<P style="margin:0px"><BR></P>
<HR style="margin-bottom:9.6px; padding-top:9.6px" noshade size=1.333>
<P style="line-height:14pt; margin-top:12px; margin-bottom:0px; padding-
right:24px; font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-size:14pt; color:#7F7F00; 
page-break-before:always" align=justify><B>ASANKO GOLD INC.</B><FONT 
style="font-size:9pt"> </FONT></P>
<P style="line-height:14pt; margin:0px; font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; 
font-size:9pt">NOTES TO THE CONDENSED CONSOLIDATED INTERIM FINANCIAL 
STATEMENTS</P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px; font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; 
font-size:9pt">FOR THE THREE AND SIX MONTHS ENDED JUNE 30, 2016</P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px; font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; 
font-size:9pt">Expressed in Thousands of United States Dollars unless otherwise 
stated</P>
<P style="margin:0px; padding-top:4px; border-top:2px solid #000000"><BR></P>
<P style="margin:0px"><BR></P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px" align=justify><BR></P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:8px; padding-right:-
1.2px; font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-size:9pt"><B>3. 
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Significant accounting policies (continued)</B></P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin-top:6px; margin-bottom:0px"><BR></P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:-2px; text-
indent:28.4px; width:47.267px; font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-
size:9pt; float:left">(l) </P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px; text-indent:-2px; font-
family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-size:9pt">Share-based compensation</P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px; clear:left"><BR></P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px; padding-left:47.267px; padding-right:-
1.2px; font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-size:9pt">The fair value of the
share-based compensation awards is determined at the date of grant using the 
Black-Scholes option pricing model. The fair value of the award is charged to 
the statement of operations and comprehensive income (loss) and credited to the 
Equity reserve (within equity in the consolidated statement of financial 
position) rateably over the vesting period, after adjusting for the number of
awards that are expected to vest. </P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px" align=justify><BR></P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px; padding-left:47.267px; padding-right:-
1.2px; font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-size:9pt">Expenses recognized 
for forfeited awards are reversed. For awards that are cancelled, any expense 
not yet recognized is recognized immediately in the statement of operations and 
comprehensive income (loss). </P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px" align=justify><BR></P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px; padding-left:47.267px; padding-right:-
1.2px; font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-size:9pt">Where the terms of an
equity-settled award are modified, as a minimum an expense is recognized as if 
the terms had not been modified over the original vesting period. In addition, 
an expense is recognized for any modification which increases the total fair 
value of the share-based payment arrangement as measured at the date of 
modification, over the remainder of the vesting period. </P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px"><BR></P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:-2px; text-
indent:18.933px; width:47.267px; font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-
size:9pt; float:left">(m) </P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px; text-indent:-2px; font-
family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-size:9pt">Income taxes</P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px; clear:left"><BR></P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px; padding-left:47.267px; padding-right:-
1.2px; font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-size:9pt">Income tax on the 
profit or loss for the periods presented comprises current and deferred income 
tax. Income tax is recognized in the statement of operations and comprehensive 
income (loss) except to the extent that it relates to items recognized directly 
in equity, in which case it is recognized in equity.</P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px"><BR></P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px; padding-left:47.267px; padding-right:-
1.2px; font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-size:9pt">Current income tax 
expense is the expected tax payable on the taxable income for the year, using 
tax rates enacted or substantively enacted at period end, adjusted for 
amendments to tax payable with regards to previous years.</P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px"><BR></P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px; padding-left:48px; font-
family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-size:9pt">Deferred income tax is recognized
in respect of unused tax losses, tax credits and temporary differences between 
the carrying amounts of assets and liabilities for financial reporting purposes 
and the amounts used for taxation purposes. Deferred tax is measured at the tax 
rates that are expected to be applied to temporary differences when they 
reverse, based on the tax rates that have been substantively enacted at the 
reporting date.</P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px"><BR></P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px; padding-left:48px; text-indent:-0.733px;
