font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-size:9pt">&nbsp;A deferred income tax 
asset is recognized only to the extent that it is probable that future taxable 
profits will be available against which the asset can be utilized. To the extent
that the Company does not consider it probable that a future income tax asset 
will be recovered, it does not recognize the asset.</P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px"><BR></P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px; padding-left:48px; padding-right:-1.2px;
font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-size:9pt">Deferred income tax assets 
and liabilities are offset when there is a legally enforceable right to set off 
current tax assets against current tax liabilities and when they relate to 
income taxes levied by the same taxation authority and the Company intends to 
settle its tax assets and liabilities on a net basis.</P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px"><BR></P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px"><BR>
<BR></P>
<P style="margin:0px"><BR></P>
<P style="margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:12px; font-size:9pt" align=center>16</P>
<P style="margin:0px"><BR></P>
<HR style="margin-bottom:9.6px; padding-top:9.6px" noshade size=1.333>
<P style="line-height:14pt; margin-top:12px; margin-bottom:0px; padding-
right:24px; font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-size:14pt; color:#7F7F00; 
page-break-before:always" align=justify><B>ASANKO GOLD INC.</B><FONT 
style="font-size:9pt"> </FONT></P>
<P style="line-height:14pt; margin:0px; font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; 
font-size:9pt">NOTES TO THE CONDENSED CONSOLIDATED INTERIM FINANCIAL 
STATEMENTS</P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px; font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; 
font-size:9pt">FOR THE THREE AND SIX MONTHS ENDED JUNE 30, 2016</P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px; font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; 
font-size:9pt">Expressed in Thousands of United States Dollars unless otherwise 
stated</P>
<P style="margin:0px; padding-top:4px; border-top:2px solid #000000"><BR></P>
<P style="margin:0px"><BR></P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px"><BR></P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:8px; padding-right:-
1.2px; font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-size:9pt"><B>3. 
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Significant accounting policies (continued)</B></P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px; padding-left:48px; padding-right:-1.2px;
font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-size:9pt">The Company records foreign 
exchange gains and losses representing the impacts of movements in foreign 
exchange rates on the tax bases of non-monetary assets and liabilities which are
denominated in foreign currencies. Foreign exchange gains and losses relating to
the translation of the deferred income tax balance from local statutory accounts
to functional currency accounts are included in deferred income tax expense or 
recovery in the statement of operations and comprehensive income (loss).</P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin-top:6.667px; margin-bottom:0px"><BR></P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:-2px; text-
indent:18.933px; width:48px; font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-size:9pt;
float:left">(n)</P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px; padding-left:28.4px; text-indent:-2px; 
font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-size:9pt">Income (loss) per share </P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px; clear:left" align=justify><BR></P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px; padding-left:47.267px; font-
family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-size:9pt" align=justify>Basic income (loss)
per share is computed by dividing net income (loss) by the weighted average 
number of common shares outstanding during the period. The computation of 
diluted income (loss) per share assumes the conversion, exercise or contingent 
issuance of securities only when such conversion, exercise or issuance would 
have a dilutive effect on income (loss) per share. For this purpose, the 
treasury stock method is used for the assumed proceeds upon the exercise of 
stock options and warrants that are used to purchase common shares at the 
average market price during the period.<FONT style="font-size:11pt"><B> 
</B></FONT></P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin-top:6.667px; margin-bottom:0px"><BR></P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:-2px; width:18.933px; 
font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-size:9pt; float:left"><B>4.</B></P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px; padding-left:18.933px; text-indent:-2px;
font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-size:9pt"><B>Significant accounting 
judgements and estimates</B></P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px; clear:left" align=justify><BR></P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px; padding-left:47.267px; font-
family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-size:9pt" align=justify>The preparation of 
financial statements in conformity with IFRS requires management to make 
estimates and assumptions that affect amounts reported in the financial 
statements and accompanying notes. Management believes the estimates and 
assumptions used in these consolidated financial statements are reasonable, 
however, actual results could differ from those estimates and could impact 
future results of operations and cash flows. The Company&#146;s significant 
accounting judgments and estimates were presented in Note 3 of the audited 
annual consolidated financial statements for the year ended December 31, 2015 
and have been consistently applied in the preparation of these condensed interim
consolidated financial statements. New judgements and estimates applied for the 
three and six months ended June 30, 2016 relate to:</P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px" align=justify><BR></P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px; padding-left:47.267px; font-
family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-size:9pt" 
align=justify><B>Estimates</B></P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px" align=justify><BR></P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px; padding-left:74.4px; font-
family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-size:9pt" align=justify><B>Depletion of 
mineral interests &#150; </B>estimates are made of recoverable ounces in the 
Company&#146;s mining properties which are depleted based on recoverable tonnes 
contained in proven and probable reserves.</P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px" align=justify><BR></P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px; padding-left:74.4px; font-
family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-size:9pt" align=justify><B>Inventory 
valuation of production costs </B>- the Company&#146;s management makes 
estimates of quantities of ore on stockpiles and in process and the recoverable 
gold in this material to determine the cost of inventories and the average costs
of finished goods sold during the period.</P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px"><BR></P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px; padding-left:74.4px; font-
family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-size:9pt" align=justify><B>Net realizable 
value of inventory </B>- in order to determine the net realizable value of gold-
in-process and stockpiled ore, the Company estimates future metal selling 
prices, production forecasts, realized grades and recoveries, timing of 
processing, and future costs to convert the respective inventories into saleable
form.</P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px" align=justify><BR></P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px; padding-left:74.4px; font-
family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-size:9pt" align=justify><B>Income taxes 
-</B> in assessing the probability of realizing income tax assets recognized, 
management makes estimates related to expectations of future taxable income, 
applicable tax opportunities, expected timing of reversals of existing temporary
differences and the likelihood that tax positions taken will be sustained upon 
examination by applicable tax authorities.</P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px" align=justify><BR>
<BR></P>
<P style="margin:0px"><BR></P>
<P style="margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:12px; font-size:9pt" align=center>17</P>
<P style="margin:0px"><BR></P>
<HR style="margin-bottom:9.6px; padding-top:9.6px" noshade size=1.333>
<P style="line-height:14pt; margin-top:12px; margin-bottom:0px; padding-
right:24px; font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-size:14pt; color:#7F7F00; 
page-break-before:always" align=justify><B>ASANKO GOLD INC.</B><FONT 
style="font-size:9pt"> </FONT></P>
<P style="line-height:14pt; margin:0px; font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; 
font-size:9pt">NOTES TO THE CONDENSED CONSOLIDATED INTERIM FINANCIAL 
STATEMENTS</P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px; font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; 
font-size:9pt">FOR THE THREE AND SIX MONTHS ENDED JUNE 30, 2016</P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px; font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; 
font-size:9pt">Expressed in Thousands of United States Dollars unless otherwise 
stated</P>
<P style="margin:0px; padding-top:4px; border-top:2px solid #000000"><BR></P>
<P style="margin:0px"><BR></P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:-2px; width:18.933px; 
font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-size:9pt; float:left"><B>4.</B></P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px; padding-left:18.933px; text-indent:-2px;
font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-size:9pt" align=justify><B>Significant
accounting judgements and estimates (continued)</B></P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px; clear:left" align=justify><BR></P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px; padding-left:74.4px; font-
family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-size:9pt" align=justify><B>Deferred 
stripping &#150; </B>in order to<B> </B>determine whether stripping costs 
incurred during the production phase of a mining property relate to reserves and
resources that will be mined in a future period and therefore should be
capitalized, the Company makes estimates of the stripping activity over the life
of the component of reserves and resources which have been made accessible. 
&nbsp;In addition, judgement is involved when allocating production costs 
between inventory produced and the stripping asset; the allocation is based on 
the volume of waste extracted compared with the expected volume, for a given 
volume of ore production.</P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px" align=justify><BR></P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px; padding-left:74.4px; text-indent:-
27.133px; font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-size:9pt" 
align=justify><B>Judgements</B></P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px" align=justify><BR></P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px; padding-left:74.4px; font-
family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-size:9pt" align=justify><B>Arrangements 
containing a lease - </B>the Company&#146;s management assessed it&#146;s mining
contract under IFRIC 4 &#150; Determining whether an Arrangement contains a 
Lease, to assess whether contract contains a finance or operating lease. 
&nbsp;In order to determine whether the lease was an operating or finance lease,
management had to make judgements with respect to the useful economic lives of 
the equipment identified in the lease as well as how much of the costs 
associated with the mining contract related to use of the equipment and how much
related to personnel charges.</P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px" align=justify><BR></P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px; padding-left:74.4px; font-
family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-size:9pt" align=justify><B>Commercial 
production -</B>the Company&#146;s management determined that Phase 1 of the AGM
was in commercial production effective April 1, 2016. &nbsp;The development 
phase ends and the production phase begins when the mine is in the condition 
necessary for it to be capable of operating in a manner intended by management. 
&nbsp;The Company uses a number of criteria to assess whether the mine has 
reached the commercial production phase. &nbsp;These criteria include, but are 
not limited to:</P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px" align=justify><BR></P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:-2px; text-
indent:98.4px; width:146.4px; font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-
size:9pt; float:left">(i)</P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px; padding-left:146.4px; text-indent:-2px; 
font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-size:9pt" align=justify>Completion of 
operational commissioning of each major mine and plant component;</P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:-2px; text-
indent:98.4px; width:146.4px; font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-
size:9pt; clear:left; float:left">(ii)</P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px; padding-left:146.4px; text-indent:-2px; 
font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-size:9pt" align=justify>Demonstrated 
ability to mine and mill consistently and without significant interruption at a 
pre-determined average rate of designed capacity;</P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:-2px; text-
indent:98.4px; width:146.4px; font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-
size:9pt; clear:left; float:left">(iii)</P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px; padding-left:146.4px; text-indent:-2px; 
font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-size:9pt" align=justify>The passage of
a reasonable period of time for testing of all major mine and plant 
components;</P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:-2px; text-
indent:98.4px; width:146.4px; font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-
size:9pt; clear:left; float:left">(iv)</P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px; padding-left:146.4px; text-indent:-2px; 
font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-size:9pt" align=justify>Gold 
recoveries are at or near expected steady-state production levels;</P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:-2px; text-
indent:98.4px; width:146.4px; font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-
size:9pt; clear:left; float:left">(v)</P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px; padding-left:146.4px; text-indent:-2px; 
font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-size:9pt" align=justify>Level of 
capital expenditure is within 90% of the forecast final construction cost;
and</P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:-2px; text-
indent:98.4px; width:146.4px; font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-
size:9pt; clear:left; float:left">(vi)</P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px; padding-left:146.4px; text-indent:-2px; 
font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-size:9pt" align=justify>A significant 
portion of available funding is directed towards operating activities.</P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:8px; clear:left" 
align=justify><BR></P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:8px; padding-
left:23.8px; text-indent:-23.8px; font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-
size:9pt" align=justify><B>5. &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Revenue</B></P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:8px; padding-
left:23.8px; text-indent:-4.867px; font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-
size:9pt" align=justify>&nbsp;&nbsp;The Company sold 35,074 and 43,783 ounces of
gold to Red Kite during the three and six months ended June 30, 2016, 
respectively, in accordance with an Offtake Agreement (Note 11 (c)). &nbsp;Sales
proceeds earned in the first quarter of 2016, prior to the commencement of 
commercial production, were recorded as an offset to pre-commercial production 
costs and included in development costs (Note 10 (b)). &nbsp;&nbsp;Sales 
proceeds earned in the three months ended June 30, 2016 were included in revenue
in the statement of operations and comprehensive loss.</P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:8px; font-
family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-size:9pt" 
align=justify>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Included in 
revenue is $0.2 million relating to by-product silver sales in the three and six
months ended June 30, 2016.</P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin-top:8px; margin-bottom:10.667px; padding-
right:-1.2px; font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-size:9pt" 
align=justify>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;All of the 
Company&#146;s concessions are also subject to a 5% gross revenue royalty 
payable to the Government of Ghana<FONT style="font-size:12pt">.</FONT></P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin-top:8px; margin-bottom:10.667px" 
align=justify><BR></P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:-2px; text-indent:-
4.867px; width:18.933px; font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-size:9pt; 
float:left"><B>6. </B></P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:8px; padding-
left:18.933px; text-indent:-2px; font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-
size:9pt" align=justify><B>Income tax</B></P>
<P style="line-height:14pt; margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:8px; padding-
left:18.933px; font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-size:9pt; clear:left" 
align=justify>Accelerated tax depreciation as a result of Phase 1 of the AGM 
reaching commerical production has resulted in a deferred tax expense of $5.6 
million in the three and six months ended June 30, 2016.</P>
<P style="line-height:14pt; margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:8px" 
align=justify><BR></P>
<P style="margin:0px"><BR></P>
<P style="margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:12px; font-size:9pt" align=center>18</P>
<P style="margin:0px"><BR></P>

<P style="line-height:14pt; margin:0px; font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman;

<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px; font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; 
font-size:9pt">FOR THE THREE AND SIX MONTHS ENDED JUNE 30, 2016</P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px; font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman;

<P style="margin:0px"><BR></P>

<P style="line-height:12pt; margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:8px" 
align=justify><BR></P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:8px; padding-
left:23.8px; text-indent:-23.8px; font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-
size:9pt" align=justify><B>8. &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;VAT receivable</B></P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:8px; padding-
left:23.8px; font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-size:9pt" 
align=justify>On April 1, 2016, the Company announced that the AGM was in 
commercial production and in addition, in April 2016, the Company received a 
letter from the Ghana Revenue Agency stating that the Company was entitled to a 
VAT refund to a total of $20.5 million with respect to the period July 2013 to 
December 2015. &nbsp;The Company considers these two events to be key triggers 
with respect to the recognition of all VAT receivable on the purchase of goods 
and services in Ghana. &nbsp;As such, in the Company&#146;s March 31, 2016 
financial statements it recognized a VAT receivable with respect to the amount 
confirmed as receivable from the Ghana Revenue Agency. &nbsp;Effective April 1, 
2016, with the commencement of commercial production, the Company recognizes a 
long-term VAT receivable for the total of all VAT returns filed with the Ghana 
Revenue Agency. &nbsp;Prior to March 31, 2016, the Company had provided a full 
allowance against the VAT receivable with an offsetting charge to deferred 
development costs. &nbsp;The Company has commenced a stakeholder engagement 
program in Ghana in order to start the refund process as soon as possible and 
has received refunds of $5.7 million as of June 30, 2016. </P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:8px; padding-
left:23.8px; font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-size:9pt" 
align=justify>As of June 30, 2016 a total VAT receivable of $29.2 million has 
been recognized. &nbsp;</P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:8px; padding-
left:23.8px; text-indent:-23.8px; font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-
size:9pt" align=justify><B>9. &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Reclamation deposit</B></P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:8px; padding-
left:18.933px; padding-right:-1.2px; text-indent:-5.067px; font-
family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-size:9pt" align=justify>&nbsp;&nbsp;The 
Company is required to provide security to the Environmental Protection Agency 
of Ghana (&#147;EPA&#148;), for the performance by the Company of its 
reclamation obligations in respect of the Abriem, Abore and Adubea mining 
leases. &nbsp;The initial security totaled $8.5 million and was made up of a 
Reclamation Deposit in the amount of $1.7 million and a bank guarantee of $6.8 
million. &nbsp;&nbsp;The reclamation deposit accrues interest and is carried at 
$1.8 million.</P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:8px; padding-
left:18.933px; padding-right:-1.2px; font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-
size:9pt" align=justify>During the year ended December 31, 2015 the Company 
deposited the Reclamation Deposit in a Ghanaian Bank in the joint names of the 
Company and the EPA. The Reclamation Deposit matures annually, but the Company 
is required to reinstate the deposit until receiving the final completion 
certificate by the EPA. The Company is expected to be released from this 
requirement 45 days following the third anniversary of the date the Company 
receives a final completion certificate.</P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:8px"
align=justify><BR></P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:8px" 
align=justify><BR>
<BR></P>
<P style="margin:0px"><BR></P>
<P style="margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:12px; font-size:9pt" align=center>19</P>
<P style="margin:0px"><BR></P>
<HR style="margin-bottom:9.6px; padding-top:9.6px" noshade size=1.333>
<P style="line-height:14pt; margin-top:12px; margin-bottom:0px; padding-
right:24px; font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-size:14pt; color:#7F7F00; 
page-break-before:always" align=justify><B>ASANKO GOLD INC.</B><FONT 
style="font-size:9pt"> </FONT></P>
<P style="line-height:14pt; margin:0px; font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; 
font-size:9pt">NOTES TO THE CONDENSED CONSOLIDATED INTERIM FINANCIAL 
STATEMENTS</P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px; font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; 
font-size:9pt">FOR THE THREE AND SIX MONTHS ENDED JUNE 30, 2016</P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px; font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; 
font-size:9pt">Expressed in Thousands of United States Dollars unless otherwise 
stated</P>
<P style="margin:0px; padding-top:4px; border-top:2px solid #000000"><BR></P>
<P style="margin:0px"><BR></P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:8px; padding-

family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-size:9pt" align=justify><B>10. 
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Mineral properties, plant and equipment</B></P>
<P style="margin:0px"><BR></P>

<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px" align=justify><BR></P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px; padding-left:18.933px; padding-right:-
3.533px; font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-size:9pt" 
align=justify>Depreciation and depletion for the three and six months ended June
30, 2016 includes $9 and $13 (2015 - $11 and $37) of depreciation included in 
general and administrative expenses.</P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px" align=justify><BR></P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:-2px; text-
indent:18.933px; width:48px; font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-size:9pt;
float:left">&nbsp;(a) </P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:8px; padding-
left:18.933px; padding-right:-0.933px; text-indent:-2px; font-
family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-size:9pt" align=justify>Mineral interests 
and plant, buildings and equipment</P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px; padding-left:47.267px; padding-right:-
1.2px; font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-size:9pt; 
clear:left">Depletable mineral interests consist of Phase 1 of the AGM, while 
non-depletable mineral interests primarily consist of Phase 2 of the AGM.</P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px" align=justify><BR></P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px; padding-left:47.267px; padding-right:-
1.2px; font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-size:9pt">Production began in 
January 2016 at Phase 1 of the AGM and on April 1, 2016 commercial production 
was declared. &nbsp;During the second quarter 2016, construction of Phase 1 of 
the AGM was completed and as a result all balances previously held as Assets 
under construction have been transferred to Plant, buildings &amp; equipment and
such assets commenced depletion. &nbsp;Effective April 1, 2016 all depletable 
mineral interests commence depletion on a units-of-production basis. </P>
<P style="margin:0px"><BR></P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:8px" 
align=justify><BR>
<BR></P>
<P style="margin:0px"><BR></P>
<P style="margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:12px; font-size:9pt" align=center>20</P>
<P style="margin:0px"><BR></P>
<HR style="margin-bottom:9.6px; padding-top:9.6px" noshade size=1.333>
<P style="line-height:14pt; margin-top:12px; margin-bottom:0px; padding-
right:24px; font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-size:14pt; color:#7F7F00; 
page-break-before:always" align=justify><B>ASANKO GOLD INC.</B><FONT 
style="font-size:9pt"> </FONT></P>
<P style="line-height:14pt; margin:0px; font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; 
font-size:9pt">NOTES TO THE CONDENSED CONSOLIDATED INTERIM FINANCIAL 
STATEMENTS</P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px; font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; 
font-size:9pt">FOR THE THREE AND SIX MONTHS ENDED JUNE 30, 2016</P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px; font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; 
font-size:9pt">Expressed in Thousands of United States Dollars unless otherwise 
stated</P>
<P style="margin:0px; padding-top:4px; border-top:2px solid #000000"><BR></P>
<P style="margin:0px"><BR></P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:8px; padding-
left:18.933px; padding-right:-1.2px; text-indent:-18.933px; font-
family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-size:9pt" align=justify><B>10. 
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Mineral properties, plant and equipment (continued)</B></P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px" align=justify><BR></P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:-2px; text-
indent:18.933px; width:47.267px; font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-
size:9pt; float:left">(b)</P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px; padding-left:18.933px; text-indent:-2px;
font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-size:9pt" align=justify>Pre-commercial
production costs</P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin-top:6px; margin-bottom:6px; padding-
left:48px; font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-size:9pt; 
clear:left">During the pre-commerical production period, the Company capitalized
the costs incurred for pre-commercial production mining, processing and support 
operations offset by the revenue from gold sales (net of royalties). &nbsp;A 
summary of the costs and revenues is provided below. &nbsp;Effective April 1, 
2016 all such deferred development costs were transferred to mineral interests. 
&nbsp;</P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:6px"><BR></P>

</TD></TR>
<TR><TD style="margin-top:0px" valign=top width=49><P style="margin:0px;

</TD></TR>

</TD><TD style="margin-top:0px" width=180><P style="margin:0px; font-

</TD></TR>
<TR><TD style="margin-top:0px" valign=top width=49><P style="margin:0px; 
padding:0px; font-size:9pt">&nbsp;</P></TD><TD style="margin-top:0px; border-
top:1px solid #000000; border-bottom:1.333px solid #000000" width=372><P 
style="margin:0px; font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-size:8pt"><B>Net 
costs deferred to development assets</B></P>
</TD><TD style="margin-top:0px; border-top:1px solid #000000; border-
bottom:1.333px solid #000000" width=180><P style="margin:0px; font-
family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-size:8pt" align=right><B>11,174</B></P>
</TD></TR>
</TABLE>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:8px" 
align=justify><BR></P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:-2px; text-
indent:18.933px; width:47.267px; font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-
size:9pt; float:left">(c)</P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px; padding-left:18.933px; text-indent:-2px;
font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-size:9pt" align=justify>Deferred 
stripping</P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin-top:6.667px; margin-bottom:0px; padding-
left:47.267px; text-indent:0.733px; font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-
size:9pt; clear:left">During the three months ended June 30, 2016, the Company 
deferred a total of $12.1 million (2015 - $nil) of stripping costs to depletable
mineral interests. &nbsp;Depletion of $0.6 million (2015 - $nil) was charged on 
this asset during the same period and was recorded in production costs.</P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px" align=justify><BR></P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px" align=justify><BR></P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:-2px; text-
indent:18.933px; width:47.267px; font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-
size:9pt; float:left">(d)</P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px; padding-left:18.933px; text-indent:-2px;
font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-size:9pt" align=justify>Non-
controlling interest </P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px; clear:left" align=justify><BR></P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px; padding-left:48px; padding-right:-3.4px;
font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-size:9pt" align=justify>The AGM is 
wholly-owned by Asanko Ghana. &nbsp;The Government of Ghana holds a 10% free 
carried interest in the subsidiary which owns the AGM (Asanko Ghana). 
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;At June 30, 2016, no amount has been recorded as non-
controlling interest as Asanko Ghana has a net equity deficiency and the 
Government of Ghana has no obligation with respect to the cumulative losses in 
Asanko Ghana.</P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:8px" 
align=justify><BR></P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin-top:6px; margin-bottom:8px" 
align=justify><BR>
<BR></P>
<P style="margin:0px"><BR></P>
<P style="margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:12px; font-size:9pt" align=center>21</P>
<P style="margin:0px"><BR></P>

</TD><TD style="margin-top:0px; border-bottom:1.333px solid #000000"

<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px" align=justify><BR></P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px; padding-left:18.933px; padding-right:-
3.4px; font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-size:9pt" align=justify>In 
2013, the Company entered into a Definitive Senior Facilities Agreement 
(&#147;DSFA&#148;) with a special purpose vehicle of RK Mine Finance Trust I 
(&#147;Red Kite&#148;), which is now fully drawn for a total of $150 million. 
&nbsp;Interest on the DFSA is calculated on a quarterly basis at a rate of LIBOR
+6% and there is a 1% minimum LIBOR rate which creates an interest rate floor. 
The Company can elect to repay the DSFA, or a portion thereof, early without 
penalty. &nbsp;The DSFA is fully secured by shares of the Company&#146;s 
Ghanaian subsidiaries. &nbsp;The loan is carried at amortized cost on the 
statement of financial position. &nbsp;</P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px" align=justify><BR></P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px; padding-left:18.933px; padding-right:-
3.4px; font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-size:9pt" align=justify>During 
the second quarter 2016, the DSFA was amended in order to defer the repayment of
the principal for two years (being the principal deferral period). The amendment
provides that the first principal repayment will now be payable on July 1, 2018 
after which the facility will be repaid in nine equal quarterly instalments, 
with the last repayment on July 1, 2020. The Company will continue to pay 
quarterly interest on the loan facility during the principal deferral period 
with the first interest payment due on July 1, 2016; this first interest payment
of $2.9 million was made on June 30, 2016. There are no other changes to the 
existing debt facility terms. A deferral fee of 2% of the loan principal was 
paid commensurate with signing the amendment. &nbsp;The amendments are 
considered to be a modification of the previous DFSA; the deferral fee of $3.275
million was paid during the second quarter 2016 and has been deferred to the 
loan balance and is being amortized with previously deferred debt financing 
costs over the remaining life of the DSFA based on the revised effective 
interest rate of 10.97%. &nbsp;</P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px" align=justify><BR></P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px; padding-left:18.933px; padding-right:-
3.4px; font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-size:9pt" align=justify>Prior 
to April 1, 2016 all interest and accretion costs were capitalized to assets 
under construction. &nbsp;Commensurate with the declaration of commercial 
production all interest and accretion costs are now charged to the statement of 
operations and comprehensive income (loss). &nbsp;During the three and six 
months ended June 30, 2016, $4.0 million and $8.0 million, respectively, (three 
and six months ended June 30, 2015 - $2.0 million and $4.0 million) of loan 
accretion and accrued interest was recorded at a weighted average effective 
interest rate of approximately 10.97%. &nbsp;&nbsp;Of this balance, during the 
three and six months ended June 30, 2016, a total of $nil and $4.0 million, 
respectively, (three and six months ended June 30, 2015 - $2.7 million and $4.0 
million) were capitalized to assets under construction.</P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px" align=justify><BR></P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px" align=justify><BR>
<BR></P>
<P style="margin:0px"><BR></P>
<P style="margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:12px; font-size:9pt" align=center>22</P>
<P style="margin:0px"><BR></P>
<HR style="margin-bottom:9.6px; padding-top:9.6px" noshade size=1.333>
<P style="line-height:14pt; margin-top:12px; margin-bottom:0px; padding-
right:24px; font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-size:14pt; color:#7F7F00; 
page-break-before:always" align=justify><B>ASANKO GOLD INC.</B><FONT 
style="font-size:9pt"> </FONT></P>
<P style="line-height:14pt; margin:0px; font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; 
font-size:9pt">NOTES TO THE CONDENSED CONSOLIDATED INTERIM FINANCIAL 
STATEMENTS</P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px; font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; 
font-size:9pt">FOR THE THREE AND SIX MONTHS ENDED JUNE 30, 2016</P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px; font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; 
font-size:9pt">Expressed in Thousands of United States Dollars unless otherwise 
stated</P>
<P style="margin:0px; padding-top:4px; border-top:2px solid #000000"><BR></P>
<P style="margin:0px"><BR></P>
<P style=margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:-1pt;font-size:1pt /><P style="line-
height:12pt; margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:-2px; text-indent:0.267px; 
width:19.2px; font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-size:9pt; 
float:left"><B>11. </B></P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:8px; padding-
left:19.2px; padding-right:-1.133px; text-indent:-2px; font-family:Calibri,Times
New Roman; font-size:9pt" align=justify><B>Long-term debt (continued)</B></P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px; clear:left" align=justify><BR></P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin-top:10px; margin-bottom:0px; padding-
left:19.2px; padding-right:-7.2px; font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-
size:9pt" align=justify><B>&nbsp;</B>(b) Embedded derivative</P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px" align=justify><BR></P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px; padding-left:18.933px; padding-right:-
3.4px; font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-size:9pt" align=justify>An 
embedded derivative liability has been recognized for the loan in relation to 
the interest rate floor. The fair value of the embedded derivative on drawdowns 
was estimated to be $1.4 million (note 18 (d)(ii)). &nbsp;The embedded 
derivative liability was revalued at June 30, 2016 at $1.8 million with the 
change in fair value since previous reporting dates recognized in the statement 
of operations and comprehensive income (loss).</P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px" align=justify><BR></P>
<TABLE style="margin-top:0px; font-size:10pt" cellpadding=0 cellspacing=0><TR 
height=0 style="font-size:0"><TD width=663.8 /></TR>
<TR><TD style="margin-top:0px" valign=top width=663.8><P style="line-
height:12pt; margin:0px; padding-right:-7.2px; text-indent:-16.667px; font-
family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-size:9pt" align=justify>8</P>
</TD></TR>
</TABLE>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px; text-indent:23.8px; font-
family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-size:9pt" align=justify>(c) Offtake 
agreement</P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px" align=justify><BR></P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px; padding-left:18.933px; padding-right:-
3.4px; font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-size:9pt" 
align=justify>&nbsp;In addition to the DSFA the Company entered into an Offtake 
Agreement with Red Kite with the following details:</P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:-2px; text-
indent:60px; width:84px; font-size:9pt; float:left">-</P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px; padding-left:84px; padding-right:-3.4px;
text-indent:-2px; font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-size:9pt" 
align=justify>Sale of 100% of the future gold production up to a maximum of 2.22
million ounces to Red Kite;</P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:-2px; text-
indent:60px; width:84px; font-size:9pt; clear:left; float:left">-</P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px; padding-left:84px; padding-right:-3.4px;
text-indent:-2px; font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-size:9pt" 
align=justify>Red Kite to pay for 100% of the value of the gold ten business 
days after shipment;</P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:-2px; text-
indent:60px; width:84px; font-size:9pt; clear:left; float:left">-</P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px; padding-left:84px; padding-right:-3.4px;
text-indent:-2px; font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-size:9pt" 
align=justify>A provisional payment of 90% of the estimated value will be made 
one business day after delivery; </P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:-2px; text-
indent:60px; width:84px; font-size:9pt; clear:left; float:left">-</P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px; padding-left:84px; padding-right:-3.4px;
text-indent:-2px; font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-size:9pt" 
align=justify>The gold sale price will be a spot price selected during a nine 
day quotational period following shipment of gold from the mine; and</P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:-2px; text-
indent:60px; width:84px; font-size:9pt; clear:left; float:left">-</P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px; padding-left:84px; padding-right:-3.4px;
text-indent:-2px; font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-size:9pt" 
align=justify>Should the Company wish to terminate the Offtake Agreement, a 
termination fee will be payable according to a schedule dependent upon the total
funds drawn under the DSFA as well as the amount of gold delivered under the 
Offtake Agreement at the time of termination. &nbsp;</P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px; clear:left" align=justify><BR></P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px; padding-right:-3.4px; font-
family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-size:9pt" align=justify>As of June 30, 
2016, 43,783 ounces have been delivered to Red Kite under the offtake 
agreement.</P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px" align=justify><BR></P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:-2px; width:48px; 
font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-size:9pt; float:left"><B>12.</B></P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px; text-indent:-2px; font-
family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-size:9pt"><B>Share capital</B></P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px; clear:left"><BR></P>
<P style=margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:-1pt;font-size:1pt /><P style="line-
height:12pt; margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:-2px; text-indent:24px; width:48px; 
font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-size:9pt; float:left">(a)</P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px; padding-left:24px; padding-right:-
0.933px; text-indent:-2px; font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-size:9pt" 
align=justify>Authorized</P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px; padding-left:72px; padding-right:-1.2px;
font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-size:9pt; clear:left" 
align=justify>Unlimited common shares without par value; and</P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin-top:1px; margin-bottom:0px; padding-
left:72px; padding-right:-1.2px; font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-
size:9pt" align=justify>Unlimited preferred shares without par value</P>
<P style=margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:-1pt;font-size:1pt /><P style="line-

<P style="margin:0px"><BR></P>
<HR style="margin-bottom:9.6px; padding-top:9.6px" noshade size=1.333>
<P style="line-height:14pt; margin-top:12px; margin-bottom:0px; padding-
right:24px; font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-size:14pt; color:#7F7F00; 
page-break-before:always" align=justify><B>ASANKO GOLD INC.</B><FONT 
style="font-size:9pt"> </FONT></P>
<P style="line-height:14pt; margin:0px; font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; 
font-size:9pt">NOTES TO THE CONDENSED CONSOLIDATED INTERIM FINANCIAL 
STATEMENTS</P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px; font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; 
font-size:9pt">FOR THE THREE AND SIX MONTHS ENDED JUNE 30, 2016</P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px; font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; 
font-size:9pt">Expressed in Thousands of United States Dollars unless otherwise 
stated</P>
<P style="margin:0px; padding-top:4px; border-top:2px solid #000000"><BR></P>
<P style="margin:0px"><BR></P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:-2px; width:48px; 
font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-size:9pt; float:left"><B>12.</B></P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px; text-indent:-2px; font-
family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-size:9pt"><B>Share capital
(continued)</B></P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin-top:6px; margin-bottom:0px; padding-
left:24px; padding-right:-0.933px; font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-
size:9pt; clear:left" align=justify>(i) On February 11, 2015, the Company closed
a bought deal financing of 22,770,000 common shares at C$2.02 for gross proceeds
$36.4 million or C$46.0 million. The Company incurred share issuance costs of 
$2.1 million, of which $1.8 million in fees were paid to the underwriters. 
&nbsp;&nbsp;</P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px"><BR></P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:-2px; width:28.4px; 
font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-size:9pt; float:left"><B>13.</B></P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px; text-indent:-2px; font-
family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-size:9pt"><B>Equity reserves</B></P>
<P style=margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:-1pt;font-size:1pt /><P style="line-
height:12pt; margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:-2px; text-indent:24px; width:48px; 
font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-size:9pt; clear:left; 
float:left">(a)</P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:8px; padding-
left:48px; padding-right:-0.933px; text-indent:-2px; font-family:Calibri,Times 
New Roman; font-size:9pt" align=justify>Share-based options</P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin-top:6px; margin-bottom:12px; padding-
left:48px; padding-right:-0.933px; font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-
size:9pt; clear:left" align=justify>The Company maintains a rolling share-based 
option plan providing for the issuance of share-based options for up to 10% of 
the Company&#146;s issued and outstanding common shares. The Company may grant 
options from time to time to its directors, officers, employees and other 
service providers. The options vest 25% on the date of the grant and 12.5 % 
every three months thereafter for a total vesting period of 18 months. </P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin-top:6px; margin-bottom:12px; padding-
left:48px; padding-right:-0.933px; font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-
size:9pt" align=justify>The following table is a reconciliation of the movement 
in share-based options for the period:</P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin-top:6px; margin-bottom:0px" 
align=justify><BR></P>

<DIV style="width:667.467px"><P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px"><BR></P>
<P style=margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:-1pt;font-size:1pt /><P style="line-
height:12pt; margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:-2px; text-indent:24px; width:48px; 
font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-size:9pt; float:left">&nbsp;(b)</P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px; padding-left:48px; padding-right:-
0.933px; text-indent:-2px; font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-size:9pt" 
align=justify>Warrants </P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin-top:6px; margin-bottom:0px; padding-
left:48px; padding-right:-0.933px; font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-
size:9pt; clear:left" align=justify>On December 21, 2015, the Company issued 
4,000,000 share purchase warrants to Red Kite in conjunction with the drawdown 
of the $20.0 million Overrun Facility (note 11). The warrants have an exercise 
price of $1.83 and expire three years from the date of issuance. All of these 
warrants remain outstanding as of June 30, 2016.</P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin-top:6px; margin-bottom:0px; padding-
left:48px; padding-right:-0.933px; font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-
size:9pt" align=justify>A total of 126,000 warrants with an exercise price of 
C$5.00 expired in September 2015.</P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin-top:6px; margin-bottom:0px" 
align=justify><BR></P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:-2px; width:24px; 
font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-size:9pt; float:left"><B>14.</B></P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px; padding-right:-1.2px; text-indent:-2px; 
font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-size:9pt" align=justify><B>Commitments
and contractual obligations</B></P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin-top:6px; margin-bottom:0px; padding-
left:24px; padding-right:-0.933px; font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-
size:9pt; clear:left" align=justify>As at June 30, 2016, the Company had 
contractual obligations totaling $195.6 million, relating to long-term debt 
(December 31, 2015 - $185.5 million). Contractual obligations related to the 
long-term debt are subject to changes in the three-month LIBOR rate. Prepayment 
terms allow the Company to prepay the long-term debt, with no penalty, in whole 
or in part at any time. As at June 30, 2016 the long-term debt had a face value 
of $163.7 million (December 31, 2015 - $159.5 million).</P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin-top:6px; margin-bottom:0px; padding-
left:24px; padding-right:-0.933px; font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-
size:9pt" align=justify>In addition, the Company has entered into certain 
construction and engineering contracts relating to the construction of the 
Asanko Gold Mine Phase 1. </P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin-top:6px; margin-bottom:0px; padding-
left:24px; padding-right:-0.933px; font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-
size:9pt" align=justify>The following table shows the Company&#146;s contractual
obligations as they fall due as at June 30, 2016: </P>

<P style="margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:12px; font-size:9pt" align=center>25</P>
<P style="margin:0px"><BR></P>
<HR style="margin-bottom:9.6px; padding-top:9.6px" noshade size=1.333>
<P style="line-height:14pt; margin-top:12px; margin-bottom:0px; padding-
right:24px; font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-size:14pt; color:#7F7F00; 
page-break-before:always" align=justify><B>ASANKO GOLD INC.</B><FONT 
style="font-size:9pt"> </FONT></P>
<P style="line-height:14pt; margin:0px; font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; 
font-size:9pt">NOTES TO THE CONDENSED CONSOLIDATED INTERIM FINANCIAL 
STATEMENTS</P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px; font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; 
font-size:9pt">FOR THE THREE AND SIX MONTHS ENDED JUNE 30, 2016</P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px; font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; 
font-size:9pt">Expressed in Thousands of United States Dollars unless otherwise 
stated</P>
<P style="margin:0px; padding-top:4px; border-top:2px solid #000000"><BR></P>
<P style="margin:0px"><BR></P>
<P style=margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:-1pt;font-size:1pt /><P style="line-
height:12pt; margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:-2px; width:24px; font-
family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-size:9pt; float:left"><B>15.</B></P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px; padding-left:24px; padding-right:-
0.933px; text-indent:-2px; font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-size:9pt" 
align=justify><B>Contingencies</B></P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px; padding-left:18.933px; font-
family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-size:9pt; clear:left"><B>&nbsp;</B></P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin-top:6px; margin-bottom:0px; padding-
left:28.4px; padding-right:-0.933px; font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-
size:9pt" align=justify>Except as set forth below, there are no material legal 
proceedings to which the Company is a party or, to the best of the Company's 
knowledge, to which any of the Company's property is or was subject to. </P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin-top:6px; margin-bottom:0px; padding-
left:28.4px; font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-size:9pt"><I>Godbri 
Datano Claim</I></P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin-top:6px; margin-bottom:0px; padding-
left:28.4px; padding-right:-0.933px; font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-
size:9pt" align=justify>During September 2012, Godbri Mining Limited 
(&#147;Godbri&#148;), a private Ghanaian company, lodged a statement of claim in
the High Court of Justice, Accra, Ghana, seeking a declaration that, among other
things, that the sale of the Datano concession to Adansi Ghana is null and void.
Godbri claims to be the owner of 38% of the issued share capital of Midras 
Mining Limited and states that it did not consent to the acquisition of the 
Datano concession by Adansi Ghana. Adansi Ghana filed a defence on November 12, 
2012. Godbri subsequently amended its claim in January 2013 and in March 2013, 
after which both the Company and Adansi Ghana filed further defences. The matter
is currently awaiting trial but the Company considers the claim made by Godbri 
to be spurious and without any merit. Godbri has taken no further steps in the 
suit since June 2013.</P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin-top:6px; margin-bottom:0px; padding-
left:28.4px; font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-size:9pt" 
align=justify><I>Matisse and Madison Claim</I></P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin-top:6px; margin-bottom:0px; padding-
left:28.4px; padding-right:-0.933px; font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-
size:9pt" align=justify>During October 2013, Matisse &amp; Madison Co. Ltd. 
lodged a statement of claim in the High Court of Justice, Accra, Ghana, seeking 
compensatory damages of $20.0 million plus interest for breach of a verbal 
contract related to the purchase of the Datano Concessions from Midras. In April
2016, this claim was withdrawn by the plaintiff and is no longer active. </P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin-top:6px; margin-bottom:0px" 
align=justify><BR></P>
<P style=margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:-1pt;font-size:1pt /><P style="line-
height:12pt; margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:-2px; width:28.4px; font-
family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-size:9pt; float:left"><B>16.</B></P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px; padding-right:-0.933px; text-indent:-
2px; font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-size:9pt" 
align=justify><B>Supplemental cash flow information</B></P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin-top:6px; margin-bottom:0px;
clear:left"><BR></P>
<TABLE style="margin-top:0px; font-size:10pt" cellpadding=0 cellspacing=0><TR 
height=0 style="font-size:0"><TD width=349 /><TD width=78 /><TD width=60 /><TD 
width=24 /><TD width=54 /><TD width=60 /></TR>
<TR><TD style="margin-top:0px; border-top:1px solid #000000" valign=bottom 
width=349><P style="margin:0px; font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-
size:7pt">&nbsp;</P>
</TD><TD style="margin-top:0px; border-top:1px solid #000000" valign=bottom 
width=138 colspan=2><P style="margin:0px; font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; 
font-size:7pt" align=right><B>Three months ended June 30</B></P>
</TD><TD style="margin-top:0px; border-top:1px solid #000000" valign=bottom 
width=24><P style="margin:0px; font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-
size:7pt" align=right><B>&nbsp;</B></P>
</TD><TD style="margin-top:0px; border-top:1px solid #000000" valign=bottom 
width=114 colspan=2><P style="margin:0px; font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; 
font-size:7pt" align=right><B>Six months ended June 30</B></P>
</TD></TR>
<TR><TD style="margin-top:0px" valign=bottom width=349><P style="margin:0px; 
padding:0px; font-size:7pt">&nbsp;</P></TD><TD style="margin-top:0px" 
valign=bottom width=78><P style="margin:0px; font-family:Calibri,Times New 
Roman; font-size:7pt" align=right><B>2016</B></P>
</TD><TD style="margin-top:0px" valign=bottom width=60><P style="margin:0px; 
font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-size:7pt" align=right><B>2015</B></P>
</TD><TD style="margin-top:0px" valign=bottom width=24><P style="margin:0px; 
padding:0px; font-size:7pt">&nbsp;</P></TD><TD style="margin-top:0px" 
valign=bottom width=54><P style="margin:0px; font-family:Calibri,Times New 
Roman; font-size:7pt" align=right><B>2016</B></P>
</TD><TD style="margin-top:0px" valign=bottom width=60><P style="margin:0px;

<P style="line-height:12pt; margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:-2px; width:24px; 
font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-size:9pt; float:left"><B>17.</B></P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px; padding-right:-1.133px; text-indent:-
2px; font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-size:9pt" 
align=justify><B>Segmented information</B></P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin-top:6px; margin-bottom:0px; padding-
left:24px; padding-right:-1.2px; font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-
size:9pt; clear:left" align=justify><U>Geographic Information</U></P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin-top:6px; margin-bottom:0px; padding-
left:24px; padding-right:-7.2px; font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-
size:9pt">The Company has two reportable operating segments determined by 
geographical location. &nbsp;Ghana is the Company&#146;s only segment with 
mining operations at present.</P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px"><BR></P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin-top:6px; margin-bottom:0px; padding-
left:24px; font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-size:9pt"><B>Geographic 
allocation of total assets and liabilities</B></P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin-top:6px; margin-bottom:0px"><BR></P>

right:24px; font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-size:14pt; color:#7F7F00; 
page-break-before:always" align=justify><B>ASANKO GOLD INC.</B><FONT 
style="font-size:9pt"> </FONT></P>
<P style="line-height:14pt; margin:0px; font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; 
font-size:9pt">NOTES TO THE CONDENSED CONSOLIDATED INTERIM FINANCIAL 
STATEMENTS</P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px; font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; 
font-size:9pt">FOR THE THREE AND SIX MONTHS ENDED JUNE 30, 2016</P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px; font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; 
font-size:9pt">Expressed in Thousands of United States Dollars unless otherwise 
stated</P>
<P style="margin:0px; padding-top:4px; border-top:2px solid #000000"><BR></P>
<P style="margin:0px"><BR></P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:-2px; width:24px; 
font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-size:9pt; float:left"><B>17.</B></P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px; padding-right:-1.133px; text-indent:-
2px; font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-size:9pt" 
align=justify><B>Segmented information (continued)</B></P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin-top:6px; margin-bottom:0px; clear:left" 
align=justify><BR></P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin-top:6px; margin-bottom:0px; padding-
left:96px; padding-right:-0.933px; text-indent:-96px; font-family:Calibri,Times 
New Roman; font-size:9pt" align=justify><B>Three and six months ended June 30, 
2015</B></P>

align=justify><BR></P>
<TABLE style="margin-top:0px; font-size:10pt" cellpadding=0 cellspacing=0><TR 
height=0 style="font-size:0"><TD width=31 /><TD width=174 /><TD width=72 /><TD 
width=72 /><TD width=72 /><TD width=18 /><TD width=66 /><TD width=72 /><TD 
width=66 /></TR>

<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px"><BR></P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px; font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; 
font-size:9pt"><B>18. &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Financial instruments</B></P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin-top:6px; margin-bottom:0px; padding-
left:28.4px; padding-right:-1.2px; font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-
size:9pt" align=justify>As at June 30, 2016 the Company&#146;s financial 
instruments consist of cash and cash equivalents, receivables, reclamation bond,
accounts payable and accrued liabilities, long-term debt and an embedded 
derivative in relation to an interest rate floor. &nbsp;The Company classifies 
cash and cash equivalents, receivables and the reclamation bond as loans and 
receivables, and classifies accounts payable and accrued liabilities and long-
term debt as other financial liabilities. &nbsp;The embedded derivative 
liability associated with the interest rate floor of the long-term loan is 
measured at fair value through profit or loss.</P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px"><BR></P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px; padding-left:28.4px; font-
family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-size:9pt" align=justify>The fair value of 
these financial instruments approximates their carrying value, unless otherwise 
noted.</P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin-top:6px; margin-bottom:0px; padding-
left:28.4px; font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-size:9pt" 
align=justify>The risk exposure arising from these financial instruments is 
summarized as follows:</P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px"><BR></P>
<P style=margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:-1pt;font-size:1pt /><P style="line-
height:12pt; margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:-2px; text-indent:24px; width:48px; 
font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-size:9pt; float:left">(a)</P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px; padding-left:48px; padding-right:-
0.933px; text-indent:-2px; font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-size:9pt" 
align=justify>Credit risk</P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin-top:6px; margin-bottom:0px; padding-
left:47.267px; padding-right:-1.2px; font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-
size:9pt; clear:left" align=justify>Credit risk is the risk of an unexpected 
loss if a customer or the issuer of a financial instrument fails to meet its 
contractual obligations. The Company is subject to credit risk on the cash and 
cash equivalent balances held at banks in each of Canada, Ghana and South 
Africa. The majority of the Company&#146;s cash is held in Canadian based 
banking institutions, authorized under the Bank Act (Canada) to accept deposits.
As at June 30, 2016, the Company had interest receivable of $0.1 million 
(December 31, 2015 - $nil). &nbsp;In addition, the Company is subject to credit 
risk in relation the receivable balances relating to the sale of gold. &nbsp;The
Company currently sells all of the gold it produces to Red Kite under an offtake
agreement (note 11 (c)). &nbsp;The risk associated with receivables from Red 
Kite as at June 30, 2016 is considered to be negligible. </P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin-top:6px; margin-bottom:0px" 
align=justify><BR></P>
<P style=margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:-1pt;font-size:1pt /><P style="line-
height:12pt; margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:-2px; text-indent:24px; width:48px; 
font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-size:9pt; float:left">&nbsp;(b)</P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px; padding-left:48px; padding-right:-1.2px;
text-indent:-2px; font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-size:9pt" 
align=justify>Liquidity risk</P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px; clear:left"><BR></P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin-top:6px; margin-bottom:0px; padding-
left:47.267px; padding-right:-1.2px; font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-
size:9pt" align=justify>The Company&#146;s approach to managing liquidity is to 
ensure that it will have sufficient liquidity to settle obligations and 
liabilities as they fall due. As at June 30, 2016 the Company had a cash and 
cash equivalents balance of $34.5 million (December 31, 2015 &#150; $114.8 
million) and is generating positive cash flows from operations, allowing it to 
settle current accounts payable and accrued liabilities of $35.6 million 
(December 31, 2015 - $34.8 million) and current debt of $8.7 million (note 11). 
&nbsp;</P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px"><BR></P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px"><BR></P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px"><BR>
<BR></P>
<P style="margin:0px"><BR></P>
<P style="margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:12px; font-size:9pt" align=center>28</P>
<P style="margin:0px"><BR></P>
<HR style="margin-bottom:9.6px; padding-top:9.6px" noshade size=1.333>
<P style="line-height:14pt; margin-top:12px; margin-bottom:0px; padding-
right:24px; font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-size:14pt; color:#7F7F00; 
page-break-before:always" align=justify><B>ASANKO GOLD INC.</B><FONT 
style="font-size:9pt"> </FONT></P>
<P style="line-height:14pt; margin:0px; font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; 
font-size:9pt">NOTES TO THE CONDENSED CONSOLIDATED INTERIM FINANCIAL 
STATEMENTS</P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px; font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; 
font-size:9pt">FOR THE THREE AND SIX MONTHS ENDED JUNE 30, 2016</P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px; font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; 
font-size:9pt">Expressed in Thousands of United States Dollars unless otherwise 
stated</P>
<P style="margin:0px; padding-top:4px; border-top:2px solid #000000"><BR></P>
<P style="margin:0px"><BR></P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px; padding-left:28.4px; text-indent:-
18.933px; font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-size:9pt"><B>18. Financial 
instruments (continued)</B> </P>
<P style=margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:-1pt;font-size:1pt /><P style="line-
height:12pt; margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:-2px; text-indent:24px; width:48px; 
font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-size:9pt; float:left">(c)</P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px; padding-left:48px; padding-right:-
0.933px; text-indent:-2px; font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-size:9pt" 
align=justify>Market risk</P>
<P style=margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:-1pt;font-size:1pt /><P style="line-
height:12pt; margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:-2px; text-indent:48px; width:72px; 
font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-size:9pt; clear:left; 
float:left">(i)</P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px; padding-left:72px; text-indent:-2px; 
font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-size:9pt" align=justify>Interest rate 
risk</P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin-top:6px; margin-bottom:0px; padding-
left:72px; padding-right:-1.2px; font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-
size:9pt; clear:left" align=justify>Interest rate risk is the risk that the fair
value or future cash flows of a financial instrument will fluctuate because of 
changes in market interest rates. &nbsp;The Company&#146;s exposure to interest 
rate risk is limited to its loan agreement with Red Kite (note 11), which is 
subject to an interest rate of LIBOR plus 6% with a minimum LIBOR of 1%. </P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin-top:6px; margin-bottom:0px; padding-
left:72px; padding-right:-1.2px; font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-
size:9pt" align=justify>The Company&#146;s sensitivity to a 1% decrease or 
increase in market rates of interest would have an immaterial effect on the 
Company&#146;s interest expense/income for the three and six months ended June 
30, 2016.</P>
<P style=margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:-1pt;font-size:1pt /><P style="line-
height:12pt; margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:-2px; text-indent:48px; width:72px; 
font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-size:9pt; float:left">(ii)</P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px; padding-left:72px; text-indent:-2px; 
font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-size:9pt" align=justify>Foreign 
currency risk</P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin-top:6px; margin-bottom:0px; padding-
left:72px; padding-right:-1.2px; font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-
size:9pt; clear:left" align=justify>The Company is exposed to foreign currency 
risk through its foreign currency monetary assets and liabilities. A significant
change in the currency exchange rate between the US dollar and Canadian dollar 
(CAD) and South African rand (ZAR) could have an effect on the Company&#146;s 
results of operations, financial position and cash flows. &nbsp;During the year 
ended December 31, 2015, the Company had entered into a series of forward 
contracts to purchase a total of ZAR 346.6 million in exchange for Canadian and
US dollars at specified exchange rates; all such contracts expired by February 
2016. &nbsp;The Company at present has not entered into any further derivative 
instruments to reduce its exposure to currency risk, however, management 
monitors differing currency needs and tries to reduce its exposure to currency 
risks through exchanging currencies at what are considered to be optimal times. 
</P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin-top:6px; margin-bottom:0px" 
align=justify><BR></P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:-2px; text-
indent:47.267px; width:95.267px; font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-
size:9pt; float:left">(iii)</P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px; padding-left:95.267px; text-indent:-2px;
font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-size:9pt">Price risk </P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin-top:6px; margin-bottom:0px; padding-
left:72px; padding-right:-1.2px; font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-
size:9pt; clear:left" align=justify>Other price risk is the risk that the future
cash flows of a financial instrument will fluctuate because of changes in market
prices, other than those arising from currency risk or interest rate risk. The 
Company poured its first gold in January 2016 and staring selling refined gold 
during the first quarter 2016. &nbsp;The Company&#146;s future cash flows 
fluctuate due to changes in gold and silver prices. </P>
<P style=margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:-1pt;font-size:1pt /><P style="line-
height:12pt; margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:-2px; text-indent:24px; width:48px; 
font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-size:9pt; 
float:left"><B>&nbsp;</B>(d)</P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px; padding-left:48px; padding-right:-1.2px;
text-indent:-2px; font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-size:9pt" 
align=justify>Fair values</P>
<P style=margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:-1pt;font-size:1pt /><P style="line-
height:12pt; margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:-2px; text-indent:47.267px; 
width:72px; font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-size:9pt; clear:left; 
float:left">(i)</P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px; padding-left:47.267px; padding-right:-
7.2px; text-indent:-2px; font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-
size:9pt">Foreign currency forward contracts derivative</P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin-top:6px; margin-bottom:0px; padding-
left:72px; padding-right:-7.2px; font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-
size:9pt; clear:left">During the year ended December 31, 2015, the Company 
entered into a series of forward contracts to purchase ZAR in exchange for 
Canadian and US dollars at specified exchange rates. These forward contracts had
settlement terms that range from one month to eleven months.</P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin-top:6px; margin-bottom:0px; padding-
left:72px; padding-right:-7.2px; font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-
size:9pt">At December 31, 2015, the company had outstanding foreign currency 
forward contracts to buy ZAR 6.0 million in exchange for C$0.6 million with 
settlement dates between one and two months.</P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin-top:6px; margin-bottom:0px; padding-
left:72px; padding-right:-7.2px; font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-
size:9pt">The fair values of outstanding foreign currency forward contracts are 
determined using the forward rates at the measurement date, with the resulting 
value discounted to present value and are categorized within level 2 of the fair
value hierarchy.</P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin-top:6px; margin-bottom:0px; padding-
left:72px; padding-right:-7.2px; font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-
size:9pt">All such forward contracts expired by February 2016 and as such there 
is no forward contract derivative liability recorded by the Company as at June 
30, 2016. &nbsp;At December 31, 2015, the outstanding contracts had a fair value
of $36.</P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px"><BR></P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px"><BR>
<BR></P>
<P style="margin:0px"><BR></P>
<P style="margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:12px; font-size:9pt" align=center>29</P>
<P style="margin:0px"><BR></P>
<HR style="margin-bottom:9.6px; padding-top:9.6px" noshade size=1.333>
<P style="line-height:14pt; margin-top:12px; margin-bottom:0px; padding-
right:24px; font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-size:14pt; color:#7F7F00; 
page-break-before:always" align=justify><B>ASANKO GOLD INC.</B><FONT 
style="font-size:9pt"> </FONT></P>
<P style="line-height:14pt; margin:0px; font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; 
font-size:9pt">NOTES TO THE CONDENSED CONSOLIDATED INTERIM FINANCIAL 
STATEMENTS</P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px; font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; 
font-size:9pt">FOR THE THREE AND SIX MONTHS ENDED JUNE 30, 2016</P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px; font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; 
font-size:9pt">Expressed in Thousands of United States Dollars unless otherwise 
stated</P>
<P style="margin:0px; padding-top:4px; border-top:2px solid #000000"><BR></P>
<P style="margin:0px"><BR></P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px; padding-left:28.4px; text-indent:-
18.933px; font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-size:9pt"><B>18. Financial 
instruments (continued)</B> </P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin-top:6px; margin-bottom:0px"><BR></P>
<P style=margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:-1pt;font-size:1pt /><P style="line-
height:12pt; margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:-2px; text-indent:95.267px; 
width:120px; font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-size:9pt; 
float:left">(ii)</P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px; padding-left:143.267px; padding-right:-
7.2px; text-indent:-2px; font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-
size:9pt">Embedded derivative</P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin-top:6px; margin-bottom:0px; padding-
left:72px; padding-right:-7.2px; font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-
size:9pt; clear:left">The embedded derivative liability associated with the 
interest rate floor of the long-term loan is categorized within level 2 of the 
fair value hierarchy. The fair value of the embedded derivative liability 
associated with the interest rate floor was estimated using the three-month 
LIBOR forward rates to 2020 ranging from 0.62% to 1.41% using an option pricing 
model. &nbsp;As at June 30, 2016, the embedded derivative liability had a fair 
value and carrying value of $1.8 million (December 31, 2015: $536).</P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px"><BR></P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px" align=justify><BR></P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:-2px; width:24px; 
font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-size:9pt; float:left"><B>19.</B></P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px; text-indent:-2px; font-
family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-size:9pt" align=justify><B>&nbsp;Subsequent
events</B></P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px; clear:left" align=justify><BR></P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin-top:6.667px; margin-bottom:0px; padding-
left:24px; font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-size:9pt">On July 12, 2016,
the Company closed the acquisition of the Akwasiso property located 
approximately 2km from the Nkran pit; the area currently being mined by Asanko. 
&nbsp;The purchase consideration was $0.35 million plus 2 million Asanko Gold 
Inc. common shares. &nbsp;In addition, under the terms of the contract to 
acquire Akwasiso, Asanko must also pay for drilling work which has taken place 
to date and complete the drilling contract to 5,000 meters, estimated to total 
$0.5 million.</P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin-top:6.667px; margin-bottom:0px"><BR>
<BR></P>
<P style="margin:0px"><BR></P>
<P style="margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:12px; font-size:9pt" align=center>30</P>
<P style="margin:0px"><BR></P>
</DIV></BODY>
