<P style="margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:-2px; text-indent:24px; width:48px; 
font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; float:left">9.</P>
<P style="margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:-2px; width:528px; font-
family:Calibri,Times New Roman; float:left">Non-GAAP measures </P>
<P style="margin:0px; padding-left:48px; text-indent:-2px; font-
family:Calibri,Times New Roman">23 - 26</P>
<P style="margin:0px; clear:left"><BR></P>
<P style="margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:-2px; text-indent:24px; width:48px; 
font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; float:left">10.</P>
<P style="margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:-2px; width:528px; font-
family:Calibri,Times New Roman; float:left">Summary of outstanding share 
data</P>
<P style="margin:0px; padding-left:48px; text-indent:-2px; font-
family:Calibri,Times New Roman">26</P>
<P style="margin:0px; clear:left"><BR></P>
<P style="margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:-2px; text-indent:24px; width:48px; 
font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; float:left">11.</P>
<P style="margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:-2px; width:528px; font-
family:Calibri,Times New Roman; float:left">Related party transactions</P>
<P style="margin:0px; padding-left:48px; text-indent:-2px; font-
family:Calibri,Times New Roman">26</P>
<P style="margin:0px; clear:left"><BR></P>
<P style="margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:-2px; text-indent:24px; width:48px; 
font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; float:left">12.</P>
<P style="margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:-2px; width:528px; font-
family:Calibri,Times New Roman; float:left">Critical accounting policies and 
estimates</P>
<P style="margin:0px; padding-left:48px; text-indent:-2px; font-
family:Calibri,Times New Roman">26 - 27</P>
<P style="margin:0px; clear:left"><BR></P>
<P style="margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:-2px; text-indent:24px; width:48px; 
font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; float:left">13.</P>
<P style="margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:-2px; width:528px; font-
family:Calibri,Times New Roman; float:left">Risks and uncertainties</P>
<P style="margin:0px; padding-left:48px; text-indent:-2px; font-
family:Calibri,Times New Roman">27 &#150; 29</P>
<P style="margin:0px; clear:left"><BR></P>
<P style="margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:-2px; text-indent:24px; width:48px; 
font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; float:left">14.</P>
<P style="margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:-2px; width:528px; font-
family:Calibri,Times New Roman; float:left">Internal control</P>
<P style="margin:0px; padding-left:48px; text-indent:-2px; font-
family:Calibri,Times New Roman">30</P>
<P style="margin:0px; clear:left"><BR></P>
<P style="margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:-2px; text-indent:24px; width:48px; 
font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; float:left">15.</P>
<P style="margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:-2px; width:528px; font-
family:Calibri,Times New Roman; float:left">Cautionary statements</P>
<P style="margin:0px; padding-left:48px; text-indent:-2px; font-
family:Calibri,Times New Roman">30 - 32</P>
<P style="line-height:13pt; margin:0px; clear:left"><BR></P>
<P style="line-height:13pt; margin:0px"><BR></P>
<P style="line-height:13pt; margin:0px" align=justify><BR></P>
<HR style="margin-bottom:9.6px; padding-top:9.6px" noshade size=1.333>
</DIV><DIV style="width:657.8px"><P style="line-height:14pt; margin-top:12px; 
margin-bottom:0px; padding-right:24px; font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; 
font-size:14pt; page-break-before:always" align=justify><B>ASANKO GOLD 
INC.</B><FONT style="font-size:9pt"> </FONT></P>
<P style="line-height:14pt; margin:0px; font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; 
font-size:9pt">MANAGEMENT&#146;S DISCUSSION AND ANALYSIS</P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px; padding-bottom:4px; font-
family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-size:9pt; border-bottom:2px solid
#000000">FOR THE THREE AND SIX MONTHS ENDED JUNE 30, 2016</P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px; padding-top:4px; border-top:2px solid 
#000000"><BR></P>
<P style="margin:0px"><BR></P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin-top:6px; margin-bottom:0px; padding-right:-
1.133px; font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-size:9pt" align=justify>This 
Management&#146;s Discussion and Analysis (&#147;MD&amp;A&#148;) of Asanko Gold 
Inc. (&#147;Asanko&#148; or the &#147;Company&#148;) has been prepared by 
management as of August 11, 2016 and should be read in conjunction with the 
Company&#146;s unaudited condensed consolidated interim financial statements for
the three and six months ended June 30, 2016 and 2015 and the related notes 
thereto. &nbsp;Additional information on the Company, including its Annual 
Information Form (&#147;AIF&#148;) for the year ended December 31, 2015 is 
available under the Company&#146;s profile at www.sedar.com.</P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin-top:6px; margin-bottom:0px; padding-right:-
0.933px; font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-size:9pt" 
align=justify>Unless otherwise specified, all financial information has been 
prepared in accordance with International Financial Reporting Standards 
(&#147;IFRS&#148;) as issued by the International Accounting Standards Board. 
All dollar amounts herein are expressed in United States dollars unless stated 
otherwise. References to $ means US dollars and C$ are to Canadian dollars.</P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin-top:6px; margin-bottom:0px; padding-right:-
1.133px; font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-size:9pt" align=justify>This 
MD&amp;A contains forward-looking statements and should be read in conjunction 
with the risk factors described in the &#147;Risks and uncertainties&#148; and 
&#147;Cautionary statement on forward looking information&#148; sections at the 
end of this MD&amp;A.</P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px"><BR></P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:-2px; width:36px; 
font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-size:11pt; float:left"><B>1)</B></P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px; text-indent:-2px; font-
family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-size:11pt" align=justify><B>Overview of the
Business</B></P>
<P style="line-height:14pt; margin-top:12px; margin-bottom:12px; padding-right:-
8.333px; font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-size:9pt; clear:left">Asanko 
Gold Inc. (&#147;Asanko&#148; or the &#147;Company&#148;) is a Canadian-based 
gold producer with operations in the Republic of Ghana (&#147;Ghana&#148;). 
&nbsp;Asanko&#146;s vision is to build a low cost, mid-tier gold mining company.
The Company&#146;s principal asset, the Asanko Gold Mine (&#147;AGM&#148; or 
&#147;the Project&#148;) located in Ghana, West Africa is<FONT 
style="background-color:#FFFFFF"> being developed in three distinct phases 
(Phase 1, 2A and 2B) where Phase 1 is initial commercial production from the 
Obotan area with the two additional Phases being commercialization of deposits 
in nearby areas of the Project which are anticipated to be operated with 
significant common infrastructure. &nbsp;</FONT>Construction of Phase 1 was 
recently completed, within budget and ahead of schedule. Gold production is 
expected to average 190,000 ounces per annum over a 12.5 year mine life. 
&nbsp;The first gold production commenced in January 2016, commercial production
was declared on April 1, 2016, and the operation reached steady-state production
levels by the end of the second quarter (&#147;Q2&#148;) of 2016. </P>
<P style="line-height:14pt; margin-top:12px; margin-bottom:12px; padding-right:-
8.333px; font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-size:9pt">The proposed 
expansionary Phases, 2A and 2B (together &#147;Phase 2&#148;) have the potential
to increase production from 190,000 ounces per annum to approximately 480,000 
ounces per annum, which will rank the AGM in the top 10 current gold mines on 
the African continent. &nbsp;A Preliminary Feasibility Study (&#147;PFS&#148;) 
on Phase 2 was published in May 2015, and posited attractive project economics 
and low operating costs; a Definitive Feasibility Study (&#147;DFS&#148;) on 
Phase 2 is due to be completed and published in the third quarter 
(&#147;Q3&#148;) of 2016. </P>
<P style="line-height:14pt; margin-top:12px; margin-bottom:12px; padding-right:-
8.333px; font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-size:9pt">In addition to the 
AGM, the Company holds a portfolio of other Ghanaian gold concessions in various
stages of exploration.</P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px; font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; 
font-size:9pt" align=justify>The Company&#146;s shares are listed on the Toronto
Stock Exchange (&#147;TSX&#148;) and the New York Stock Exchange 
(&#147;NYSE&#148;) under the symbol &#147;AKG&#148;.</P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px"><BR></P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:-2px; width:36px; 
font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-size:11pt; float:left"><B>2)</B></P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px; text-indent:-2px; font-
family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-size:11pt"><B>Highlights and key business 
developments</B></P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px; clear:left"><BR></P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px; font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; 
font-size:9pt"><B>Q2 Business developments &nbsp;</B></P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px"><BR></P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:-2px; text-
indent:24px; width:48px; font-family:Symbol; font-size:9pt; 
float:left">&#183;</P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px; padding-left:48px; text-indent:-2px; 
font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-size:9pt">On April 1, 2016, the 
Company declared Phase 1 of the AGM to be in commercial production, a full 
quarter ahead of schedule. &nbsp;Commercial production was declared as a result 
of the mine achieving a number of key milestones including the mill processing 
at 111% of design capacity and gold recoveries exceeding design during the month
of March.</P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px; clear:left"><BR></P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:-2px; text-
indent:24px; width:48px; font-family:Symbol; font-size:9pt; 
float:left">&#183;</P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px; padding-left:48px; text-indent:-2px; 
font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-size:9pt">The Company substantially 
completed the finalization of capital expenditures on Phase 1 bringing the 
project to commercial production for $293 million, essentially in-line with the 
budget of $295 million.</P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px; clear:left"><BR></P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:-2px; text-
indent:24px; width:48px; font-family:Symbol; font-size:9pt; 
float:left">&#183;</P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px; padding-left:48px; text-indent:-2px; 
font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-size:9pt">Steady state production was 
achieved by the end of Q2; now mining the main ore zones in the Nkran pit and 
mill feed grades are in-line with the Mineral Reserve grade.</P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px; clear:left"><BR></P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px"><BR>
<BR></P>
<P style="margin:0px" align=right>2</P>
<P style="margin:0px" align=center><BR></P>
<P style="margin:0px"><BR></P>
<HR style="margin-bottom:9.6px; padding-top:9.6px" noshade size=1.333>
<P style="line-height:14pt; margin-top:12px; margin-bottom:0px; padding-
right:24px; font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-size:14pt; page-break-
before:always" align=justify><B>ASANKO GOLD INC.</B><FONT style="font-size:9pt">
</FONT></P>
<P style="line-height:14pt; margin:0px; font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; 
font-size:9pt">MANAGEMENT&#146;S DISCUSSION AND ANALYSIS</P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px; padding-bottom:4px; font-
family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-size:9pt; border-bottom:2px solid 
#000000">FOR THE THREE AND SIX MONTHS ENDED JUNE 30, 2016</P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px; padding-top:4px; border-top:2px solid 
#000000"><BR></P>
<P style="margin:0px"><BR></P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:-2px; text-
indent:24px; width:48px; font-family:Symbol; font-size:9pt; 
float:left">&#183;</P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px; padding-left:48px; text-indent:-2px;
font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-size:9pt">A total of 36,337 ounces of 
gold were produced, in-line with guidance of 35,000-40,000 ounces for the 
quarter and 35,074 ounces were sold at an average price of $1,231/ounce for 
gross gold revenue of $43.2 million.</P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px; clear:left"><BR></P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:-2px; text-
indent:24px; width:48px; font-family:Symbol; font-size:9pt; 
float:left">&#183;</P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px; padding-left:48px; text-indent:-2px; 
font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-size:9pt">The Company received its 
first refund of Ghanaian VAT which had been accumulated during the development 
phase of the project, amounting to $5.7 million. &nbsp;Subsequent to the end of 
the quarter, the Company has received a further $1.0 million in refunds and 
going forward expects VAT outflows to be offset by VAT inflows. &nbsp;</P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px; clear:left"><BR></P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:-2px; text-
indent:24px; width:48px; font-family:Symbol; font-size:9pt; 
float:left">&#183;</P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px; padding-left:48px; text-indent:-2px; 
font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-size:9pt">The balance sheet at June 
30, 2016 remains strong with cash of $34.5 million and unrefined gold dore on 
hand with a market value of $10.2 million. &nbsp;The working capital position of
the Company as of June 30, 2016 improved to $21.5 million from $10.8 million at 
March 31, 2016.</P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px; clear:left"><BR></P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:-2px; text-
indent:24px; width:48px; font-family:Symbol; font-size:9pt; 
float:left">&#183;</P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px; padding-left:48px; text-indent:-2px; 
font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-size:9pt">The Company amended the 
terms of its existing $150 million loan facility in order to defer principal 
payments for two years allowing the Company <FONT style="background-
color:#FFFFFF">to re-invest in its Phase 2 growth projects.</FONT></P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px; clear:left"><BR></P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:-2px; text-
indent:24px; width:48px; font-family:Symbol; font-size:9pt; float:left"><FONT 
style="background-color:#FFFFFF">&#183;</FONT></P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px; padding-left:48px; text-indent:-2px; 
font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-size:9pt"><FONT style="background-
color:#FFFFFF">The Phase 2 DFS scope was modified during the quarter as a result
of excess milling capacity at the Phase 1 metallurgical facility, creating the 
potential to develop Phase 2 in stages in order to fully utilize the existing 
infrastructure. &nbsp;The Phase 2 DFS remains on track for completion in Q3 
2016. </FONT></P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px; clear:left"><BR></P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:-2px; text-
indent:24px; width:48px; font-family:Symbol; font-size:9pt; 
float:left">&#183;</P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px; padding-left:48px; text-indent:-2px; 
font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-size:9pt">The 2016 near mine 
exploration program continued to work on evaluating three targets for 
anticipated mining and processing starting in early 2017: &nbsp;Adubiaso 
Extension, Nkran Extension and Akwasiso. &nbsp;These deposits are expected to 
provide additional ore sources to fully utilize the existing processing facility
capacity while the Company advances its feasibility assessment in regards to 
potentially bringing the Esaase deposit into production in 2018 as the first 
stage of the Phase 2 expansion.</P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px; clear:left"><BR></P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:-2px; text-
indent:24px; width:48px; font-family:Symbol; font-size:9pt; 
float:left">&#183;</P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px; padding-left:48px; text-indent:-2px; 
font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-size:9pt">Production guidance for the 
second half of 2016 is re-iterated at 90,000-100,000 ounces.</P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px; clear:left"><BR></P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px; font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; 
font-size:9pt"><B>Q2 key consolidated financial information </B></P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px"><BR></P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:-2px; text-
indent:24px; width:48px; font-family:Symbol; font-size:9pt; 
float:left">&#183;</P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px; padding-left:48px; text-indent:-2px; 
font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-size:9pt">In its first quarter of 
commercial production, the Company earned net revenues (after royalties) of 
$41.2 million from the sale of gold. &nbsp;Total cost of sales (including 
depreciation and depletion) of $40.8 million resulted in earnings from mine 
operations of $0.3 million.</P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px; clear:left"><BR></P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:-2px; text-
indent:24px; width:48px; font-family:Symbol; font-size:9pt; 
float:left">&#183;</P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px; padding-left:48px; text-indent:-2px; 
font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-size:9pt">The Company incurred a net 
loss and adjusted net loss of $12,527 ($0.06 earnings per share) and $11,760 
($0.06 loss per share) respectively. </P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px; clear:left"><BR></P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:-2px; text-
indent:24px; width:48px; font-family:Symbol; font-size:9pt; 
float:left">&#183;</P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px; padding-left:48px; text-indent:-2px; 
font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-size:9pt">Operating cash flow before 
working capital changes was $11.6 million.</P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px; clear:left"><BR></P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:-2px; text-
indent:24px; width:48px; font-family:Symbol; font-size:9pt; 
float:left">&#183;</P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px; padding-left:48px; text-indent:-2px; 
font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-size:9pt">The Company incurred 
operating cash costs per ounce and total cash costs per ounce of $785 per 
ounce<A NAME="_Ref457311733"></A><SUP>1</SUP> and $846 per ounce respectively. 
&nbsp;&nbsp;Cash operating costs and AISC are expected to improve in the second 
half of 2016 as steady state operations have been achieved and gold production 
is in line with the rates envisioned in the life-of-mine operating plan.</P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px; clear:left"><BR></P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:-2px; text-
indent:24px; width:48px; font-family:Symbol; font-size:9pt; 
float:left">&#183;</P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px; padding-left:48px; text-indent:-2px; 
font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-size:9pt">Importantly, unit cost of 
production in the mining and milling areas are substantially in-line with 
expectations with mining costs averaging $3.74/tonne mined and processing costs 
averaging $13.79/tonne milled during Q2. &nbsp;Improvements in mining costs are 
expected as a result of a mining fleet upgrade taking place in Q3 2016.</P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px; clear:left"><BR></P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:-2px; text-
indent:24px; width:48px; font-family:Symbol; font-size:9pt; 
float:left">&#183;</P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px; padding-left:48px; text-indent:-2px; 
font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-size:9pt">The Company incurred all-in 
sustaining costs (&#147;AISC&#148;) per ounce of<FONT style="font-
family:Cambria,Times New Roman; font-size:11pt"> </FONT>$1,280<FONT style="font-
family:Cambria,Times New Roman; font-size:11pt">, </FONT>of which $346 relates 
to deferred stripping costs. &nbsp;</P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px; clear:left"><BR></P>
<P style="margin:0px; font-family:Arial"><SUP>1</SUP> <FONT style="font-
size:8pt">See &#147;</FONT><FONT style="font-size:8pt"><B>9. Non-GAAP 
measures&#148;.</B></FONT></P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px"><BR>
<BR></P>
<P style="margin:0px" align=right>3</P>
<P style="margin:0px" align=center><BR></P>
<P style="margin:0px"><BR></P>
<HR style="margin-bottom:9.6px; padding-top:9.6px" noshade size=1.333>
<P style="line-height:14pt; margin-top:12px; margin-bottom:0px; padding-
right:24px; font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-size:14pt; page-break-
before:always" align=justify><B>ASANKO GOLD INC.</B><FONT style="font-size:9pt">
</FONT></P>
<P style="line-height:14pt; margin:0px; font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; 
font-size:9pt">MANAGEMENT&#146;S DISCUSSION AND ANALYSIS</P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px; padding-bottom:4px; font-
family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-size:9pt; border-bottom:2px solid 
#000000">FOR THE THREE AND SIX MONTHS ENDED JUNE 30, 2016</P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px; padding-top:4px; border-top:2px solid 
#000000"><BR></P>
<P style="margin:0px"><BR></P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px"><BR></P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px; font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; 
font-size:11pt"><B>Selected consolidated data</B></P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px"><BR></P>

</TD></TR>
<TR><TD style="margin-top:0px" valign=bottom width=316><P style="margin:0px; 
padding:0px; font-size:8pt">&nbsp;</P></TD><TD style="margin-top:0px; border-

</TD><TD style="margin-top:0px; border-bottom:1px solid #000000" valign=bottom 
width=102><P style="margin:0px; font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-
size:8pt" align=center><B>2015</B></P>
</TD></TR>
<TR><TD style="margin-top:0px" valign=bottom width=316><P style="margin:0px;

<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px"><BR></P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px; font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; 
font-size:9pt">All results in the table above are the consolidated results of 
the Company. &nbsp;The Company operates in two segments, Ghana and Canada; the 
Canadian segment is a head office function and is not presented separately in 
the results below as its results are not material to the Company&#146;s overall 
operations. &nbsp;All financial results in this MD&amp;A are discussed on a 
consolidated basis.</P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px"><BR></P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:-2px; width:36px; 
font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-size:11pt; float:left"><B>3)</B></P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px; padding-left:36px; text-indent:-2px; 
font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-size:11pt"><B>2016 Outlook and 
strategy</B></P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px; clear:left" align=justify><BR></P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px; font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; 
font-size:9pt" align=justify><B>Current operations</B></P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px" align=justify><BR></P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px; font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; 
font-size:9pt" align=justify>During the second half of 2016, the Company expects
to produce 90,000 to 100,000 ounces of gold. &nbsp;Ore for the operation is 
expected to continue to come exclusively from mining the Nkran pit.</P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px" align=justify><BR></P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px; font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; 
font-size:9pt" align=justify>Near mine exploration activity at Adubiaso 
Extension, the Nkran Extension and Akwasiso is expected to continue in Q3 2016. 
&nbsp;Receipt of permitting modifications are anticipated to be received which 
will enable mining of Adubiaso Extension to commence during the first quarter of
2017. &nbsp;The predominantly oxide ores are expected to be blended with fresh 
ore from the Nkran pit to maximise full utilization of the existing processing 
plant&#146;s capacity.</P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px"><BR></P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px; padding-right:-1.2px; font-
family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-size:9pt">At the end of Q2 2016 the capital
projects for Phase 1 were complete and the mine and processing facility was 
fully operational by this date. &nbsp;At this time there was $8.3 million in 
Phase 1 related project capital expenditure in accounts payable and a further 
$10.6 million in final invoices expected to be received. &nbsp;In summary, at 
June 30, 2016: &nbsp;$282.5 million had been spent, $8.3 million in payables 
remained to be paid and $10.62 million in invoices were yet to be received 
bringing the total capital cost of the project to $293.1 million, approximately 
$2 million under the budget estimated in the Phase 2 Pre-feasibility Study filed
on <FONT style="color:#0000FF"><U>www.sedar.com</U></FONT><FONT 
style="color:#0000FF"><U></U></FONT> on June 29, 2015.</P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px"><BR>
<BR></P>
<P style="margin:0px" align=right>4</P>
<P style="margin:0px" align=center><BR></P>
<P style="margin:0px"><BR></P>
<HR style="margin-bottom:9.6px; padding-top:9.6px" noshade size=1.333>
<P style="line-height:14pt; margin-top:12px; margin-bottom:0px; padding-
right:24px; font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-size:14pt; page-break-
before:always" align=justify><B>ASANKO GOLD INC.</B><FONT style="font-size:9pt">
</FONT></P>
<P style="line-height:14pt; margin:0px; font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; 
font-size:9pt">MANAGEMENT&#146;S DISCUSSION AND ANALYSIS</P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px; padding-bottom:4px; font-
family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-size:9pt; border-bottom:2px solid 
#000000">FOR THE THREE AND SIX MONTHS ENDED JUNE 30, 2016</P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px; padding-top:4px; border-top:2px solid 
#000000"><BR></P>
<P style="margin:0px"><BR></P>
<P style="margin-top:11.267px; margin-bottom:0px; font-family:Calibri,Times New 
Roman; font-size:9pt"><FONT style="background-color:#FFFFFF"><B>Planned 
expansion</B></FONT></P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px"><BR></P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px; padding-right:-1.2px; font-
family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-size:9pt">A Definitive Feasibility Study 
(&#147;DFS&#148;) on the Phase 2 expansion is currently underway and expected to
be filed in Q3 2016. As discussed below under &#147;<B>5. Development and 
Exploration update&#148;, </B>the scope of the Phase 2 DFS has been modified to 
include a two-stage development approach (Phase 2A and Phase 2B) for the 
integration of the Esaase deposit with Phase 1. &nbsp;Phase 2A is the 
development of the Esaase pit, mining up to 2 million tonnes per annum 
(&#147;Mtpa&#148;) of oxide ores and construction of a conveyor from the Esaase 
deposit to the current Phase 1 processing facility, which will be upgraded to 
5Mtpa throughput.</P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px"><BR></P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px; padding-right:-1.2px; font-
family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-size:9pt">Phase 2A is expected to take 
approximately 21 months for detailed design and construction at a capital cost 
of approximately US$100 - $125 million. The operating and capital cost estimates
are currently being updated as part of the DFS.</P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px"><BR></P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px; padding-right:-1.2px; font-
family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-size:9pt">During Q2 2016, the Company 
announced that it had successfully agreed to terms with RK Mine Finance 
(&#147;Red Kite&#148;) to amend its existing US$150 million loan facility and 
defer repayment of the principal for two years to allow Phase 2A to be fully 
financed from cash flow from operations (<B>see &#147;8. Liquidity and capital 
resources&#148; below). &nbsp;</B></P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px"><BR></P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px; padding-right:-1.2px; font-
family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-size:9pt">A final Environment Impact 
Statement (&#147;EIS&#148;) has been prepared and submitted to the Ghanaian 
Environmental Protection Agency following a successful community consultation 
meeting held in April 2016. &nbsp;The Company expects to receive its Environment
Permit for Phase 2 in Q4 2016. &nbsp;Following the receipt of the final permit, 
an investment decision to proceed with Phase 2 is expected to be made by the 
Company&#146;s Board of directors.</P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px"><BR></P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px; padding-right:-1.2px; font-
family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-size:9pt">Readers are cautioned that while 
the Company is optimistic that the DPP will posit a positive return for Phase 2A
and 2B, until the results of the report are in-hand there can be no certainty 
that it will result in a decision to proceed.</P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px"><BR></P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px; padding-right:-1.2px; font-
family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-size:9pt"><B>Exploration</B></P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px"><BR></P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px; padding-right:-1.2px; font-
family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-size:9pt">Following encouraging results 
from a near-mine exploration program in the first half of 2016 (see &#147;<B>5. 
Development and exploration update</B>&#148; below), the 2016 exploration
program continues to focus on near-mine priority targets for the second half of 
the year. &nbsp;The first drilling campaign has delineated two mineralized zones
- one is an extension of the existing Adubiaso pit (3km from the Phase 1 
processing facility) and the other is a north-easterly extension of the main 
Nkran pit mineralization. Both zones present as near-surface, have not been 
mined before and occur within the existing mine permit boundaries which should 
result in a streamlined permitting process allowing for accelerated commencement
of mining and incremental oxide ore feed to the existing processing facility. 
&nbsp;Drilling is currently focused on a third target, Akwasiso. &nbsp;An 
initial Mineral Resource Estimate is expected in Q4 2016.</P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px"><BR></P>
<P style="margin:0px"><BR>
<BR></P>
<P style="margin:0px" align=right>5</P>
<P style="margin:0px" align=center><BR></P>
<P style="margin:0px"><BR></P>
<HR style="margin-bottom:9.6px; padding-top:9.6px" noshade size=1.333>
<P style="line-height:14pt; margin-top:12px; margin-bottom:0px; padding-
right:24px; font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-size:14pt; page-break-
before:always" align=justify><B>ASANKO GOLD INC.</B><FONT style="font-size:9pt">
</FONT></P>
<P style="line-height:14pt; margin:0px; font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; 
font-size:9pt">MANAGEMENT&#146;S DISCUSSION AND ANALYSIS</P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px; padding-bottom:4px; font-
family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-size:9pt; border-bottom:2px solid 
#000000">FOR THE THREE AND SIX MONTHS ENDED JUNE 30, 2016</P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px; padding-top:4px; border-top:2px solid 
#000000"><BR></P>
<P style="margin:0px"><BR></P>
<P style="margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:-2px; width:36px; font-
family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-size:11pt; float:left"><B>4)</B></P>
<P style="margin:0px; text-indent:-2px; font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; 
font-size:11pt"><B>Operating performance</B></P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px; clear:left"><BR></P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px; font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; 
font-size:9pt">The following table provides a summary of operating performance 
at the AGM for Q2, 2016, the first quarter of commercial production. &nbsp;Data 
prior to this date has not been provided as either i) the mine was not in 
commercial production or ii) the data does not provide meaningful information 
for comparative purposes as it relates to production in the period prior to 
commercial production.</P>

<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px"><BR></P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:6px; font-
family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-size:9pt">The Company&#146;s pre-commercial
production operations commenced January 1, 2016 with the mechanical completion 
of the processing facility, and ceased on March 31, 2016 on the eve of the 
declaration of commercial production. &nbsp;Commercial production was announced 
at the AGM effective April 1, 2016. &nbsp;Below, the Company has presented a 
discussion of pre-commercial production operations during Q1 2016 as well as a 
discussion of operations for Q2 2016, the Company&#146;s first quarter of 
commercial production; there are no comparative numbers as the mine was not 
operating in 2015.</P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:6px; font-
family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-size:9pt"><B>Pre-commercial production 
&#150; Q1 2016</B></P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:8px; font-
family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-size:9pt">The quarter saw a highly 
successful ramp-up of the processing plant which was commissioned six weeks 
ahead of schedule, ramped up to design throughput three months faster than 
expected, and operated consistently at more than 10% above design throughput 
rates. The processing plant produced its first gold in January and during Q1 
produced 15,337 ounces of gold; 6,591 ounces of which were held as inventory as 
of March 31, 2016. &nbsp;During this pre-commercial production period, gold 
recovery exceeded expectations achieving in excess of 94% over the last two 
weeks of March versus a design of 92.5%. </P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:8px"><BR></P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:8px; font-
family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-size:9pt">As a result of higher than 
expected demand for feed, ore in the pre-commercial production period was 
predominantly bulk mined with a focus on mining higher rates from the pit in 
order to open up the main ore zones, as well as to give the pit more operational
flexibility. &nbsp;Consequently, lower head grades were mined, with higher 
levels of dilution and gold losses than planned.</P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:6px"><BR></P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:6px"><BR>
<BR></P>
<P style="margin:0px" align=right>6</P>
<P style="margin:0px" align=center><BR></P>
<P style="margin:0px"><BR></P>
<HR style="margin-bottom:9.6px; padding-top:9.6px" noshade size=1.333>
<P style="line-height:14pt; margin-top:12px; margin-bottom:0px; padding-
right:24px; font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-size:14pt; page-break-
before:always" align=justify><B>ASANKO GOLD INC.</B><FONT style="font-size:9pt">
</FONT></P>
<P style="line-height:14pt; margin:0px; font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; 
font-size:9pt">MANAGEMENT&#146;S DISCUSSION AND ANALYSIS</P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px; padding-bottom:4px; font-
family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-size:9pt; border-bottom:2px solid 
#000000">FOR THE THREE AND SIX MONTHS ENDED JUNE 30, 2016</P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px; padding-top:4px; border-top:2px solid 
#000000"><BR></P>
<P style="margin:0px"><BR></P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:6px; font-
family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-size:9pt"><B>Commercial production &#150; 
Q2 2016</B></P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:6px; font-
family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-size:9pt"><B>Health and Safety</B></P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:6px; font-
family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-size:9pt">There were no lost time injuries 
(&#147;LTI&#148;) during the quarter, with only one LTI occurring in the last 12
months on March 8, 2016. Since then, there have been 1,523,942 LTI free man-
hours worked. The 12-month rolling lost time injury frequency rate per million 
man hours worked is 0.14.</P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:6px; font-
family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-size:9pt"><B>Mining</B></P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px; font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; 
font-size:9pt">Mining operations continued exclusively in the Nkran pit where 
bulk mining of the periphery of the main ore zones was undertaken to open up 
access to the main ore body by the end of Q2. &nbsp;This objective was achieved 
in the quarter with 5.8 million tonnes (&#147;Mt&#148;) of waste removed from 
the pit and 1.2Mt of ore mined at a strip ratio of 4.7:1. &nbsp;As anticipated, 
the bulk mining resulted in higher levels of dilution and gold losses than are 
expected at steady state, resulting in an average grade of mined ore of 1.48 g/t
gold. &nbsp;</P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px"><BR></P>

</TD><TD style="margin-top:0px; border-right:1px solid #000000; border-

font-size:8pt" align=center>1.48</P>
</TD></TR>
</TABLE>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px"><BR></P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px; font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; 
font-size:9pt">Mining efficiencies are showing signs of improvement as a result 
of receiving part of a new mining contractor fleet during the quarter to replace
the second-hand fleet that started the pre-strip in 2015. In the quarter a new 
CAT 992 FEL, a new CAT 6030 300T shovel and 10 new CAT 777&#146;s were 
delivered. In Q3, an additional 10 new CAT 777&#146;s and three new drill rigs 
are expected, which are expected to improve equipment utilization, increase 
efficiencies and lower unit mining costs. </P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px"><BR></P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px; font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; 
font-size:9pt">Encouragingly, the first two ore domains were encountered at 
Nkran, as anticipated, during the final weeks of Q2. Since intercepting these 
domains the dilution and ore losses are now approaching projected normal rates, 
resulting in higher grade ore being fed to the processing plant. The average 
mill feed grade for the month of June was 2.0 g/t gold and currently the feed 
grades to the mill are in-line with the Mineral Reserve grade for Nkran as 
estimated in the PFS. As the main ore body continues to be exposed in early Q3, 
dilution and gold losses are expected to meet planned levels.</P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px"><BR></P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:6px; font-
family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-size:9pt"><B>Processing</B></P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px; font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; 
font-size:9pt">The processing plant processed 702,318 tonnes (&#147;t&#148;) of 
ore at an average grade of 1.69 g/t gold during the quarter. &nbsp;Recovery of 
gold was in line with expectations with higher recoveries achieved in the latter
half of the quarter once the oxygen plant was fully operational. &nbsp;The 
average gold recovery for the quarter was 92%. </P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px"><BR></P>

<P style="line-height:12pt; margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:5.333px"><BR>
<BR></P>
<P style="margin:0px" align=right>7</P>
<P style="margin:0px" align=center><BR></P>
<P style="margin:0px"><BR></P>
<HR style="margin-bottom:9.6px; padding-top:9.6px" noshade size=1.333>
<P style="line-height:14pt; margin-top:12px; margin-bottom:0px; padding-
right:24px; font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-size:14pt; page-break-
before:always" align=justify><B>ASANKO GOLD INC.</B><FONT style="font-size:9pt">
</FONT></P>
<P style="line-height:14pt; margin:0px; font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; 
font-size:9pt">MANAGEMENT&#146;S DISCUSSION AND ANALYSIS</P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px; padding-bottom:4px; font-
family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-size:9pt; border-bottom:2px solid 
#000000">FOR THE THREE AND SIX MONTHS ENDED JUNE 30, 2016</P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px; padding-top:4px; border-top:2px solid 
#000000"><BR></P>
<P style="margin:0px"><BR></P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px; font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; 
font-size:9pt">During the quarter a number of operational improvements were 
implemented in the processing plant including mechanical changes to the 
materials handling and crushing circuits, ball mill and SAG mill gear changes 
and other de-bottlenecking work that resulted in higher than normal planned 
mechanical down-time in the processing plant. &nbsp;The goal of the work was to 
optimize the inherent additional mill capacity and operate at 275,000t per 
month, or about 10% above design rates on a continuous basis. &nbsp;With the 
bulk of the changes completed by early June, the processing plant treated 
265,000t during the month and is now operating at the levels anticipated from 
these improvements. </P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px"><BR></P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px; font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; 
font-size:9pt"><B>Preliminary Mineral Resource Reconciliation</B></P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:6px; font-
family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-size:9pt">Of the 702,318t of ore fed to the
plant, approximately 257,000t (37%) came from the main ore domains in the Nkran 
pit with the balance of the ore coming from mining of the periphery ore zones 
(445,318t). &nbsp;</P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:6px; font-
family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-size:9pt">The main ore zones mined in Q2 
consist of portions of the first two domains that have been encountered as 
mining reached the main ore zones of the deposit. The two domains are 2000 and 
2500 as described in the Company&#146;s Mineral Resource Estimate (see news 
release dated September 10, 2014 on the Company`s website or www.sedar.com). 
&nbsp;The grade control drilling results from these main zones is reconciling 
well with the Mineral Resource Estimate with grade control estimating 10% less 
tonnes than anticipated at 13% higher gold grade resulting in a 2% positive gold
reconciliation.</P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px"><BR></P>
<TABLE style="margin-top:0px; font-size:10pt" cellpadding=0 cellspacing=0><TR

</TD></TR>
</TABLE>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:6px"><BR></P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:6px; font-
family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-size:9pt">Asanko expects to be able to 
carry ongoing reconciliations of actual mining results compared to estimated 
Mineral Reserves as mining the main ore zones continues. It is expected that the
majority of ore will come from the main Nkran ore zones for H2 2016.</P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:6px; font-
family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-size:9pt">In addition, the mine predicted 
feed grade to the mill is reconciling well with the calculated mill head grade 
now that the gold inventory build-up in the processing plant has reached steady 
state.</P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px"><BR></P>
<TABLE style="margin-top:0px; font-size:10pt" cellpadding=0 cellspacing=0><TR 
height=0 style="font-size:0"><TD width=104.6 /><TD width=138.933 /><TD 
width=135.067 /><TD width=140 /><TD width=124.533 /></TR>

<P style="line-height:12pt; margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:2.667px; font-

Grade</B></P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:2.667px; font-
family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-size:8pt" align=center><B>(g/t)</B></P>
</TD><TD style="margin-top:0px; border-top:1.333px solid #000000; border-

font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-size:8pt" align=center><B>Plant Calc 
Grade</B></P>

<P style="margin:0px" align=right>8</P>
<P style="margin:0px" align=center><BR></P>
<P style="margin:0px"><BR></P>
<HR style="margin-bottom:9.6px; padding-top:9.6px" noshade size=1.333>
<P style="line-height:14pt; margin-top:12px; margin-bottom:0px; padding-
right:24px; font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-size:14pt; page-break-
before:always" align=justify><B>ASANKO GOLD INC.</B><FONT style="font-size:9pt">
</FONT></P>
<P style="line-height:14pt; margin:0px; font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; 
font-size:9pt">MANAGEMENT&#146;S DISCUSSION AND ANALYSIS</P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px; padding-bottom:4px; font-
family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-size:9pt; border-bottom:2px solid 
#000000">FOR THE THREE AND SIX MONTHS ENDED JUNE 30, 2016</P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px; padding-top:4px; border-top:2px solid 
#000000"><BR></P>
<P style="margin:0px"><BR></P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:6px; font-
family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-size:9pt"><B>Ore Inventory 
Movements</B></P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px; font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; 
font-size:9pt">The mining operations continued to stockpile ore ahead of the 
processing plant on the Run-of-Mine (ROM) pad. &nbsp;The stockpile movements 
during the quarter are shown below. &nbsp;</P>

</TD></TR>
</TABLE>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px"><BR></P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px; font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; 
font-size:9pt">In addition to the ROM stockpiles, the processing plant maintains
a crushed ore stockpile for emergency use in the event of a crusher breakdown. 
&nbsp;At June 30, 2016 there was 63,854t of crushed ore at 1.27 g/t on this 
stockpile (2,602 ounces of gold), during the quarter approximately 38,000t of 
ore were added to this stockpile. &nbsp;As well, during the Nkran pre-stripping 
operations, marginal ore was stockpiled separately for potential processing at 
the end of the mine life and consists of 470,597t at 0.79 g/t (11,953 ounces of 
gold).</P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px"><BR></P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px; font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; 
font-size:9pt"><B>Sales</B></P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:6px; font-
family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-size:9pt">Gold production for the quarter 
was 36,337 ounces with gold sales of 35,074 ounces at an average price of 
US$1,231 per ounce, generating gold sales revenue of US$43.2 million. At the end
of the quarter, there were 7,833 ounces of dor&#233; in inventory at a market 
value of approximately $10.2 million.</P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:6px; font-
family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-size:9pt">Mining costs for the quarter were
$3.74/tonne of material mined, in-line with costs anticipated in the DPP. 
&nbsp;Processing costs for the quarter were $13.79/tonne of ore milled, also in-
line with costs anticipated. &nbsp;</P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:6px; font-
family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-size:9pt">All-in sustaining costs, 
operating cash costs and total cash costs per ounce during the first quarter of 
commercial production were $1,280, $785 and $846 respectively (see <B>&#147;9. 
Non-GAAP measures&#148; </B>below). &nbsp;These costs per ounce were higher than
the Company expects to incur for the third and fourth quarters (and in the long-
term) due predominantly to processing of lower grade material resulting in 
higher unit costs per ounce of gold produced. &nbsp;(see &#147;<B>6. Financial 
results&#148; </B>below). &nbsp;&nbsp;</P>
<P style="margin:0px"><BR></P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:-2px; width:48px; 
font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-size:11pt; float:left"><B>5)</B></P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px; text-indent:-2px; font-
family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-size:11pt"><B>Development and Exploration 
update</B></P>
<P style="margin:0px; clear:left"><BR></P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px; padding-right:-1.2px; font-
family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-size:11pt"><B>5.1 Phase 1 </B></P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px"><BR></P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px; padding-right:-1.2px; font-
family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-size:9pt"><B>Development 
Expenditures</B></P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px"><BR></P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px; padding-right:-1.2px; font-
family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-size:9pt">As of the date of this MD&amp;A, 
the development of Phase 1 of the AGM was substantially complete with residual 
procurement packages in the final stages of closure. &nbsp;The capital cost 
budget for the Project as approved by the board of directors was $295 million 
with the Project commencing July 1, 2014. &nbsp;A summary of the Phase 1 
development expenditures as at June 30, 2016 is as follows: </P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px"><BR></P>
<TABLE style="margin-top:0px; font-size:10pt" cellpadding=0 cellspacing=0><TR 
height=0 style="font-size:0"><TD width=334.667 /><TD width=68 /></TR>

of Property, Plant and Equipment</B></P>
</TD><TD style="margin-top:0px; border-bottom:1px solid #000000" width=68><P

<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px"><BR></P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px"><BR>
<BR></P>
<P style="margin:0px" align=right>9</P>
<P style="margin:0px" align=center><BR></P>
<P style="margin:0px"><BR></P>
<HR style="margin-bottom:9.6px; padding-top:9.6px" noshade size=1.333>
<P style="line-height:14pt; margin-top:12px; margin-bottom:0px; padding-
right:24px; font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-size:14pt; page-break-
before:always" align=justify><B>ASANKO GOLD INC.</B><FONT style="font-size:9pt">
</FONT></P>
<P style="line-height:14pt; margin:0px; font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; 
font-size:9pt">MANAGEMENT&#146;S DISCUSSION AND ANALYSIS</P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px; padding-bottom:4px; font-
family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-size:9pt; border-bottom:2px solid
#000000">FOR THE THREE AND SIX MONTHS ENDED JUNE 30, 2016</P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px; padding-top:4px; border-top:2px solid 
#000000"><BR></P>
<P style="margin:0px"><BR></P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px; padding-right:-1.2px; font-
family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-size:9pt">Of the total of $282.5 million 
Phase 1 expenditure incurred by June 30, 2016, approximately $8.3 million were 
reflected in accounts payable as at June 30, 2016. &nbsp;A further $10.6 million
in cash remains to be incurred with respect to Phase 1 relating to the final 
EPCM (engineering, procurement contract management), EC &amp; I (electrical, 
controls and instrumentation) and S&amp;PP (steelwork, plate work and 
piping).</P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px"><BR></P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px; padding-right:-1.2px; font-
family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-size:9pt">With the commencement of 
commercial production on April 1, 2016, all of the Phase 1 development costs 
were transferred to mineral properties.</P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px"><BR></P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px; padding-right:-1.2px; font-
family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-size:11pt"><B>5.2 Phase 2 </B></P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px"><BR></P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px; padding-right:-1.2px; font-
family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-size:9pt">A DFS for Phase 2 of the Project 
was initiated following a positive PFS, which was filed June 29, 2015. &nbsp;The
DFS is expected to be completed prior to the end of Q3 2016.</P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px"><BR></P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px; padding-right:-1.2px; font-
family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-size:9pt">The PFS envisioned integrating 
the Esaase deposit with Phase 1 to create one large, multi-pit mine and 
expanding the existing processing facilities to produce an average of 411,000 
ounces of gold per annum over a 10.5 year Life of Mine (&#147;LoM&#148;) from 
2018. &nbsp;The ore would be mined and crushed at Esaase and then conveyed to 
the expanded Phase 1 processing facility, which would include an upgrade to the 
CIL circuit with two extra tanks to increase capacity from 3Mtpa to 3.8Mtpa and 
the addition of a 5Mtpa flotation plant.</P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px"><BR></P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px; padding-right:-1.2px; font-
family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-size:9pt">Following the successful 
commissioning of Phase 1 in Q1 2016, the process plant has demonstrated the 
ability to operate at greater than 110% of the 3Mtpa design. This has presented 
an opportunity to take advantage of the Esaase oxide ore (representing 
approximately 37% of the Esaase reserves) which is well suited to processing 
through the CIL circuit. &nbsp;Therefore, the scope of the Phase 2 DFS has been 
modified to include a two-stage approach (together &#147;Phase 2&#148;) for the 
integration of the Esaase deposit with Phase 1:</P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px"><BR></P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:-2px; text-
indent:48px; width:72px; font-family:Symbol; font-size:9pt; 
float:left">&#183;</P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px; padding-left:72px; padding-right:-1.2px;
text-indent:-2px; font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-size:9pt">Phase 2A: 
development of the Esaase pit, mining up to 2Mtpa of oxide ores and construction
of the conveyor to provide the additional ore to process up to 5Mtpa through the
existing CIL circuit, which will be upgraded; and</P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:-2px; text-
indent:48px; width:72px; font-family:Symbol; font-size:9pt; clear:left; 
float:left">&#183;</P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px; padding-left:72px; padding-right:-1.2px;
text-indent:-2px; font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-size:9pt">Phase 2B: 
mining of both Esaase oxide and fresh ores and expansion of the processing 
facilities to include the addition of a 5Mtpa flotation plant to bring the total
processing capacity up to 10Mtpa.</P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px; clear:left"><BR></P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px; padding-right:-1.2px; font-
family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-size:9pt"><B>Overview of Phase 2A</B></P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px"><BR></P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px; padding-right:-0.933px; font-
family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-size:9pt">The Esaase deposit contains 
60.3Mt of Proven and Probable Mineral Reserves of which approximately 23Mt are 
oxide and transition ores. Phase 2A will develop the Esaase pit, mining the 
oxide portion of the Mineral Reserve to provide an additional 2Mtpa of material 
which will be blended with 3Mtpa of the Nkran fresh ore and processed through 
the existing processing facility, which will be upgraded. &nbsp;</P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px"><BR></P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px; padding-right:-0.933px; font-
family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-size:9pt">Development will include 
construction of mining and crushing infrastructure and a 27km overland conveyor 
belt to transport the ore to the existing processing facility. &nbsp;Brownfield 
modifications will upgrade the existing processing plant capacity from 3Mtpa up 
to 5Mtpa. The upgrades to the processing facility that were originally 
envisioned to expand capacity from 3Mtpa to 3.8 Mtpa in the PFS are now expected
to increase production levels up to 5Mtpa with some minor additional capital 
expenditure. &nbsp;The extent and cost of the modifications will be detailed in 
the DFS, expected in Q3 2016. Additional metallurgical test work, undertaken at 
ALS laboratories in Perth, Australia, together with operational experience 
gained from Phase 1 to date has confirmed that metallurgical recovery from 
blending of the Esaase oxide and Nkran fresh ores will be in-line with the PFS 
recovery estimates of approximately 90.9%<SUP>2</SUP>.</P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px"><BR></P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px; padding-right:-0.933px; font-
family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-size:9pt">Based on the PFS capital cost 
estimate and mine plan, Phase 2A is expected to take approximately 21 months for
detailed design and construction at a capital cost of approximately US$100 
&#150; 125 million<SUP>2</SUP>. Production of over 280,000 ounces per annum is 
targeted to commence in Q4 2018. &nbsp;The increase in production by 
approximately 45% is expected to improve the overall unit operating costs as the
fixed cost of operations is spread over a larger production base and the oxide 
ores are treated for the incremental operating costs. &nbsp;The operating and 
capital cost estimates are currently being updated as part of the DFS, which is 
due in Q3 2016. &nbsp;Readers are cautioned that until the DFS is in-hand, there
can be no certainty about these forward-looking estimates.</P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px"><BR></P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px; padding-right:-1.2px; font-
family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-size:9pt"><SUP>2</SUP> &nbsp;Based on Phase
2 PFS published on SEDAR June 29, 2015</P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px"><BR>
<BR></P>
<P style="margin:0px" align=right>10</P>
<P style="margin:0px" align=center><BR></P>
<P style="margin:0px"><BR></P>
<HR style="margin-bottom:9.6px; padding-top:9.6px" noshade size=1.333>
<P style="line-height:14pt; margin-top:12px; margin-bottom:0px; padding-
right:24px; font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-size:14pt; page-break-
before:always" align=justify><B>ASANKO GOLD INC.</B><FONT style="font-size:9pt">
</FONT></P>
<P style="line-height:14pt; margin:0px; font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; 
font-size:9pt">MANAGEMENT&#146;S DISCUSSION AND ANALYSIS</P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px; padding-bottom:4px; font-
family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-size:9pt; border-bottom:2px solid 
#000000">FOR THE THREE AND SIX MONTHS ENDED JUNE 30, 2016</P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px; padding-top:4px; border-top:2px solid 
#000000"><BR></P>
<P style="margin:0px"><BR></P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px; padding-right:-1.2px; font-
family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-size:9pt">Based on the current gold price 
environment, the Company is forecasting that it should be able to fund 
construction of Phase 2A from the cash flow from the existing operations. 
&nbsp;This position has been significantly enhanced by the Company&#146;s
renegotiation of the US$150 million loan facility in order defer repayment of 
the principal for two years (<B>see &#147;8. Liquidity and capital 
resources&#148; </B>below).<B> &nbsp;</B></P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px"><BR></P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px; padding-right:-1.2px; font-
family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-size:9pt"><B>Phase 2B</B></P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px"><BR></P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px; padding-right:-1.2px; font-
family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-size:9pt">The second stage of the project, 
Phase 2B, will expand the mining operation to mine both Esaase oxide and fresh 
ores and expand the processing facility with the construction of an additional 
5Mtpa milling and flotation plant for the exclusive processing of Esaase fresh 
ores. &nbsp;Production is expected to exceed 480,000 ounces per annum, with 
total processing capacity of 10Mtpa (3Mtpa from the Phase 1 deposit and 7Mtpa 
from Esaase). &nbsp;</P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px"><BR></P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px; padding-right:-1.2px; font-
family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-size:9pt">The capital cost is expected to 
be approximately US$170 - 210 million<SUP>2</SUP> and development of Phase 2B 
development will be staggered so that the capital cost will be funded from cash 
flow from operations. </P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px"><BR></P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px; padding-right:-1.2px; font-
family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-size:9pt">The current approach to phased 
development brings flexibility to the project execution timeline should market 
or financing conditions improve, thereby allowing the accelerated development of
Phase 2B.</P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px"><BR></P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px; padding-right:-1.2px; font-
family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-size:9pt"><B>Permitting</B></P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px"><BR></P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px; padding-right:-1.2px; font-
family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-size:9pt">A Phase 2 EIS was submitted to 
the EPA in June 2015 based on the revised scope for development of the Esaase 
project from a stand-alone operation. &nbsp;</P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px"><BR></P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px; padding-right:-1.2px; font-
family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-size:9pt">A Scoping Report and a draft 
Terms of Reference for the revised project proposal was prepared and submitted 
to the EPA in August 2015. &nbsp;Following extensive stakeholder engagement, the
Company has obtained the necessary support of local stakeholders. &nbsp;This 
support was formalized in a Public Hearing held by the Ghanaian EPA on April 19,
2016 at which the local stakeholders expressed their desire for Phase 2 to 
proceed.</P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px"><BR></P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px; padding-right:-1.2px; font-
family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-size:9pt">A final EIS has now been 
submitted for review and the Company expects to receive its Environment Permit 
for Phase 2 in Q4 2016.</P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px"><BR></P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px; font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; 
font-size:9pt"><B>Project Schedule</B></P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px"><BR></P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px; font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; 
font-size:9pt">The Phase 2 PFS was completed on the basis that construction of 
the Phase 2 expansion could commence as early as July 2016 with steady state 
operations of over 400,000 ounces per annum projected in 2018. &nbsp;A DFS is 
now underway which will optimize the mining operations by more efficiently 
sequencing the six open pit deposits into one integrated mining schedule, as 
well as evaluate process synergies and optimizations. &nbsp;A positive DFS, 
requisite permits and project financing will be required in order for the 
Company to make an investment decision, expected in Q4 2016, on whether to 
proceed with the expansion.</P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px"><BR></P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px; padding-right:-1.2px; font-
family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-size:9pt"><B>Key Milestones and Anticipated
Timelines:</B></P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px"><BR></P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:-2px; width:288px; 
font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-size:9pt; float:left">Complete Phase 2
DFS</P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px; padding-right:-1.2px; text-indent:-2px; 
font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-size:9pt">Q3 2016</P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:-2px; width:288px; 
font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-size:9pt; clear:left; 
float:left">Receive Environmental Permit</P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px; padding-right:-1.2px; text-indent:-2px; 
font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-size:9pt">Q4 2016</P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:-2px; width:288px; 
font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-size:9pt; clear:left; 
float:left">Investment Decision on Phase 2A</P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px; padding-right:-1.2px; text-indent:-2px; 
font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-size:9pt">Q4 2016</P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:-2px; width:288px; 
font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-size:9pt; clear:left; 
float:left">Start detailed design and Construction </P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px; padding-right:-1.2px; text-indent:-2px; 
font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-size:9pt">Q1 2017</P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:-2px; width:288px; 
font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-size:9pt; clear:left; 
float:left">Phase 2A complete</P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px; padding-right:-1.2px; text-indent:-2px; 
font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-size:9pt">Q4 2018</P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px; clear:left"><BR></P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px"><BR>
<BR></P>
<P style="margin:0px" align=right>11</P>
<P style="margin:0px" align=center><BR></P>
<P style="margin:0px"><BR></P>
<HR style="margin-bottom:9.6px; padding-top:9.6px" noshade size=1.333>
<P style="line-height:14pt; margin-top:12px; margin-bottom:0px; padding-
right:24px; font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-size:14pt; page-break-
before:always" align=justify><B>ASANKO GOLD INC.</B><FONT style="font-size:9pt">
</FONT></P>
<P style="line-height:14pt; margin:0px; font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; 
font-size:9pt">MANAGEMENT&#146;S DISCUSSION AND ANALYSIS</P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px; padding-bottom:4px; font-
family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-size:9pt; border-bottom:2px solid 
#000000">FOR THE THREE AND SIX MONTHS ENDED JUNE 30, 2016</P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px; padding-top:4px; border-top:2px solid 
#000000"><BR></P>
<P style="margin:0px"><BR></P>
<P style="margin:0px; font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-
size:11pt"><B>5.3 Exploration and evaluation</B></P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px" align=justify><BR></P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px; font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; 
font-size:9pt">Following a successful 2015 program that identified a series of 
advanced targets, a number of the targets are now being drilled with a goal of 
upgrading them into a category of resource status on a systematic basis. 
&nbsp;The Company is currently evaluating three near surface exploration targets
within short trucking distance of existing processing plant: Nkran Extension, 
Adubiaso Extension and Akwasiso.</P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px"><BR></P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px; font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; 
font-size:9pt">During Q2, the Nkran Extension resource estimate was completed 
with Measured &amp; Indicated Mineral Resources estimated at 758,658 tonnes at 
1.76g/t for 42,930 contained ounces of gold at 0.8 g/t cut-off. 
&nbsp;Previously, the Adubiaso Extension resource estimate was completed with
Measured &amp; Indicated Mineral Resources 628,600 tonnes at 1.89 g/t for 38,250
contained ounces of gold at 0.8 g/t cut-off. &nbsp;The newest larger target, 
Akwasiso, is the focus of current drilling with 4,200 meters drilled to date and
a Mineral Resource Estimate expected in Q4 2016.</P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px"><BR></P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px; font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; 
font-size:9pt" align=justify>The supplementary EIS for Adubiaso has been 
submitted and the requisite permits are expected to be granted during H2 2016. 
The Nkran extension permit applications are at an advanced stage of preparations
and will be lodged with the relevant regulatory bodies by the end of Q3 
2016.</P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px"><BR></P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px; font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; 
font-size:9pt"><B>Nkran Extension</B></P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px; font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; 
font-size:9pt" align=justify>The Nkran Extension (Annexure 1) is located on the 
Nkran shear structure, approximately 1.5km from the Nkran pit, and runs for 900m
North-South adjacent to the existing Tailings Storage Facility 
(&#147;TSF&#148;). The zone of interest was originally indicated from 
sterilization drilling for the TSF in 2013. </P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px" align=justify><BR></P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px; font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; 
font-size:9pt" align=justify>During Q1 2016 the zone was infilled by RC drilling
on a heel-toe 40m x 20m grid. Following the completed assaying of the 29 Reverse
Circulation (&#147;RC&#148;) drillholes (approximately 2,200m), a classified 
Mineral Resource has been estimated. Given these additional resources are part 
of and not a material addition to the estimated Asanko Gold Mine resources, no 
separate technical report will be prepared for them.</P>
<P style="margin:0px"><BR></P>
<P style="margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:6px; font-family:Calibri,Times New 
Roman; font-size:9pt" align=justify><B>Table 1: Nkran Extension &#150; Measured 
and Indicated Resources</B></P>
<TABLE style="margin-top:0px; font-size:10pt" cellpadding=0 cellspacing=0><TR 
height=0 style="font-size:0"><TD width=126 /><TD width=93.867 /><TD width=98.067
/><TD width=150.067 /></TR>

<P style="line-height:12pt; margin-top:4px; margin-bottom:0px; font-
family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-size:9pt" align=justify><B>Notes:</B></P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px; padding-right:-0.4px; font-
family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-size:9pt" align=justify>All figures are in 
metric tonnes and columns may not add up due to rounding. A gold cut-off grade 
of 0.8 g/t has been used. The Mineral Resources are stated as <I>in situ</I> 
tonnes. Individual densities were used per ore domain. The tonnages and contents
are stated as 100%, which means no attributable portions have been stated in the
table conversion from grams to ounces &#150; 31.10348.</P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px"><BR></P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px"><BR>
<BR></P>
<P style="margin:0px" align=right>12</P>
<P style="margin:0px" align=center><BR></P>
<P style="margin:0px"><BR></P>
<HR style="margin-bottom:9.6px; padding-top:9.6px" noshade size=1.333>
<P style="line-height:14pt; margin-top:12px; margin-bottom:0px; padding-
right:24px; font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-size:14pt; page-break-
before:always" align=justify><B>ASANKO GOLD INC.</B><FONT style="font-size:9pt">
</FONT></P>
<P style="line-height:14pt; margin:0px; font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; 
font-size:9pt">MANAGEMENT&#146;S DISCUSSION AND ANALYSIS</P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px; padding-bottom:4px; font-
family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-size:9pt; border-bottom:2px solid 
#000000">FOR THE THREE AND SIX MONTHS ENDED JUNE 30, 2016</P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px; padding-top:4px; border-top:2px solid 
#000000"><BR></P>
<P style="margin:0px"><BR></P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px; font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; 
font-size:9pt"><B>Adubiaso Pit Extension (previously announced, see press 
release dated April 27, 2016)</B></P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px; font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; 
font-size:9pt" align=justify>The Adubiaso pit (Annexure 1) is a previously mined
satellite pit at the Asanko Gold Mine which is estimated to contain 1.8 million 
tonnes of Proven and Probable Mineral Reserves at 2.07 g/t gold<SUP>3</SUP>. 
These Mineral Reserves lie predominantly under the old pit and form part of the 
current life-of-mine plan for the Asanko Gold Mine<SUP>2</SUP>. &nbsp;In 2015, 
mineralization in two zones over a 300m strike length extending to the North-
East of the existing pit were identified based on an analysis of historical 
drill hole data.</P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px"><BR></P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px; font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; 
font-size:9pt" align=justify>In the first quarter of 2016, the Company drilled 
20 holes (approximately 2,100 metres) of RC drilling and delineated a classified
Mineral Resource, as per the tables below.&nbsp;Given these additional resources
are part of and not a material addition to the estimated Asanko Gold Mine 
resources, no separate technical report will be prepared for them.</P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px" align=justify><BR></P>
<P style="margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:6px; font-family:Calibri,Times New 
Roman; font-size:9pt" align=justify><B>Table 1: Adubiaso Extension - Measured 
and Indicated Resources</B></P>
