<P style="line-height:12pt; margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:-2px; width:36px; 
font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-size:11pt; float:left"><B>10)</B></P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px; text-indent:-2px; font-
family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-size:11pt"><B>Summary of Outstanding Share 
Data</B></P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px; clear:left" align=justify><BR></P>
<P style="margin:0px; font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-size:9pt" 
align=justify>As of the date of this MD&amp;A, there were 201,294,832 common
shares of the Company issued and outstanding and 15,056,125 share purchase 
options and 4 million warrants outstanding (with exercise prices ranging between
C$1.85 and C$6.10 per share). The fully diluted outstanding share count at the 
date of this MD&amp;A is 220,350,957.</P>
<P style="margin:0px" align=justify><BR></P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:-2px; width:36px; 
font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-size:11pt; float:left"><B>11)</B></P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px; text-indent:-2px; font-
family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-size:11pt"><B>Related party 
transactions</B></P>
<P style="margin:0px; clear:left"><BR></P>
<P style="margin:0px; font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-size:9pt">As at 
June 30, 2016, the Company&#146;s related parties are its subsidiaries and key 
management personnel. &nbsp;During normal course of operations, the Company 
enters into transactions with its related parties. &nbsp;During the three and 
six months ended June 30, 2016 all related party transactions were in the normal
course of business including compensation payments to key management 
personnel.</P>
<P style="margin:0px"><BR></P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:-2px; width:36px; 
font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-size:11pt; float:left"><B>12)</B></P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px; text-indent:-2px; font-
family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-size:11pt"><B>Critical accounting policies 
and estimates</B></P>
<P style="margin:0px; clear:left"><BR></P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px; padding-right:-1.133px; font-
family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-size:9pt" align=justify><B>12.1 Estimates 
and judgements</B></P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px" align=justify><BR></P>
<P style="margin:0px; font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-size:9pt">The 
preparation of financial statements in conformity with IFRS requires management 
to make estimates and assumptions that affect amounts reported in the financial 
statements and accompanying notes. Management believes the estimates and 
assumptions used in these consolidated financial statements are reasonable, 
however, actual results could differ from those estimates and could impact 
future results of operations and cash flows. The Company&#146;s significant 
accounting judgments and estimates were presented in Note 3 of the audited 
annual consolidated financial statements for the year ended December 31, 2015 
and have been consistently applied in the preparation of these condensed interim
consolidated financial statements. New judgements and estimates applied for the 
three and six months ended June 30, 2016 relate to:</P>
<P style="margin:0px"><BR></P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px; font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; 
font-size:9pt" align=justify><B>Estimates</B></P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px" align=justify><BR></P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px; font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; 
font-size:9pt" align=justify><B>Depletion of mineral interests &#150;</B> 
estimates are made of recoverable ounces in the Company&#146;s mining properties
which are depleted based on recoverable tonnes contained in proven and probable 
reserves.</P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px" align=justify><BR></P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px; font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; 
font-size:9pt" align=justify><B>Inventory valuation of production costs</B> - 
the Company&#146;s management makes estimates of quantities of ore on stockpiles
and in process and the recoverable gold in this material to determine the cost 
of inventories and the average costs of finished goods sold </P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px" align=justify><BR>
<BR></P>
<P style="margin:0px" align=right>26</P>
<P style="margin:0px" align=center><BR></P>
<P style="margin:0px"><BR></P>
<HR style="margin-bottom:9.6px; padding-top:9.6px" noshade size=1.333>
<P style="line-height:14pt; margin-top:12px; margin-bottom:0px; padding-
right:24px; font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-size:14pt; page-break-
before:always" align=justify><B>ASANKO GOLD INC.</B><FONT style="font-size:9pt">
</FONT></P>
<P style="line-height:14pt; margin:0px; font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; 
font-size:9pt">MANAGEMENT&#146;S DISCUSSION AND ANALYSIS</P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px; padding-bottom:4px; font-
family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-size:9pt; border-bottom:2px solid 
#000000">FOR THE THREE AND SIX MONTHS ENDED JUNE 30, 2016</P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px; padding-top:4px; border-top:2px solid 
#000000"><BR></P>
<P style="margin:0px"><BR></P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px; font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; 
font-size:9pt" align=justify>during the period.</P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px" align=justify><BR></P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px; font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; 
font-size:9pt" align=justify><B>Net realizable value of inventory</B> - in order
to determine the net realizable value of gold-in-process and stockpiled ore, the
Company estimates future metal selling prices, production forecasts, realized 
grades and recoveries, timing of processing, and future costs to convert the 
respective inventories into saleable form.</P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px" align=justify><BR></P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px; font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; 
font-size:9pt" align=justify><B>Income taxes -</B> in assessing the probability 
of realizing income tax assets recognized, management makes estimates related to
expectations of future taxable income, applicable tax opportunities, expected 
timing of reversals of existing temporary differences and the likelihood that 
tax positions taken will be sustained upon examination by applicable tax 
authorities.</P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px" align=justify><BR></P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px; font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; 
font-size:9pt" align=justify><B>Deferred stripping</B> &#150; in order to 
determine whether stripping costs incurred during the production phase of a 
mining property relate to reserves and resources that will be mined in a future 
period and therefore should be capitalized, the Company makes estimates of the 
stripping activity over the life of the component of reserves and resources 
which have been made accessible. &nbsp;In addition, judgement is involved when 
allocating production costs between inventory produced and the stripping asset; 
the allocation is based on the volume of waste extracted compared with the 
expected volume, for a given volume of ore production.</P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px" align=justify><BR></P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px; font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; 
font-size:9pt" align=justify><B>Judgements</B></P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px; font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; 
font-size:9pt" align=justify><B>Arrangements containing a lease</B> - the 
Company&#146;s management assessed it&#146;s mining contract under IFRIC 4 
&#150; Determining whether an Arrangement contains a Lease, to assess whether 
contract contains a finance or operating lease. &nbsp;In order to determine 
whether the lease was an operating or finance lease, management had to make 
judgements with respect to the useful economic lives of the equipment identified
in the lease as well as how much of the costs associated with the mining 
contract related to use of the equipment and how much related to personnel 
charges.</P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px" align=justify><BR></P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px; font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; 
font-size:9pt" align=justify><B>Commercial production</B> -the Company&#146;s 
management determined that Phase 1 of the AGM was in commercial production 
effective April 1, 2016. &nbsp;The development phase ends and the production 
phase begins when the mine is in the condition necessary for it to be capable of
operating in a manner intended by management. &nbsp;The Company uses a number of
criteria to assess whether the mine has reached the commercial production phase.
&nbsp;These criteria include, but are not limited to:</P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px" align=justify><BR></P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:-2px; text-
indent:98.4px; width:146.4px; font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-
size:9pt; float:left">(i)</P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px; padding-left:146.4px; text-indent:-2px; 
font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-size:9pt" align=justify>Completion of 
operational commissioning of each major mine and plant component;</P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:-2px; text-
indent:98.4px; width:146.4px; font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-
size:9pt; clear:left; float:left">(ii)</P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px; padding-left:146.4px; text-indent:-2px; 
font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-size:9pt" align=justify>Demonstrated 
ability to mine and mill consistently and without significant interruption at a 
pre-determined average rate of designed capacity;</P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:-2px; text-
indent:98.4px; width:146.4px; font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-
size:9pt; clear:left; float:left">(iii)</P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px; padding-left:146.4px; text-indent:-2px; 
font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-size:9pt" align=justify>The passage of
a reasonable period of time for testing of all major mine and plant 
components;</P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:-2px; text-
indent:98.4px; width:146.4px; font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-
size:9pt; clear:left; float:left">(iv)</P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px; padding-left:146.4px; text-indent:-2px; 
font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-size:9pt" align=justify>Gold 
recoveries are at or near expected steady-state production levels;</P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:-2px; text-
indent:98.4px; width:146.4px; font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-
size:9pt; clear:left; float:left">(v)</P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px; padding-left:146.4px; text-indent:-2px; 
font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-size:9pt" align=justify>Level of 
capital expenditure is within 90% of the forecast final construction cost; 
and</P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:-2px; text-
indent:98.4px; width:146.4px; font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-
size:9pt; clear:left; float:left">(vi)</P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px; padding-left:146.4px; text-indent:-2px; 
font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-size:9pt" align=justify>A significant 
portion of available funding is directed towards operating activities.</P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px; clear:left" align=justify><BR></P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px; font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; 
font-size:9pt" align=justify><B>12.2 Changes in Accounting Policies including 
Initial Adoption</B></P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px" align=justify><BR></P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px; font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; 
font-size:9pt" align=justify>There has been no significant change in significant
accounting policies during the three and six months ended June 30, 2016, 
however, given that the Company declared commercial production at the AGM 
effective April 1, 2016, a number of the Company&#146;s accounting policies are 
being implemented for the first time in the three months ended June 30, 2016 and
as such a full list of the Company&#146;s accounting policies are presented in 
note 3 to the Company`s June 30, 2016 Condensed Consolidated Interim Financial 
Statements. </P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px" align=justify><BR></P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:-2px; width:36px; 
font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-size:11pt; float:left"><B>13)</B></P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px; text-indent:-2px; font-
family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-size:11pt"><B>Risks and 
uncertainties</B></P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px; clear:left" align=justify><BR></P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px; font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; 
font-size:9pt" align=justify><B>13.1 Financial instruments &amp; risk</B></P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px" align=justify><BR></P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px; font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; 
font-size:9pt" align=justify>As at June 30, 2016 the Company&#146;s financial 
instruments consist of cash and cash equivalents, receivables, reclamation bond,
accounts payable and accrued liabilities, long-term debt and an embedded
derivative in relation to an interest rate floor. &nbsp;The Company classifies 
cash and cash equivalents, receivables and the reclamation bond as loans and 
receivables, and classifies accounts payable and accrued liabilities and long-
term debt as other financial liabilities. &nbsp;The embedded derivative 
liability associated with the interest </P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px" align=justify><BR>
<BR></P>
<P style="margin:0px" align=right>27</P>
<P style="margin:0px" align=center><BR></P>
<P style="margin:0px"><BR></P>
<HR style="margin-bottom:9.6px; padding-top:9.6px" noshade size=1.333>
<P style="line-height:14pt; margin-top:12px; margin-bottom:0px; padding-
right:24px; font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-size:14pt; page-break-
before:always" align=justify><B>ASANKO GOLD INC.</B><FONT style="font-size:9pt">
</FONT></P>
<P style="line-height:14pt; margin:0px; font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; 
font-size:9pt">MANAGEMENT&#146;S DISCUSSION AND ANALYSIS</P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px; padding-bottom:4px; font-
family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-size:9pt; border-bottom:2px solid 
#000000">FOR THE THREE AND SIX MONTHS ENDED JUNE 30, 2016</P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px; padding-top:4px; border-top:2px solid 
#000000"><BR></P>
<P style="margin:0px"><BR></P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px; font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; 
font-size:9pt" align=justify>rate floor of the long-term loan is measured at 
fair value through profit or loss.</P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px" align=justify><BR></P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px; font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; 
font-size:9pt" align=justify>The fair value of these financial instruments 
approximates their carrying value, unless otherwise noted.</P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px" align=justify><BR></P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px; font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; 
font-size:9pt" align=justify>The risk exposure arising from these financial 
instruments is summarized as follows:</P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px" align=justify><BR></P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:-2px; text-
indent:24px; width:48px; font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-size:9pt; 
float:left">(a)</P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px; padding-left:48px; text-indent:-2px; 
font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-size:9pt" align=justify>Credit 
risk</P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px; clear:left" align=justify><BR></P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px; padding-left:48px; font-
family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-size:9pt" align=justify>Credit risk is the 
risk of an unexpected loss if a customer or the issuer of a financial instrument
fails to meet its contractual obligations. The Company is subject to credit risk
on the cash and cash equivalent balances held at banks in each of Canada, Ghana 
and South Africa. The majority of the Company&#146;s cash is held in Canadian 
based banking institutions, authorized under the Bank Act (Canada) to accept 
deposits. As at June 30, 2016, the Company had interest receivable of $0.1 
million (December 31, 2015 - $nil). &nbsp;In addition, the Company is subject to
credit risk in relation the receivable balances relating to the sale of gold. 
&nbsp;The Company currently sells all of the gold it produces to Red Kite under 
an offtake agreement. &nbsp;The risk associated with receivables from Red Kite 
as at June 30, 2016 is considered to be negligible. </P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px" align=justify><BR></P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:-2px; text-
indent:24px; width:48px; font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-size:9pt; 
float:left">(b)</P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px; padding-left:48px; text-indent:-2px; 
font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-size:9pt" align=justify>Liquidity 
risk</P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px; clear:left" align=justify><BR></P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px; padding-left:48px; font-
family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-size:9pt" align=justify>The Company&#146;s 
approach to managing liquidity is to ensure that it will have sufficient 
liquidity to settle obligations and liabilities as they fall due. As at June 30,
2016 the Company had a cash and cash equivalents balance of $34.5 million 
(December 31, 2015 &#150; $114.8 million) and is generating positive cash flows 
from operations, allowing it to settle current accounts payable and accrued 
liabilities of $35.6 million (December 31, 2015 - $34.8 million) and current 
debt of $8.7 million.</P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px" align=justify><BR></P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:-2px; text-
indent:24px; width:48px; font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-size:9pt; 
float:left">(c)</P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px; padding-left:48px; text-indent:-2px; 
font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-size:9pt" align=justify>Market 
risk</P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px; clear:left" align=justify><BR></P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:-2px; text-
indent:48px; width:84px; font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-size:9pt; 
float:left">(i)</P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px; padding-left:84px; text-indent:-2px; 
font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-size:9pt" align=justify>Interest rate 
risk</P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px; clear:left" align=justify><BR></P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px; padding-left:84px; font-
family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-size:9pt" align=justify>Interest rate risk 
is the risk that the fair value or future cash flows of a financial instrument 
will fluctuate because of changes in market interest rates. &nbsp;The 
Company&#146;s exposure to interest rate risk is limited to its loan agreement 
with Red Kite, which is subject to an interest rate of LIBOR plus 6% with a 
minimum LIBOR of 1%. The Company&#146;s sensitivity to a 1% decrease or increase
in market rates of interest would have an immaterial effect on the 
Company&#146;s interest expense/income for the three and six months ended June 
30, 2016.</P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px" align=justify><BR></P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:-2px; text-
indent:48px; width:72px; font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-size:9pt; 
float:left">(ii)</P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px; padding-left:96px; text-indent:-2px; 
font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-size:9pt" align=justify>Foreign 
currency risk</P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px; clear:left" align=justify><BR></P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px; padding-left:84px; text-indent:0.467px; 
font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-size:9pt" align=justify>The Company is
exposed to foreign currency risk through its foreign currency monetary assets 
and liabilities. A significant change in the currency exchange rate between the 
US dollar and Canadian dollar (CAD) and South African rand (ZAR) could have an 
effect on the Company&#146;s results of operations, financial position and cash 
flows. &nbsp;During the year ended December 31, 2015, the Company had entered 
into a series of forward contracts to purchase a total of ZAR 346.6 million in 
exchange for Canadian and US dollars at specified exchange rates; all such 
contracts expired by February 2016. &nbsp;The Company at present has not entered
into any further derivative instruments to reduce its exposure to currency risk,
however, management monitors differing currency needs and tries to reduce its 
exposure to currency risks through exchanging currencies at what are considered 
to be optimal times. </P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px" align=justify><BR></P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:-2px; text-
indent:48px; width:84px; font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-size:9pt; 
float:left">(iii)</P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px; padding-left:84px; text-indent:-2px; 
font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-size:9pt" align=justify>Price risk 
</P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px; clear:left" align=justify><BR></P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px; padding-left:84px; font-
family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-size:9pt" align=justify>Other price risk is
the risk that the future cash flows of a financial instrument will fluctuate 
because of changes in market prices, other than those arising from currency risk
or interest rate risk. The Company poured its first gold in January 2016 and 
staring selling refined gold during the first quarter 2016. &nbsp;The 
Company&#146;s future cash flows fluctuate due to changes in gold and silver 
price.</P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px" align=justify><BR>
<BR></P>
<P style="margin:0px" align=right>28</P>
<P style="margin:0px" align=center><BR></P>
<P style="margin:0px"><BR></P>
<HR style="margin-bottom:9.6px; padding-top:9.6px" noshade size=1.333>
<P style="line-height:14pt; margin-top:12px; margin-bottom:0px; padding-
right:24px; font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-size:14pt; page-break-
before:always" align=justify><B>ASANKO GOLD INC.</B><FONT style="font-size:9pt">
</FONT></P>
<P style="line-height:14pt; margin:0px; font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; 
font-size:9pt">MANAGEMENT&#146;S DISCUSSION AND ANALYSIS</P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px; padding-bottom:4px; font-
family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-size:9pt; border-bottom:2px solid 
#000000">FOR THE THREE AND SIX MONTHS ENDED JUNE 30, 2016</P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px; padding-top:4px; border-top:2px solid 
#000000"><BR></P>
<P style="margin:0px"><BR></P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px" align=justify><BR></P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:-2px; text-
indent:24px; width:48px; font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-size:9pt; 
float:left">(d)</P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px; padding-left:48px; text-indent:-2px; 
font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-size:9pt" align=justify>Fair 
values</P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px; clear:left" align=justify><BR></P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:-2px; text-
indent:48px; width:84px; font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-size:9pt; 
float:left">(i)</P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px; padding-left:48px; text-indent:-2px; 
font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-size:9pt" align=justify>Foreign 
currency forward contracts derivative</P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px; clear:left" align=justify><BR></P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px; padding-left:84px; text-indent:1.333px; 
font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-size:9pt" align=justify>During the 
year ended December 31, 2015, the Company entered into a series of forward 
contracts to purchase ZAR in exchange for Canadian and US dollars at specified 
exchange rates. These forward contracts had settlement terms that range from one
month to eleven months. &nbsp;At December 31, 2015, the Company had outstanding 
foreign currency forward contracts to buy ZAR 6.0 million in exchange for C$0.6 
million with settlement dates between one and two months.</P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px" align=justify><BR></P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px; padding-left:84px; font-
family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-size:9pt" align=justify>The fair values of 
outstanding foreign currency forward contracts are determined using the forward 
rates at the measurement date, with the resulting value discounted to present 
value and are categorized within level 2 of the fair value hierarchy. &nbsp;All 
such forward contracts expired by February 2016 and as such there is no forward 
contract derivative liability recorded by the Company as at June 30, 2016. 
&nbsp;At December 31, 2015, the outstanding contracts had a fair value of 
$36.</P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px" align=justify><BR></P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:-2px; text-
indent:48px; width:84px; font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-size:9pt; 
float:left">(ii)</P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px; padding-left:84px; text-indent:-2px; 
font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-size:9pt" align=justify>Embedded
derivative</P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px; clear:left" align=justify><BR></P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px; padding-left:84px; font-
family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-size:9pt" align=justify>The embedded 
derivative liability associated with the interest rate floor of the long-term 
loan is categorized within level 2 of the fair value hierarchy. The fair value 
of the embedded derivative liability associated with the interest rate floor was
estimated using the three-month LIBOR forward rates to 2020 ranging from 0.62% 
to 1.41% using an option pricing model. &nbsp;As at June 30, 2016, the embedded 
derivative liability had a fair value and carrying value of $1.8 million 
(December 31, 2015: $536).</P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px"><BR></P>
<P style=margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:-1pt;font-size:1pt /><P style="line-
height:12pt; margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:-2px; text-indent:24px; width:48px;

<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px"><BR></P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px; font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; 
font-size:9pt" align=justify><B>13.2 Other risks and uncertainties</B></P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px"><BR></P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px; font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; 
font-size:9pt">The Company&#146;s process to manage its risks and other 
uncertainties, including the risks related to the Company&#146;s foreign 
operations, government, environmental, and other regulations, and operating 
costs is continuous and dynamic. Changes to these risks that result from 
changing internal and external factors are evaluated on a quarterly basis and 
significant changes in risks and corresponding mitigation activities are 
reported quarterly to the Company&#146;s Board of Directors. A detailed 
discussion of the Company's risks can be found in the Company&#146;s Annual 
Information Form dated March 17, 2016 filed at www.sedar.com. </P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px"><BR></P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px"><BR>
<BR></P>
<P style="margin:0px" align=right>29</P>
<P style="margin:0px" align=center><BR></P>
<P style="margin:0px"><BR></P>
<HR style="margin-bottom:9.6px; padding-top:9.6px" noshade size=1.333>
<P style="line-height:14pt; margin-top:12px; margin-bottom:0px; padding-
right:24px; font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-size:14pt; page-break-
before:always" align=justify><B>ASANKO GOLD INC.</B><FONT style="font-size:9pt">
</FONT></P>
<P style="line-height:14pt; margin:0px; font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; 
font-size:9pt">MANAGEMENT&#146;S DISCUSSION AND ANALYSIS</P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px; padding-bottom:4px; font-
family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-size:9pt; border-bottom:2px solid 
#000000">FOR THE THREE AND SIX MONTHS ENDED JUNE 30, 2016</P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px; padding-top:4px; border-top:2px solid 
#000000"><BR></P>
<P style="margin:0px"><BR></P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:-2px; width:36px; 
font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-size:11pt; float:left"><B>14)</B></P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px; text-indent:-2px; font-
family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-size:11pt"><B>Internal control</B></P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px; clear:left"><BR></P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px; padding-left:48px; text-indent:-48px; 
font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-size:9pt"><B>14.1 Disclosure Controls 
and Procedures </B></P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px"><BR></P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px; font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; 
font-size:9pt" align=justify>Evaluation of Disclosure Controls and Procedures 
are designed to provide reasonable assurance that all relevant information is 
gathered and reported to senior management, including the Company&#146;s Chief 
Executive Officer and Chief Financial Officer, on a timely basis so that 
appropriate decisions can be made regarding public disclosure. Internal control 
over financial reporting is a process designed to provide reasonable assurance 
regarding the reliability of financial reporting and the preparation of 
financial statements for external purposes in accordance with IFRS. Management 
of the Company, with the participation of the Chief Executive Officer and the 
Chief Financial Officer, have evaluated the design and effectiveness of the 
Company&#146;s disclosure controls and procedures and the design as required by 
Canadian and United States securities legislation, and have concluded that such 
procedures are adequate to ensure accurate, complete and timely disclosures in 
public filings. </P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px"><BR></P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px; padding-left:48px; text-indent:-48px; 
font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-size:9pt"><B>14.2 Internal Controls 
Over Financial Reporting </B></P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px"><BR></P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px; font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; 
font-size:9pt" align=justify>The Company&#146;s management, with the 
participation of its President and Chief Executive Officer and Chief Financial 
Officer, is responsible for establishing and maintaining adequate internal 
control over financial reporting. Under the supervision of the President and 
Chief Executive Officer and Chief Financial Officer, the Company&#146;s internal
control over financial reporting is a process designed to provide reasonable 
assurance regarding the reliability of financial reporting and the preparation 
of financial statements for external purposes in accordance with IFRS. The 
Company&#146;s internal control over financial reporting includes policies and 
procedures that: </P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px" align=justify><BR></P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px; padding-left:9.467px; text-indent:-
9.467px; font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-size:9pt" 
align=justify>&#149; pertain to the maintenance of records that accurately and 
fairly reflect, in reasonable detail, the transactions and dispositions of 
assets of the Company;</P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px; padding-left:9.467px; text-indent:-
9.467px; font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-size:9pt" 
align=justify>&#149; provide reasonable assurance that transactions are recorded
as necessary to permit preparation of financial statements in accordance with 
IFRS and that the Company&#146;s receipts and expenditures are made only in 
accordance with authorizations of management and the Company&#146;s Directors; 
and</P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px; padding-left:9.467px; text-indent:-
9.467px; font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-size:9pt" 
align=justify>&#149; provide reasonable assurance regarding prevention or timely
detection of unauthorized acquisition, use, or disposition of the Company&#146;s
assets that could have a material effect on the Company&#146;s consolidated 
financial statements. </P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px" align=justify><BR></P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px; font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; 
font-size:9pt" align=justify>There has been no change in the Company&#146;s 
internal control over financial reporting during the six months ended June 30, 
2016 that has materially affected, or is reasonably likely to materially affect,
the Company&#146;s internal control over financial reporting, with the exception
of new controls which have been implemented with respect to the recording of 
financial results upon and since the commencement of commercial production.</P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px" align=justify><BR></P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px; font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; 
font-size:9pt" align=justify><B>14.3 Limitations of controls and procedures 
</B></P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px" align=justify><BR></P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px; font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; 
font-size:9pt" align=justify>Evaluation of Disclosure Controls and Procedures 
are designed to provide reasonable assurance that all relevant information is 
gathered and reported to senior management, including the Company&#146;s Chief 
Executive Officer and Chief Financial Officer, on a timely basis so that 
appropriate decisions can be made regarding public disclosure. Internal control 
over financial reporting is a process designed to provide reasonable assurance 
regarding the reliability of financial reporting and the preparation of 
financial statements for external purposes in accordance with IFRS. Management 
of the Company, with the participation of the Chief Executive Officer and the 
Chief Financial Officer, have evaluated the design and effectiveness of the 
Company&#146;s disclosure controls and procedures and the design as required by 
Canadian and United States securities legislation as at the end of the period 
covered by this report, and have concluded that such procedures are adequate to 
ensure accurate, complete and timely disclosures in public filings. </P>
<P style="margin:0px"><BR></P>
<P style="margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:-2px; width:36px; font-
family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-size:11pt; float:left"><B>15)</B></P>
<P style="margin:0px; text-indent:-2px; font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; 
font-size:11pt"><B>Cautionary statements</B></P>
<P style="margin:0px; clear:left"><BR></P>
<P style="margin:0px; font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-
size:9pt"><B>15.1 Cautionary statement on forward-looking information</B></P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px" align=justify><BR></P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px; padding-right:-7.2px; font-
family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-size:9pt" align=justify>This MD&amp;A may 
contain &#147;forward-looking statements&#148; which reflect the Company&#146;s 
current expectations regarding the future results of operations, performance and
achievements of the Company, including but not limited to statements with 
respect to the Company&#146;s </P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px" align=justify><BR>
<BR></P>
<P style="margin:0px" align=right>30</P>
<P style="margin:0px" align=center><BR></P>
<P style="margin:0px"><BR></P>
<HR style="margin-bottom:9.6px; padding-top:9.6px" noshade size=1.333>
<P style="line-height:14pt; margin-top:12px; margin-bottom:0px; padding-
right:24px; font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-size:14pt; page-break-
before:always" align=justify><B>ASANKO GOLD INC.</B><FONT style="font-size:9pt">
</FONT></P>
<P style="line-height:14pt; margin:0px; font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; 
font-size:9pt">MANAGEMENT&#146;S DISCUSSION AND ANALYSIS</P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px; padding-bottom:4px; font-
family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-size:9pt; border-bottom:2px solid 
#000000">FOR THE THREE AND SIX MONTHS ENDED JUNE 30, 2016</P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px; padding-top:4px; border-top:2px solid 
#000000"><BR></P>
<P style="margin:0px"><BR></P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px; padding-right:-7.2px; font-
family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-size:9pt" align=justify>plans or future 
financial or operating performance, the estimation of mineral reserves and 
resources, conclusions of economic assessments of projects, the timing and 
amount of estimated future production, costs of future production, future 
capital expenditures, costs and timing of the development of &nbsp;deposits, 
success of exploration activities, permitting time lines, requirements for 
additional capital, sources and timing of additional financing, realization of 
unused tax benefits and future outcome of legal and tax matters.</P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px" align=justify><BR></P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px; padding-right:-7.2px; font-
family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-size:9pt" align=justify>The Company has 
tried, wherever possible, to identify these forward-looking statements by, among
other things, using words such as &#147;anticipate,&#148; &#147;believe,&#148; 
&#147;estimate,&#148; &#147;expect&#148;, &#147;budget&#148;, or variations of 
such words and phrases or state that certain actions, events or results 
&#147;may&#148;, &#147;could&#148;, &#147;would&#148;, &#147;might&#148; or 
&#147;will be taken&#148;, &#147;occur&#148; or &#147;be achieved&#148;. 
&nbsp;The statements reflect the current beliefs of the management of the 
Company, and are based on currently available information. &nbsp;Accordingly, 
these statements are subject to known and unknown risks, uncertainties and other
factors, which could cause the actual results, performance, or achievements of 
the Issuer to differ materially from those expressed in, or implied by, these 
statements. These uncertainties are factors that include but are not limited to 
risks related to international operations; risks related to general economic 
conditions and credit availability, uncertainty related to the resolution of 
legal disputes and lawsuits; actual results of current exploration activities, 
unanticipated reclamation expenses; fluctuations in prices of gold; fluctuations
in foreign currency exchange rates, increases in market prices of mining 
consumables, possible variations in mineral resources, grade or recovery rates; 
accidents, labour disputes, title disputes, claims and limitations on insurance 
coverage and other risks of the mining industry; delays in obtaining 
governmental approvals or financing or in the completion of development or 
construction activities, changes in national and local government regulation of 
mining operations, mineral tenure rules, tax rules and regulations, and 
political and economic developments in countries in which the Company operates, 
as well as those factors discussed in the 40-F filing for the year ended 
December 31, 2015, available under the Company&#146;s profile on SEDAR at 
www.sedar.com. </P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px" align=justify><BR></P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px; font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; 
font-size:9pt" align=justify>The Company&#146;s management reviews periodically 
information reflected in forward-looking statements. The Company has and 
continues to disclose in its Management&#146;s Discussion and Analysis and other
publicly filed documents, changes to material factors or assumptions underlying 
the forward-looking statements and to the validity of the statements themselves,
in the period the changes occur.</P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px" align=justify><BR></P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px; padding-right:-7.2px; font-
family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-size:9pt" align=justify>Historical results 
of operations and trends that may be inferred from the following discussions and
analysis may not necessarily indicate future results from operations. 
&nbsp;Historically, the Company&#146;s operations have been primarily funded 
from share issuances through private placements and the exercise of warrants and
share-based options. The Company has and may continue to have capital 
requirements in excess of its currently available resources. In the event the 
Company&#146;s plans change, its assumptions change or prove inaccurate, or its 
capital resources in addition to projected cash flow, if any, prove to be 
insufficient to fund its future operations, the Company may be required to seek 
additional financing. </P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px" align=justify><BR></P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px; padding-right:-7.2px; font-
family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-size:9pt" align=justify>Although the 
Company has been successful in raising capital, there can be no assurance that 
the Company will have sufficient financing to meet its future capital 
requirements or that additional financing will be available on terms acceptable 
to the Company in the future. </P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px" align=justify><BR></P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px; font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; 
font-size:9pt">Readers are cautioned that there can be no certainty that Phase 2
of the Project will be built or that the overall conclusions of the Definitive 
Feasibility Study will confirm the June 29, 2015 PFS &nbsp;outcomes for the AGM,
which is on file at <FONT style="color:#0000FF"><U>www.sedar.com</U></FONT><FONT
style="color:#0000FF"><U></U></FONT>.</P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px"><BR></P>
<P style="margin:0px; font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-
size:9pt"><B>15.2 Cautionary note for United States investors</B></P>
<P style="margin:0px"><BR></P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px; padding-right:-7.2px; font-
family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-size:9pt" align=justify>As a British 
Columbia corporation and a &#147;reporting issuer&#148; under Canadian 
securities laws, the Company is subject to certain rules and regulations issued 
by Canadian Securities Administrators. The Company is required to provide 
detailed information regarding its properties including mineralization, 
drilling, sampling and analysis, on security of samples and mineral reserve 
estimates under Canadian National Instrument 43-101 (&#147;NI 43-101&#148;). The
United States Securities and Exchange Commission applies different standards 
than the standards under NI 43-101 in order to classify mineralization as a 
reserve. Accordingly, mineral reserve estimates contained in this MD&amp;A may 
not qualify as &#147;reserves&#148; under SEC standards. Further, the Company 
describes any mineral resources associated with its properties utilizing 
terminology such as &#147;measured resources&#148;, &#147;indicated 
resources&#148; or &#147;inferred resources&#148; which are terms recognized by 
Canadian regulators under NI 43-101 but not recognized by the United 
States&#146; Securities and Exchange Commission. United States investors are 
cautioned not to assume that any part or all of the mineral deposits in these 
categories will ever be converted into mineral reserves. These terms have a 
greater amount of uncertainty as to their existence and feasibility than 
reserves </P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px" align=justify><BR>
<BR></P>
<P style="margin:0px" align=right>31</P>
<P style="margin:0px" align=center><BR></P>
<P style="margin:0px"><BR></P>
<HR style="margin-bottom:9.6px; padding-top:9.6px" noshade size=1.333>
<P style="line-height:14pt; margin-top:12px; margin-bottom:0px; padding-
right:24px; font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-size:14pt; page-break-
before:always" align=justify><B>ASANKO GOLD INC.</B><FONT style="font-size:9pt">
</FONT></P>
<P style="line-height:14pt; margin:0px; font-family:Calibri,Times New Roman; 
font-size:9pt">MANAGEMENT&#146;S DISCUSSION AND ANALYSIS</P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px; padding-bottom:4px; font-
family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-size:9pt; border-bottom:2px solid 
#000000">FOR THE THREE AND SIX MONTHS ENDED JUNE 30, 2016</P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px; padding-top:4px; border-top:2px solid 
#000000"><BR></P>
<P style="margin:0px"><BR></P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px; padding-right:-7.2px; font-
family:Calibri,Times New Roman; font-size:9pt" align=justify>recognized by the 
United States Securities and Exchange Commission. Further, &#147;inferred 
resources&#148; have a great amount of uncertainty as to their existence and as 
to whether they can be mined legally or economically. Therefore, United States 
investors are also cautioned not to assume that all or any part of the 
&#147;inferred resources&#148; exist. United States investors are also cautioned
that disclosure of exploration potential is conceptual in nature by definition 
and there is no assurance that exploration of the mineral potential identified 
will result in any category of NI 43-101 mineral resources being identified.</P>
<P style="margin:0px"><BR></P>
<P style="margin:0px"><BR>

<P style="margin:0px" align=right>32</P>

<DOCUMENT>
<TYPE>EX-99.3
<SEQUENCE>6
<FILENAME>exhibit993.htm
<DESCRIPTION>CEO CERTIFICATION
<TEXT>
<!doctype html public "-//IETF//DTD HTML//EN">
<HTML>
<HEAD>
<TITLE>Exhibit 99.3</TITLE>
<META NAME="date" CONTENT="08/08/2016">
</HEAD>
<BODY style="margin-top:0;font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10pt; 
color:#000000">
<DIV style="width:652.8px"><P style="margin:0px" align=right><BR></P>
<P style="margin:0px"><BR></P>
<P style="margin:0px" align=center><B>Form 52-109F2</B></P>
<P style="margin:0px" align=center><B>Certification of interim filings - full 
certificate</B></P>
<P style="margin:0px" align=justify><BR></P>
<P style="margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:13.333px" align=justify>I, Peter Breese,
Chief Executive Officer of Asanko Gold Inc., certify the following:</P>
<P style="margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:-2px; width:48px; float:left">1.</P>
<P style="margin:0px; padding-left:48px; text-indent:-2px" 
align=justify><B><I>Review:</I> </B>I have reviewed the interim financial report
and interim MD&amp;A (together, the &#147;interim filings&#148;) of Asanko Gold 
Inc. (the &#147;issuer&#148;) for the interim period ended June 30, 2016.</P>
<P style="margin:0px; clear:left" align=justify><BR></P>
<P style="margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:-2px; width:48px; float:left">2.</P>
<P style="margin:0px; padding-left:48px; text-indent:-2px" 
align=justify><B><I>No misrepresentations:</I> </B>Based on my knowledge, having
exercised reasonable diligence, the interim filings do not contain any untrue 
statement of a material fact or omit to state a material fact required to be 
stated or that is necessary to make a statement not misleading in light of the 
circumstances under which it was made, with respect to the period covered by the
interim filings.</P>
<P style="margin:0px; clear:left" align=justify><BR></P>
<P style="margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:-2px; text-indent:24px; width:48px; 
float:left"><B><I>3.</I></B></P>
<P style="margin:0px; padding-left:48px; text-indent:-2px" 
align=justify><B><I>Fair presentation:</I> </B>Based on my knowledge, having 
exercised reasonable diligence, the interim financial report together with the 
other financial information included in the interim filings fairly present in 
all material respects the financial condition, financial performance and cash 
flows of the issuer, as of the date of and for the periods presented in the 
interim filings. </P>
<P style="margin:0px; clear:left" align=justify><BR></P>
<P style="margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:-2px; text-indent:24px; width:48px; 
float:left"><B><I>4.</I></B></P>
<P style="margin:0px; padding-left:48px; text-indent:-2px" 
align=justify><B><I>Responsibility: </I></B>The issuer&#146;s other certifying 
officer and I are responsible for establishing and maintaining disclosure 
controls and procedures (DC&amp;P) and internal control over financial reporting
(ICFR), as those terms are defined in National Instrument 52-109 
<I>Certification of Disclosure in Issuers&#146; Annual and Interim Filings,</I> 
for the issuer.</P>
<P style="margin:0px; clear:left" align=justify><BR></P>
<P style="margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:-2px; text-indent:24px; width:48px; 
float:left"><B><I>5.</I></B></P>
<P style="margin:0px; padding-left:48px; text-indent:-2px" 
align=justify><B><I>Design:</I></B> &nbsp;Subject to the limitations, if any, 
described in paragraphs 5.2 and 5.3, the issuer&#146;s other certifying 
officer(s) and I have, as at the end of the period covered by the interim 
filings</P>
<P style="margin:0px; clear:left" align=justify><BR></P>
<P style="margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:-2px; text-indent:48px; width:96px; 
float:left">(a) </P>
<P style="margin:0px; padding-left:96px; text-indent:-2px"
align=justify>designed DC&amp;P, or caused it to be designed under our 
supervision, to provide reasonable assurance that </P>
<P style="margin:0px; clear:left" align=justify><BR></P>
<P style="margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:-2px; text-indent:96px; width:144px; 
float:left">(i)</P>
<P style="margin:0px; padding-left:144px; text-indent:-2px" 
align=justify>material information relating to the issuer is made known to us by
others, particularly during the period in which the interim filings are being 
prepared; and</P>
<P style="margin:0px; clear:left" align=justify><BR></P>
<P style="margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:-2px; text-indent:96px; width:144px; 
float:left">(ii)</P>
<P style="margin:0px; padding-left:144px; text-indent:-2px" 
align=justify>information required to be disclosed by the issuer in its annual 
filings, interim filings or other reports filed or submitted by it under 
securities legislation is recorded, processed, summarized and reported within 
the time periods specified in securities legislation; and </P>
<P style="margin:0px; clear:left" align=justify><BR></P>
<P style="margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:-2px; text-indent:48px; width:96px; 
float:left">(b) </P>
<P style="margin:0px; padding-left:96px; text-indent:-2px" 
align=justify>designed ICFR, or caused it to be designed under our supervision, 
to provide reasonable assurance regarding the reliability of financial reporting
and the preparation of financial statements for external purposes in accordance 
with the issuer&#146;s GAAP.</P>
<P style="margin:0px; clear:left" align=justify><BR></P>
<P style="margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:-2px; width:48px; float:left">5.1</P>
<P style="margin:0px; padding-left:48px; text-indent:-2px" 
align=justify><B><I>Control framework:</I></B> &nbsp;The control framework the 
issuer&#146;s other certifying officer and I used to design the issuer&#146;s 
ICFR is based on Internal Control &#150; Integrated Framework issued by the 
Committee of Sponsoring Organizations of the Treadway Commission.<I> </I></P>
<P style="margin:0px; clear:left" align=justify><BR></P>
<P style="margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:-2px; width:48px; float:left">5.2</P>
<P style="margin:0px; padding-left:48px; text-indent:-2px" 
align=justify><B><I>ICFR &#150; material weakness relating to design: 
</I></B>N/A</P>
<P style="margin:0px; clear:left" align=justify><BR></P>
<P style="margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:-2px; width:48px; float:left">5.3</P>
<P style="margin:0px; padding-left:48px; text-indent:-2px" 
align=justify><B><I>Limitation on scope of design:</I></B> &nbsp;N/A</P>
<P style="margin:0px; clear:left" align=justify><BR></P>
<P style="margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:-2px; width:48px; float:left">6.</P>
<P style="margin:0px; padding-left:48px; text-indent:-2px" 
align=justify><B><I>Reporting changes in ICFR:</I> </B>The issuer has disclosed 
in its interim MD&amp;A any change in the issuer&#146;s ICFR that occurred 
during the period beginning on April 1, 2016 and ended on June 30, 2016 that has
materially affected, or is reasonably likely to materially affect, the 
issuer&#146;s ICFR. </P>
<P style="margin:0px; clear:left" align=justify><BR></P>
<P style="margin:0px" align=justify>Date: <B>August 12, 2016</B></P>
<P style="margin:0px" align=justify><BR></P>
<P style="margin:0px" align=justify><I>//Peter Breese</I></P>
<P style="margin:0px" align=justify>_______________________</P>
<P style="margin:0px" align=justify>Peter Breese</P>
<P style="margin:0px" align=justify>Chief Executive Officer</P>
<P style="margin:0px" align=justify><BR></P>
<P style="margin:0px" align=justify><BR>
<BR></P>
</DIV></BODY>

</HTML>
</TEXT>

<DOCUMENT>
<TYPE>EX-99.4
<SEQUENCE>7
<FILENAME>exhibit994.htm
<DESCRIPTION>CFO CERTIFICATION
<TEXT>
<!doctype html public "-//IETF//DTD HTML//EN">
<HTML>
<HEAD>
<TITLE>Exhibit 99.4</TITLE>
<META NAME="date" CONTENT="08/08/2016">
</HEAD>
<BODY style="margin-top:0;font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10pt; 
color:#000000">
<DIV style="width:652.8px"><P style="margin:0px" align=right><BR></P>
<P style="margin:0px"><BR></P>
<P style="margin:0px" align=center><B>Form 52-109F2</B></P>
<P style="margin:0px" align=center><B>Certification of interim filings - full 
certificate</B></P>
<P style="margin:0px" align=justify><BR></P>
<P style="margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:13.333px" align=justify>I, Greg McCunn, 
Chief Financial Officer of Asanko Gold Inc., certify the following:</P>
<P style="margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:-2px; width:48px; float:left">1.</P>
<P style="margin:0px; padding-left:48px; text-indent:-2px" 
align=justify><B><I>Review:</I> </B>I have reviewed the interim financial report
and interim MD&amp;A (together, the &#147;interim filings&#148;) of Asanko Gold 
Inc. (the &#147;issuer&#148;) for the interim period ended June 30, 2016.</P>
<P style="margin:0px; clear:left" align=justify><BR></P>
<P style="margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:-2px; width:48px; float:left">2.</P>
<P style="margin:0px; padding-left:48px; text-indent:-2px" 
align=justify><B><I>No misrepresentations:</I> </B>Based on my knowledge, having
exercised reasonable diligence, the interim filings do not contain any untrue 
statement of a material fact or omit to state a material fact required to be 
stated or that is necessary to make a statement not misleading in light of the 
circumstances under which it was made, with respect to the period covered by the
interim filings.</P>
<P style="margin:0px; clear:left" align=justify><BR></P>
<P style="margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:-2px; text-indent:24px; width:48px; 
float:left"><B><I>3.</I></B></P>
<P style="margin:0px; padding-left:48px; text-indent:-2px" 
align=justify><B><I>Fair presentation:</I> </B>Based on my knowledge, having 
exercised reasonable diligence, the interim financial report together with the 
other financial information included in the interim filings fairly present in 
all material respects the financial condition, financial performance and cash 
flows of the issuer, as of the date of and for the periods presented in the 
interim filings. </P>
<P style="margin:0px; clear:left" align=justify><BR></P>
<P style="margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:-2px; text-indent:24px; width:48px; 
float:left"><B><I>4.</I></B></P>
<P style="margin:0px; padding-left:48px; text-indent:-2px" 
align=justify><B><I>Responsibility: </I></B>The issuer&#146;s other certifying 
officer and I are responsible for establishing and maintaining disclosure 
controls and procedures (DC&amp;P) and internal control over financial reporting
(ICFR), as those terms are defined in National Instrument 52-109 
<I>Certification of Disclosure in Issuers&#146; Annual and Interim Filings,</I> 
for the issuer.</P>
<P style="margin:0px; clear:left" align=justify><BR></P>
<P style="margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:-2px; text-indent:24px; width:48px; 
float:left"><B><I>5.</I></B></P>
<P style="margin:0px; padding-left:48px; text-indent:-2px" 
align=justify><B><I>Design:</I></B> &nbsp;Subject to the limitations, if any, 
described in paragraphs 5.2 and 5.3, the issuer&#146;s other certifying 
officer(s) and I have, as at the end of the period covered by the interim 
filings</P>
<P style="margin:0px; clear:left" align=justify><BR></P>
<P style="margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:-2px; text-indent:48px; width:96px; 
float:left">(a) </P>
<P style="margin:0px; padding-left:96px; text-indent:-2px" 
align=justify>designed DC&amp;P, or caused it to be designed under our 
supervision, to provide reasonable assurance that </P>
<P style="margin:0px; clear:left" align=justify><BR></P>
<P style="margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:-2px; text-indent:96px; width:144px; 
float:left">(i)</P>
<P style="margin:0px; padding-left:144px; text-indent:-2px" 
align=justify>material information relating to the issuer is made known to us by
others, particularly during the period in which the interim filings are being 
prepared; and</P>
<P style="margin:0px; clear:left" align=justify><BR></P>
<P style="margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:-2px; text-indent:96px; width:144px; 
float:left">(ii)</P>
<P style="margin:0px; padding-left:144px; text-indent:-2px" 
align=justify>information required to be disclosed by the issuer in its annual 
filings, interim filings or other reports filed or submitted by it under 
securities legislation is recorded, processed, summarized and reported within 
the time periods specified in securities legislation; and </P>
<P style="margin:0px; clear:left" align=justify><BR></P>
<P style="margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:-2px; text-indent:48px; width:96px; 
float:left">(b) </P>
<P style="margin:0px; padding-left:96px; text-indent:-2px" 
align=justify>designed ICFR, or caused it to be designed under our supervision, 
to provide reasonable assurance regarding the reliability of financial reporting
and the preparation of financial statements for external purposes in accordance 
with the issuer&#146;s GAAP.</P>
<P style="margin:0px; clear:left" align=justify><BR></P>
<P style="margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:-2px; width:48px; float:left">5.1</P>
<P style="margin:0px; padding-left:48px; text-indent:-2px" 
align=justify><B><I>Control framework:</I></B> &nbsp;The control framework the 
issuer&#146;s other certifying officer and I used to design the issuer&#146;s 
ICFR is based on Internal Control &#150; Integrated Framework issued by the 
Committee of Sponsoring Organizations of the Treadway Commission.<I> </I></P>
<P style="margin:0px; clear:left" align=justify><BR></P>
<P style="margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:-2px; width:48px; float:left">5.2</P>
<P style="margin:0px; padding-left:48px; text-indent:-2px" 
align=justify><B><I>ICFR &#150; material weakness relating to design: 
</I></B>N/A</P>
<P style="margin:0px; clear:left" align=justify><BR></P>
<P style="margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:-2px; width:48px; float:left">5.3</P>
<P style="margin:0px; padding-left:48px; text-indent:-2px" 
align=justify><B><I>Limitation on scope of design:</I></B> &nbsp;N/A</P>
<P style="margin:0px; clear:left" align=justify><BR></P>
<P style="margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:-2px; width:48px; float:left">6.</P>
<P style="margin:0px; padding-left:48px; text-indent:-2px" 
align=justify><B><I>Reporting changes in ICFR:</I> </B>The issuer has disclosed 
in its interim MD&amp;A any change in the issuer&#146;s ICFR that occurred 
during the period beginning on April 1, 2016 and ended on June 30, 2016 that has
materially affected, or is reasonably likely to materially affect, the 
issuer&#146;s ICFR. </P>
<P style="margin:0px; clear:left" align=justify><BR></P>
<P style="margin:0px" align=justify><B>Date: August 12, 2016</B></P>
<P style="margin:0px" align=justify><BR></P>
